commit_message:
Deprecate 'test' integration

No one in OpenStack should be using this command any more and it's
unlikely that anyone outside it is even using these. We don't want to
have to continue supporting this going forward so let's start the
deprecation process.

Change-Id: I51e8ebb0268ff7ec1e71d66ff59422fcc7377c4c
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate 'build_sphinx' integration

We now have a path away from this feature, so let's deprecate it while
we can.

Change-Id: Idfc34b9085c6da9b8cac24986be5f3bad142d927
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add Sphinx extension

This duplicates what already exists in openstackdocstheme but provides a
migration path for users outside of the OpenStack ecosystem.

Change-Id: I73750b3fe984f9d2f339aac0f435a83ee68c89da
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2018-07-20 16:54:08.000000000', 'message': 'Move heartbeat from utility_all to kibana

always be an OSA one by using the group "utility_all" as a deployment

nodes by default which corrects the previous assumption.

commit_message:
Move heartbeat from utility_all to kibana

The heartbeat probe was making an assumption that the deployment will
always be an OSA one by using the group "utility_all" as a deployment
target. This change moves heartbeat to the first kibana three kibana
nodes by default which corrects the previous assumption.

Change-Id: Ic1b90eb94dd20dc2273542333de47bfd690af1dd
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Use absolute paths in enable-designate environments
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-07-19 16:51:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-07-19 18:00:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-07-20 08:41:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

There should be a better solution perhaps? Abs paths do not fit well into custom --templates paradigm.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-07-20 08:44:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This will break for anyone working from a git checkout or copy of the templates - IMO all paths should always be relative (and also we need them to be relative inside the swift container anyway)'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-07-20 08:47:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Perhaps we should split the pool configuration from the resource_registry or something?

Note that in future this will be easier if we can use heat parameter_merge_strategies to simply append services to the *Services list, instead of disabling services via resource_registry mappings, slow progress on that though ref https://review.openstack.org/#/c/448209/ (Rabi has been helping to revive that though)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-07-20 16:44:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> Perhaps we should split the pool configuration from the
 > resource_registry or something?
 
That should work.  We did something similar for ssl because it had the same problem.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-07-20 22:00:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Split patch proposed at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584532'}]

[{'created': '2018-07-19 16:51:27.000000000', 'message': "Use absolute paths in enable-designate environments

Because the pool configuration needs to be modified for every
deployment, it isn't possible to use the environment files as-is.
Each deployment will need to make a copy of the file, and if they
put the copy in a different location then the relative paths won't
work.

Change-Id: I6aedc91e1f20e22019ffcc5b217fa02175be2531
"}, {'created': '2018-07-19 18:00:14.000000000', 'message': "Use absolute paths in enable-designate environments

Because the pool configuration needs to be modified for every
deployment, it isn't possible to use the environment files as-is.

Change-Id: I6aedc91e1f20e22019ffcc5b217fa02175be2531

commit_message:
Use absolute paths in enable-designate environments

Because the pool configuration needs to be modified for every
deployment, it isn't possible to use the environment files as-is.
Each deployment will need to make a copy of the file, and if they
put the copy in a different location then the relative paths won't
work.

Change-Id: I6aedc91e1f20e22019ffcc5b217fa02175be2531

Patch [1] added configuration of forward rule for trusted ports in

This patch fixes issue with many "duplicate iptables rule detected"

trusted port is updated.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525607/

commit_message:
Set trusted port only once in iptables firewall driver

Patch [1] added configuration of forward rule for trusted ports in
iptables firewall driver.

This patch fixes issue with many "duplicate iptables rule detected"
warning messages due to try to add such forward rule each time when
trusted port is updated.
Now such rule is added only once for port.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525607/

Change-Id: Ib816887f07f16b6ac865bb81d0f27f12d0b47dfb
Closes-Bug: #1754770
(cherry picked from commit 8be0c2a551fea0c02d757c6ad460f8435423ec32)

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Block revert to snapshot for replicated volumes

Attempting to restore a replicated volume to snapshot will result in an
error, as this operation requires the RDF relationship to be suspended
first. It would be safest to throw an exception and block this operation
on replicated volumes. The user could instead create a new volume from
the snapshot and attach that, instead of reverting the original volume.
This patch implements this change.

Change-Id: If7b1dc408375d724fdc9ce6a3e256ad37e7c946f
Closes-bug: 1777871

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-06 10:01:00.000000000', 'message': "Maintenance: Fix router ports

Prior to this patch the maintenance thread would fail to fix a router
port resource upon a failure in OVN to create it.

The maintence thread was calling the add_router_interface() method from
the l3_ovn.py module but, if the router port already existed in Neutron
(but didn't exist in OVN) that method would fail with a PortInUse
exception.

This patch accounts for that problem and if the port router already
exist in Neutron it will only fetch it from the database and continue
the work until it's created in the OVN database as well.

A new functional test has been added which to test this scenario.

Closes-Bug: #1746979
Change-Id: Iae500d17d0efe17f3460dc2f09356675d406abed

commit_message:
Maintenance: Fix router ports

Prior to this patch the maintenance thread would fail to fix a router
port resource upon a failure in OVN to create it.

The maintence thread was calling the add_router_interface() method from
the l3_ovn.py module but, if the router port already existed in Neutron
(but didn't exist in OVN) that method would fail with a PortInUse
exception.

This patch accounts for that problem and if the port router already
exist in Neutron it will only fetch it from the database and continue
the work until it's created in the OVN database as well.

A new functional test has been added which to test this scenario.

Closes-Bug: #1746979
Change-Id: Iae500d17d0efe17f3460dc2f09356675d406abed

commit_message:
sahara-extra is not a library

Sahara-extra contains Sahara components and tools not included
into the main Sahara repository, like the Swift filesystem
implementation for Hadoop, or the main function wrappers that
adapt for oozie and spark, as well as tools to help build those.

Change-Id: Ied40f1e901631ea8f00914a532ca7220c9593965

commit_message:
Remove reference to ntp package

This is motivated by the fact that:
* the ntp/chrony package is already a dependency of the ceph-mon/osd
package
* NTP will be managed by operators through the NTP charm
It is thus useless to keep that package mentioned here.

Change-Id: If6ecfc6f515bec4f955a5b52df8f0fbfafd29008
Closes-Bug: #1780690
Depends-on: Iddb7ffcc7ab7a74700855b950f619208511c2fab

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I865fa0f597adeb4caa4a93448e5a2af26064ddd5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-20 14:18:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix group read permissions

Recent changes in charms.openstack write configuration files
with perms 0640; however without a group attribute on the
client charm class, these will root.root owned.

Ensure that config files are written using root.designate for
this charm.

Change-Id: I5e680e7546ad66f087c1c15cd2db60428d50afb9
Closes-Bug: 1782644
'}]
commit_message:
Fix group read permissions

Recent changes in charms.openstack write configuration files
with perms 0640; however without a group attribute on the
client charm class, these will root.root owned.

Ensure that config files are written using root.designate for
this charm.

Change-Id: I5e680e7546ad66f087c1c15cd2db60428d50afb9
Closes-Bug: 1782644

commit_message:
Remove reference to ntp package

This is motivated by the fact that:
* the ntp/chrony package is already a dependency of the ceph-mon/osd
package
* NTP will be managed by operators through the NTP charm
It is thus useless to keep that package mentioned here.

Change-Id: I5834ff22d4306707529e958cd26f14bbb752c796
Closes-Bug: #1780690
Depends-on: Iddb7ffcc7ab7a74700855b950f619208511c2fab

commit_message:
Additions:
    Cluster Membership checks: checks to see if other pods of kuryr controllers are still running
    Hash Ring: The hash ring has been added to the kuryr-controller, and crude logic to resize the
                ring when membership has changed is now working

Change-Id: Iff53a49dcb6db196a4e20f639e735398b14a7eec
Signed-off-by: Emilio Garcia <egarcia@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove testrepository

This commit is a follow-up of "switch to using stestr"
which was merged already [1].
After switch to using stestr, testrepository is unnecessary
and should be removed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571471

Change-Id: I58c8c5e5ee9c6fded649dd83ee10d9364454ae82

commit_message:
Enable some off-by-default checks

Some of the available checks are disabled by default, like:
[H106] Dont put vim configuration in source files
[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

Change-Id: I815f189258356cb911d1e232b6f53c864e53c602

commit_message:
Force ceilometermiddleware 1.3.0 release

There were a couple CI related commits since last cycle
that we should tag before branching so they do not need
to be backported.

commit_message:
Support binding_deactivate in CacheBackedPluginApi

CacheBackedPluginApi enables the neutron server to push resources
updates to L2 agents. The agents retrieve the resources updates locally
from the cache implemented by it. CacheBackedPluginApi also emulates
server notifications to the agents, such as port_delete or port_update,
based on the updated data received by the cache. This commit adds code
to CacheBackedPluginApi to implement a binding_deactivate notification
from the server to the agents

Change-Id: I023ccbd405bc41379007d87a9c1051970aa8d603
Partial-Bug: #1580880

commit_message:
Match neutron's version of hacking, flake8 ignores

The neutron project bumped its hacking level in test-requirements via
Ia7c7c5a44727f615a151e1e68dd94c7ed42f974f, causing a conflict with ours.

Make our pep8 pass by adding an ignore rule for W504 (line break after
binary operator) to match neutron.

Change-Id: Ifb9583437edba41addff5d3650b350a8941d3150

commit_message:
Remove reference to ntp package

This is motivated by the fact that:
* the ntp/chrony package is already a dependency of the ceph-mon/osd
package
* NTP will be managed by operators through the NTP charm
It is thus useless to keep that package mentioned here.

Change-Id: Iddb7ffcc7ab7a74700855b950f619208511c2fab
Closes-Bug: #1780690

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 22:00:08.000000000', 'message': "[CI] Don't set test config for API microversions if master

If the version's being bumped on manila,
the newer API changes cause test failures with
manila-tempest-plugin.

We could carefully craft a
manila-tempest-plugin changeset that fixes
any incongruous test assumptions and make the
manila change depend on the tempest changeset.
However, that may make developing the API harder
than it is today.

Change-Id: Ie97fb49b38b565dcc57332db8b42605216372aa8
Related-Bug: #1781671
"}, {'created': '2018-07-20 18:42:34.000000000', 'message': "[CI] Don't set test config for API microversions if master

If the version's being bumped on manila,
the newer API changes cause test failures with
manila-tempest-plugin.

We could carefully craft a
manila-tempest-plugin changeset that fixes
any incongruous test assumptions and make the
manila change depend on the tempest changeset.
However, that may make developing the API harder
than it is today.

Change-Id: Ie97fb49b38b565dcc57332db8b42605216372aa8
Related-Bug: #1781671
(cherry picked from commit ed95238da9fca293165a5025f486f37c0be3149c)
"}]
commit_message:
[CI] Don't set test config for API microversions if master

If the version's being bumped on manila,
the newer API changes cause test failures with
manila-tempest-plugin.

We could carefully craft a
manila-tempest-plugin changeset that fixes
any incongruous test assumptions and make the
manila change depend on the tempest changeset.
However, that may make developing the API harder
than it is today.

Change-Id: Ie97fb49b38b565dcc57332db8b42605216372aa8
Related-Bug: #1781671
(cherry picked from commit ed95238da9fca293165a5025f486f37c0be3149c)

commit_message:
Skip provider_networks module if possible

If the deployer is setting its own neutron_provider_networks, there
is no need to force running the provider_networks module. We can
pass the variables directly to neutron, like we do in the role
testing.

Change-Id: I31ec312f7f023e7bc8e96072ebe55915e8970aef

commit_message:
Update get-pip to version 3.3

Version 3.2 has a bug with it on some systems that can result in the
following stacktrace: [ http://paste.openstack.org/show/726064 ]. To
correct this issue the version of the get-pip script has been set to 3.3
which does not suffer from the same issue.

Change-Id: I61a7234dc4fbde1b9319874d82fe33578f490abc
Partial-Bug: 1779534
(cherry picked from commit 184dbb8e18973a8baf69d203c0b159367cb1ff8e)

commit_message:
Update get-pip to version 3.3

Version 3.2 has a bug with it on some systems that can result in the
following stacktrace: [ http://paste.openstack.org/show/726064 ]. To
correct this issue the version of the get-pip script has been set to 3.3
which does not suffer from the same issue.

Change-Id: I61a7234dc4fbde1b9319874d82fe33578f490abc
Partial-Bug: 1779534
(cherry picked from commit 184dbb8e18973a8baf69d203c0b159367cb1ff8e)

commit_message:
Use the provider network for router id

The router id for the dragent must be on the provider network. The
charm was using the BGP speaker_ip which is only used for related
test services. (i.e. quagga).

This change guarantees the router id uses the provider extra binding
IP.

It also sets the group ownership to neutron for rendered config files.

Closes-Bug: #1782433
Partial-Bug: #1782444
Change-Id: I4761b4c5b80a398e13e4cdf880b773df489f53b9

commit_message:
Pass extra parameters to ansible on start-migration

This is very helpful during development to, for example
run only specific tags you're developing, while still
retaining all the configuration options.

Change-Id: Ic61638451b207efa7bf9ef1a2259b6a02f360e6b

commit_message:
Clean packethost floating IPs

This instructs nodepool to clean up unattached floating IPs. This will
clean up leaked floating IPs.

Change-Id: Id7411fe975bf1a15db66916755c90e082f17d11d

commit_message:
Fix group permissions for bind access

Ensure generated configuration files are readable by the bind
user (required due to switch in default permissions to 0640
in charms.openstack).

Change-Id: I88bf4e93ea07621bda8c87f0f98f1c438bfe2be4
Closes-Bug: 1782640

@Eric this result in the correct amount of quota being consumed.
The logic is like this:  I created a volume and three snapshots,  so the volume_quota +1 and snapshot_quota +3 in my project.  Then I transfer the volume and snapshots to you and you accept them.  So your volume_quota +1 and snapshot_quota+3,  my volume_quota -1 and snapshot_quota -3.   That is it.   I think maybe we have some misunderstanding here,  I didn't add the snapshot size into volume quota when I calculate the snapshot quota, just name a arg 'volume_sizes' for snapshot size. This feature will change Cinder to transfer
snapshots with volumes at the same time by default.
If user doesn't want to transfer snapshots, they could use
a new optional argument '--no-snapshots'.
And we also introduce the new V3 api 'v3/volume_transfers'
to move this API out of contrib into Cinder V3 API.

Change-Id: If848d131e5edcdb77d0b3c2ca45a99c4d5e14d1e

commit_message:
Transfer snapshots with volumes

This feature changes Cinder to transfer
snapshots with volumes at the same time by default.
If user doesn't want to transfer snapshots, they could use
a new optional argument '--no-snapshots' after microversion 3.55.
And we also introduce the new V3 api 'v3/volume_transfers'
to move this API out of contrib into Cinder V3 API.

The cinderclient patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577611/

Change-Id: If848d131e5edcdb77d0b3c2ca45a99c4d5e14d1e
Implements: blueprint transfer-snps-with-vols

commit_message:
Revert "Add a get_nested filter"

This reverts commit 80a1262252db951e40749d37f5348aa8907039c6
because we're not using it, and using json_query is simple enough.

Change-Id: I8d5fba867eceb6892a7a995a9b86153e88353480

commit_message:
Remove syslinux usage

Turns out we wer never using syslinux, and we don't need it
since we directly invoke ipxe.

Change-Id: Ibe6b62046efb58c085fa63eaed2ff98c6d8ecabd
Story: #2002934
Task: #22921

commit_message:
Switch from ostestr to stestr

os-testr has moved over to use stestr instead of testr. This change
updates the tox.ini file to call stestr directly instead of going
through ostestr and remove testrepository from test-requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I31fa5fefd610ec783471e15992675bd39ff0ebc4

are also corrected.

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1], stestr is maintained project
to which all Openstack projects should migrate. Let's switch to stestr
as other projects have already moved to it.

While we're at it, we also fix the docs requirements and removed the
unused 'pypy' and 'cover' tox targets.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I424068adc9092be2cf40d117c9dc4e92bb51e804
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ic189fc2d55534557029fec4150f7a7f3c9562d6e
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Updated to use a separate image cache for direct deploy interface, so that we won't mess up with iscsi driver.

The symbolic link is removed for now, as Julia points out there would be privilege issue (though I don't hit in my environment)."}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-02-09 06:47:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-04-04 08:42:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-04-04 08:49:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

I think we can't handle privilege issues by ironic alone, it involves many things in real deployment, more than this spec can cover.
Have reverted the idea of creating another cache for direct interface, and restored the idea of symlink.
The spec looks like a mess, though the general idea is here.
Will do an update later, W-1 until then."}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-04-09 08:38:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-04-09 09:27:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-04-09 20:44:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(11 comments)

Thank you Julia, I'm afraid some comments are beyond my knowledge, I hope most of them can be addressed."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-01 14:18:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-07-20 16:32:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)

I really like this idea, thanks!'}]

commit_message:
The direct deploy interface provisioning with HTTP server

This spec proposes a mechanism to provision baremetal nodes by hosting custom
HTTP service as an image source provider to ``direct`` deploy interface, when
the Image service is utilized.

Story: #1598852
Task: #10474

Change-Id: If765b985e26ce776f065b2ca44a2f406ac27523d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 17:04:07.000000000', 'message': "Make certificate generation host configurable

We do not necessarily always want to use the deployment
host for certificate generation. This patch allows the
deployer to set an alternative host to delegate these
tasks to in the same pattern as has been done for the
service registration tasks.

Additionally, due to the way this is done we can also:

1. Remove the task to install pyOpenSSL, because it is
   already in the Ansible runtime venv for both role
   tests and the integrated build. We have set the
   python interpreter correctly to ensure that we have
   access to it.

2. Consolidate the 'install' and 'config' tasks into
   a single task file. Given that most of the 'install'
   tasks were doing runtime configuration, it seems best
   to rather move them into a single file and use the
   'config' tag.

Change-Id: If2f1ab03ccd9400fe05e2948ddfe33c8796dbd97

commit_message:
Make certificate generation host configurable

We do not necessarily always want to use the deployment
host for certificate generation. This patch allows the
deployer to set an alternative host to delegate these
tasks to in the same pattern as has been done for the
service registration tasks.

Additionally, due to the way this is done we can also:

1. Remove the task to install pyOpenSSL, because it is
   already in the Ansible runtime venv for both role
   tests and the integrated build. We have set the
   python interpreter correctly to ensure that we have
   access to it.

2. Consolidate the 'install' and 'config' tasks into
   a single task file. Given that most of the 'install'
   tasks were doing runtime configuration, it seems best
   to rather move them into a single file and use the
   'config' tag.

Change-Id: If2f1ab03ccd9400fe05e2948ddfe33c8796dbd97

[{'created': '2018-07-02 17:12:51.000000000', 'message': 'Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters replace
the rabbitmq values and aure used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be transparent
to the magnum service.

* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Add transport_url generation to conf template
* Add oslo.messaging to tests inventory
* Update tests
* Update examples
* Add release note

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters replace
the rabbitmq values and aure used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be transparent
to the magnum service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Add transport_url generation to conf template
* Add oslo.messaging to tests inventory
* Update tests
* Update examples
* Add release note

Change-Id: Ib44af3b1d153742975351a321d65c8812a994370

commit_message:
Remove table 17 from OVS OF pipeline sync

OpenFlow flows for table 17 now only appear after a port is created and
there is no longer a default flow during the deploy stage. Therefore
remove the check for table 17 existing during deployment.

Closes-Bug: 1781616

Change-Id: Ie988ba6a2d444a614e97c0edf5fce24b23970310
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 463d3f3a636de7ccb12a207b0407ba3fb7554d7e)

commit_message:
Updates OpenDaylight healthcheck URI

The new URI is more accurate and only supported as of ODL version
Fluorine.

Closes-Bug: 1779215

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 21:07:52.000000000', 'message': "Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- nova_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- nova_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I5732550bb2a0c5da4a2bf3f7ea8c89ed701dba31

commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- nova_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- nova_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I5732550bb2a0c5da4a2bf3f7ea8c89ed701dba31

subject: Switch compute to use different inventory_hostname
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-19 18:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-19 18:06:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-19 18:14:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-20 11:33:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-20 14:44:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-20 14:47:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 18:03:15.000000000', 'message': "Switch compute to use different inventory_hostname

Our role tests execute as non-root users, and the roles
need to access the environment variables for that non-root
user. Ansible, when targeting localhost, changes to
'connection: local' and thus breaks everything we need
to do against localhost as root unless we use 'become: true',
but we if generally use that against remote hosts we lose
the environment variables for the non-root user.

As such, we switch the inventory to target 'compute1' instead,
which has the address '127.0.0.1', so that we do not have to
deal with the implict connection type changes implemented by
Ansible.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584033
Change-Id: I6e6f586844f4945ebbeffe17da4cd16083d43771

commit_message:
Switch compute to use different inventory_hostname

Our role tests execute as non-root users, and the roles
need to access the environment variables for that non-root
user. Ansible, when targeting localhost, changes to
'connection: local' and thus breaks everything we need
to do against localhost as root unless we use 'become: true',
but we if generally use that against remote hosts we lose
the environment variables for the non-root user.

As such, we switch the inventory to target 'compute1' instead,
which has the address '10.1.1.1' (br-mgmt), so that we do not
have to deal with the implict connection type changes implemented
by Ansible.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584033
Change-Id: I6e6f586844f4945ebbeffe17da4cd16083d43771

commit_message:
Update get-pip to version 3.3

Version 3.2 has a bug with it on some systems that can result in the
following stacktrace: [ http://paste.openstack.org/show/726064 ]. To
correct this issue the version of the get-pip script has been set to 3.3
which does not suffer from the same issue.

Change-Id: Ib551c8627351ba23d3c1a67a9631f58fdd2157a7
(cherry picked from commit 178506f624b37db1fd899deff9b1e64aba82fa38)

subject: Update qgroup setup to be more explicit
messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-19 21:41:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-20 00:01:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-20 15:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 21:41:55.000000000', 'message': 'Update qgroup setup to be more explicit

The default qgroup setup was setting the qgroup limits to none which
allows the system to dynamical expand or contract. While this works
there can be a lag between the time it takes to grow vs the time it
takes to hit the limit. This change sets the limits accordingly should a
deployer not have a container specific limit set already.

Change-Id: Iea2498bfe1c391f4b4bee295c8f04b2655f404d9
'}]
commit_message:
Update qgroup setup to be more explicit

The default qgroup setup was setting the qgroup limits to none which
allows the system to dynamical expand or contract. While this works
there can be a lag between the time it takes to grow vs the time it
takes to hit the limit. This change sets the limits accordingly should a
deployer not have a container specific limit set already.

Change-Id: Iea2498bfe1c391f4b4bee295c8f04b2655f404d9

nit: ironic-inspector would never have worked in a multinode environment.'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-04-10 16:02:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-04-10 17:13:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Old commit message seemed ok...'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-04-10 18:25:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-04-10 18:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-04-11 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

this patch fixed one issue, but it also change the original deploy arch, which ignore other hosts in ironic-inspector groups.

There is a case that use deploy multi ironic-inspector(with patch) and first node is failure for some reason, then he may be confused that why haproxy only use first node? he can not get a anwser until he find this patch.

on the other hand, should we warning or even failed when there are multi node in inspector groups?'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-04-11 08:14:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> this patch fixed one issue, but it also change the original deploy
 > arch, which ignore other hosts in ironic-inspector groups.
 > 
 > There is a case that use deploy multi ironic-inspector(with patch)
 > and first node is failure for some reason, then he may be confused
 > that why haproxy only use first node? he can not get a anwser until
 > he find this patch.
 > 
 > on the other hand, should we warning or even failed when there are
 > multi node in inspector groups?

It's an interesting point about warning (hard in ansible) or failing if there are multiple nodes in the inspector group. This would prevent the user from using the upstream multinode inventory without modifying the ironic-inspector group. OTOH, it is more explicit and less magic.

To add a third option to the mix - a new variable, enable_ironic_inspector_ha, that controls the scale of the inspector service. This would be a bit weird as HA isn't supported yet, but would be more explicit while also supporting the standard multinode inventory.

For reference, here's the inspector HA story: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/1525218."}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-04-17 10:13:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

How about:

* Update the inspector group to just contain one node
* Add a precheck to fail if there's any more
* Leave the deploy task and haproxy untouched

Then when Ironic finish the HA support all we need to do is revert this change. What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-04-17 11:10:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> How about:
 > 
 > * Update the inspector group to just contain one node
 > * Add a precheck to fail if there's any more
 > * Leave the deploy task and haproxy untouched
 > 
 > Then when Ironic finish the HA support all we need to do is revert
 > this change. What do you think?

I don't think there's a way to add a single node to a group using e.g.

[ironic-inspector]
control[0]

Perhaps there is another way?

In the ironic meeting yesterday they said that HA is supposed to be complete, but not widely tested or used, and may have some race issues. The developer (milan) is no longer on the project."}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-04-19 11:11:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-04-19 11:13:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Seems like there's a variety of ways this could be addressed. Right now I value having it fixed over getting fancy or trying to preempt when it may be fixed upstream in Ironic. Have added a release note to make things clear, operators who value their setups will read this and can take appropriate precautions."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-04-19 11:25:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

> Seems like there's a variety of ways this could be addressed. Right
 > now I value having it fixed over getting fancy or trying to preempt
 > when it may be fixed upstream in Ironic. Have added a release note
 > to make things clear, operators who value their setups will read
 > this and can take appropriate precautions.

Works for me. This change can be backported then reverted or made optional on master when we're confident about inspector HA."}, {'account_id': 28003, 'date': '2018-04-20 01:39:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-04-30 11:59:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 21691, 'date': '2018-04-30 13:39:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

LGTM, thanks Paul'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-05-01 08:43:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-05-02 06:56:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

how about use active-backup for ironic-inspector in haproxy? just like mariadb backend does?'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-05-02 08:17:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> how about use active-backup for ironic-inspector in haproxy? just
 > like mariadb backend does?

There needs to be some HA support in the application. MariaDB uses Galera for replication. Inspector does not have support for active/backup as far as I'm aware.

Inspector HA needs verification, but at that point we can use it - and it should be active/active."}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2018-07-20 15:43:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

If someone else wants to pick this up feel free to reopen'}]

commit_message:
Ironic inspector/dnsmasq can run on only one host

Ironic inspector does not currently support scaling out to multiple
hosts. Support for this is under development. Until then, ironic
inspector should be limited to running only on a single host.

The same applies to the ironic_dnsmasq container - this should only run
on a single host. Running the ironic_dnsmasq container on multiple hosts
could lead to issues as multiple DHCP servers will use a single address
pool.

Change-Id: I3e515e3530f08be8ea6851e49b7c4ea7ee836e78
Closes-Bug: #1761788

commit_message:
Update get-pip to version 3.3

Version 3.2 has a bug with it on some systems that can result in the
following stacktrace: [ http://paste.openstack.org/show/726064 ]. To
correct this issue the version of the get-pip script has been set to 3.3
which does not suffer from the same issue.

Change-Id: Ib551c8627351ba23d3c1a67a9631f58fdd2157a7
(cherry picked from commit 178506f624b37db1fd899deff9b1e64aba82fa38)

commit_message:
Install openvswitch packages on 'ml2.ovs.dvr' configuration

The 'neutron_package_list' is extended when 'neutron_needs_openvswitch'
is true. Which needs neutron_services['neutron-openvswitch-agent'].service_en
to be true. Which it is only for 'ml2.ovs' and not 'ml2.ovs.dvr'.

Change-Id: I6a4f597377e711508f26b142d7184cfd08b3ffaa
(cherry picked from commit 38884cb091f1908650daaf4e35681a5c2f51adbd)

commit_message:
Enable deep_compare of pcmk resources by default

By settings these hiera keys we will actually do a deep comparison
of all pacemaker resources and update them accordingly.

This means that rerunning a deploy against an existing overcloud
will actually detect if a pacemaker resource needs updating and
will update the definition and restart of said resource. The code
will wait for the resource to be up (aka the cluster to settle
after an update).

Depends-On: I62d5662327333e17e1c32a029695b3d3a904ca10

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be

- gate-python-heatclient-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/13/435213/3/check/gate-python-heatclient-python27-ubuntu-xenial/c4d3573/ : SUCCESS in 2m 47s
- gate-heatclient-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/13/435213/3/check/gate-heatclient-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial/d904a26/ : SUCCESS in 18m 24s'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2017-05-17 09:21:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2017-05-19 07:56:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Can you please elaborate on the need to use the --include-pass when using keystone sessions? AFAIK there would be X-Auth-Token in header. 

I think  you should osc cli and not heat cli which is deprecated. Though the bug report is correct, this change does not seem correct to me at this point.

We should get rid of httpclient like nova and other projects.

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-novaclient/tree/novaclient/client.py#n164'}, {'account_id': 20963, 'date': '2017-05-21 13:16:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Rabi, Thanks for the feedback

This --include-password is necessary for including credential headers which are required for deferred_auth 'password' method in heat. I know that we can now use 'trust' authentication but we are still stuck with using the old password authentication and hence need this fix. (Same goes for using osc vs heatclient, Hopefully we will move to osc someday :) )

I agree on the point of moving away from these httpclient but at this point a bug fix would be better to patch this issue here. (Replacing httpclient can be discussed as a bp later)"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2017-05-22 04:22:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I know that we can now use 'trust' authentication but we are still stuck with using the old password authentication and hence need this fix.

OK. But AFAIK 'password' deferred_auth would not work with keystone v3, as it would expect domain details to authenticate the user when using stored context and we don't store the domain information in user_creds.

Therefore I would think, it would be better you move to use trusts and we remove the 'deferred_auth=password' option completely."}, {'account_id': 20963, 'date': '2017-06-13 00:11:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think the deferred_auth=password works fine with keystone v3 and is a supported feature for heat.

But yeah if you think this patch is not needed then lets cancel this.

As for the removal of deferred_auth=password this should be added as a new blueprint I guess because removing it might be a big change.
Thanks'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-05-07 11:34:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi as we now migrated from Launchpad to StoryBoard ( https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/project_group/82 ), we needs to link from your patch to StoryBoard, as for how to provide the link, please reference `How to connect from gerrit to StoryBoard` section in https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Heat-StoryBoard-Migration-Info
Please help to add those keys to your commit message. Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-07-20 15:30:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-17 03:41:04.000000000', 'message': "Add include credentials support in SessionClient

http._construct_http_client returns two kinds of clients, HTTPClient if
session not provided and SessionClient if session is provided. By
default heat creates a session from user credentials so SessionClient
is returned by this method most of the time. However the SessionClient
doesn't include credentials or include_pass key. Hence even if the user
passes '--include_pass' in heat call for eg.
`heat --include_pass stack-create -f template.yaml stack1`
the credentials were not being pass in request headers. A workaround
for this was to manually pass --os-auth-token and --os-no-client-auth
which forces creation of HTTPClient by _construct_http_client which
supports include_pass

To resolve this, Update the _construct_http_client to include
credentials params in SessionClient and implement credentials_headers
logic in SessionClient to pass credentials in headers.
SessionClient __init__ is overridden to pop out these credentials
before calling super so we don't break legacy code.

Change-Id: I6bc841b78e6121f2daae89a10061c40b6c5022fb
Closes-Bug: #1665321
"}, {'created': '2017-02-17 05:07:31.000000000', 'message': "Add include credentials support in SessionClient

commit_message:
Add include credentials support in SessionClient

http._construct_http_client returns two kinds of clients, HTTPClient if
session not provided and SessionClient if session is provided. By
default heat creates a session from user credentials so SessionClient
is returned by this method most of the time. However the SessionClient
doesn't include credentials or include_pass key. Hence even if the user
passes '--include_pass' in heat call for eg.
`heat --include_pass stack-create -f template.yaml stack1`
the credentials were not being pass in request headers. A workaround
for this was to manually pass --os-auth-token and --os-no-client-auth
which forces creation of HTTPClient by _construct_http_client which
supports include_pass

To resolve this, Update the _construct_http_client to include
credentials params in SessionClient and implement credentials_headers
logic in SessionClient to pass credentials in headers.
SessionClient __init__ is overridden to pop out these credentials
before calling super so we don't break legacy code.

Change-Id: I6bc841b78e6121f2daae89a10061c40b6c5022fb
Closes-Bug: #1665321

[{'created': '2018-07-19 20:45:33.000000000', 'message': 'Update get-pip to version 3.3

Version 3.2 has a bug with it on some systems that can result in the
following stacktrace: [ http://paste.openstack.org/show/726064 ]. To
correct this issue the version of the get-pip script has been set to 3.3
which does not suffer from the same issue.

Change-Id: Iaa824cc64bd0e8bdfdda4de243d80400f1529e8c
Closes-Bug: #1779534
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 79063a3e10ba733ea50a404627570c6a21bebd83)
'}]
commit_message:
Update get-pip to version 3.3

Version 3.2 has a bug with it on some systems that can result in the
following stacktrace: [ http://paste.openstack.org/show/726064 ]. To
correct this issue the version of the get-pip script has been set to 3.3
which does not suffer from the same issue.

Change-Id: Iaa824cc64bd0e8bdfdda4de243d80400f1529e8c
Closes-Bug: #1779534
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 79063a3e10ba733ea50a404627570c6a21bebd83)

Elod, some bad news here, :(

We have to backport another two pathes to get the checking jobs passing:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550768/
(for mariadbdb-multi, as promoting one replica to master will fail)

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569405/
(for mysql related jobs, as restoring from backup will fail)

For postgres and redis:
* the postgres sinle non-dynamic test failure also is one of the known issue:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547945/

* the redis root API related failures are fixed by:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/549174/
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/549206/
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/549255/

The jobs of postgres and redis are non-voting, and the fixes are mostly for the tests themselves, so we could ignore those patches at this time. However the patches for mariadb and mysql are necessary, so we have to squash the theses three patches into one patch to make things work.

Elod, would you help to finish this, it'll be really appriatiated."}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2018-07-09 16:17:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2018-07-09 16:30:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

[{'created': '2018-07-06 09:04:57.000000000', 'message': "Use neutronclient for floatingip operations

As add_floating_ip and remove_floating_ip were removed from novaclient,
migrating to neutronclient for floatingip operations.

This is the first patch for fixing unittests. As integration tests
didn't fail, floatingip operations are not covered there, so it may be
necessary to add new scenario tests for this in following patches.

NOTE(elod.illes): this backport is necessary due to nova client
constraint update [1] otherwise (periodic stable) jobs in queens fails
in stable/queens

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571540/

Change-Id: Ic41f5898db77a09158e0f8bfa4196bdb5e40b49a
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9209d0bf896c8b7c717e072317794f0b141306fc)
"}, {'created': '2018-07-09 16:17:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix zuul check jobs

This patch is a squash of three commits that is needed to have
a successful zuul run:

1. Use neutronclient for floatingip operations

As add_floating_ip and remove_floating_ip were removed from novaclient,
migrating to neutronclient for floatingip operations.

This is the first patch for fixing unittests. As integration tests
didn't fail, floatingip operations are not covered there, so it may be
necessary to add new scenario tests for this in following patches.

NOTE(elod.illes): this backport is necessary due to nova client
constraint update [1] otherwise (periodic stable) jobs in queens fails
in stable/queens

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571540/

Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

2. Avoid diverged slave when migrating MariaDB master

When promoting one slave to the new master in a replication group,
previously the old master will be attached to the new one right after
the new master is on. For MariaDB, attaching the old master to the new
one, new GTID may be created on the old master and also may be synced
to some of the other replicas, as they're still connecting to the old
master. The new GTID does not exists in the new master, making these
slaves diverged from the master. After that, when the diverged slave
connects to the new master, 'START SLAVE' will fail with logs like:

    [ERROR] Error reading packet from server: Error: connecting slave
    requested to start from GTID X-XXXXXXXXXX-XX, which is not in the
    master's binlog. Since the master's binlog contains GTIDs with
    higher sequence numbers, it probably means that the slave has
    diverged due to executing extra erroneous transactions
    (server_errno=1236)

And these slaves will be left orphan and errored after
promote_to_replica_source finishs.

Attaching the other replicas to the new master before dealing with the
old master will fix this problem and the failure of the
trove-scenario-mariadb-multi Zuul job as well.

Closes-Bug: #1754539
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

3. Add a hook for restore process to check if successful

1.This is the same solution with the backup process. Previously we only
check the stderr of the restore command, but this method is not
reliable, and the changes during percona-xtrabackup 2.4.11:
https://jira.percona.com/browse/PXB-1542
causes the gate jobs failed in creating a slave MySQL instance.

The new hook currently is only used by InnoBackupEx restore runner with
checking the exit status and stderr output of xbstream.

2.with[1] merged,this makes DIB_CLOUD_IMAGES more flexible, but it
break trovestack build image, now we need to specify a more
detailed path to DIB_CLOUD_IMAGES to get the appropriate content.

[1]:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568697/

Co-Authored-By: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: zhanggang <zhanggang@cmss.chinamobile.com>
Co-Authored-By: jiansong <jian.song@easystack.cn>

Closes-Bug: #1771990

Change-Id: Ic41f5898db77a09158e0f8bfa4196bdb5e40b49a
(cherry picked from commit 9209d0bf896c8b7c717e072317794f0b141306fc)
(cherry picked from commit 5895cf0ee99022e2910ec8c72393fe998f5860f8)
(cherry picked from commit 43b5807f2d7fe417712226062df8e2f366fff801)

commit_message:
Fix zuul check jobs

This patch is a squash of three commits that is needed to have
a successful zuul run:

1. Use neutronclient for floatingip operations

As add_floating_ip and remove_floating_ip were removed from novaclient,
migrating to neutronclient for floatingip operations.

This is the first patch for fixing unittests. As integration tests
didn't fail, floatingip operations are not covered there, so it may be
necessary to add new scenario tests for this in following patches.

NOTE(elod.illes): this backport is necessary due to nova client
constraint update [1] otherwise (periodic stable) jobs in queens fails
in stable/queens

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571540/

Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

2. Avoid diverged slave when migrating MariaDB master

When promoting one slave to the new master in a replication group,
previously the old master will be attached to the new one right after
the new master is on. For MariaDB, attaching the old master to the new
one, new GTID may be created on the old master and also may be synced
to some of the other replicas, as they're still connecting to the old
master. The new GTID does not exists in the new master, making these
slaves diverged from the master. After that, when the diverged slave
connects to the new master, 'START SLAVE' will fail with logs like:

    [ERROR] Error reading packet from server: Error: connecting slave
    requested to start from GTID X-XXXXXXXXXX-XX, which is not in the
    master's binlog. Since the master's binlog contains GTIDs with
    higher sequence numbers, it probably means that the slave has
    diverged due to executing extra erroneous transactions
    (server_errno=1236)

And these slaves will be left orphan and errored after
promote_to_replica_source finishs.

Attaching the other replicas to the new master before dealing with the
old master will fix this problem and the failure of the
trove-scenario-mariadb-multi Zuul job as well.

Closes-Bug: #1754539
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

3. Add a hook for restore process to check if successful

1.This is the same solution with the backup process. Previously we only
check the stderr of the restore command, but this method is not
reliable, and the changes during percona-xtrabackup 2.4.11:
https://jira.percona.com/browse/PXB-1542
causes the gate jobs failed in creating a slave MySQL instance.

The new hook currently is only used by InnoBackupEx restore runner with
checking the exit status and stderr output of xbstream.

NOTE(elod.illes): The following part is not backported because [1] is
not backported either:
2.with[1] merged,this makes DIB_CLOUD_IMAGES more flexible, but it
break trovestack build image, now we need to specify a more
detailed path to DIB_CLOUD_IMAGES to get the appropriate content.

[1]:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568697/

Co-Authored-By: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: zhanggang <zhanggang@cmss.chinamobile.com>
Co-Authored-By: jiansong <jian.song@easystack.cn>

Closes-Bug: #1771990

Change-Id: Ic41f5898db77a09158e0f8bfa4196bdb5e40b49a
(cherry picked from commit 9209d0bf896c8b7c717e072317794f0b141306fc)
(cherry picked from commit 5895cf0ee99022e2910ec8c72393fe998f5860f8)
(cherry picked from commit 43b5807f2d7fe417712226062df8e2f366fff801)

commit_message:
tasks: repo_build_wheels: Download get-pip.py if it does not exist

/opt/get-pip.py may not exist if the host uses the distribution
python-pip package. As such, we need to check if the file exists
and download it if it's missing before trying to copy it to the
repo build directory.

This is a combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/570601
- https://review.openstack.org/572422
- https://review.openstack.org/580409
- https://review.openstack.org/583331

Related-Review: https://review.openstack.org/583925
Related-Bug: #1779534
Related-Bug: #1782051
Change-Id: I693b930bf337fd08931d835d57ffe9ecae904517
(cherry picked from commit ea4f8606df8a19edf5aa958a866f77ccafa62e47)

messages:
[{'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-07-20 07:39:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-07-20 11:54:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Good catch. Wow, I cannot believe we never exposed it Oo'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-07-20 11:55:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-07-20 11:59:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Sorry for changing my vote. Jim has reminded me that we already have this exposed in a bit different way. Since instance_uuid is unique, we do

 openstack baremetal node show --instance <instance>

and ironic.node.get_by_instance_uuid'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-07-20 12:48:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes, they are using different endpoints, my thought is instance uuid is returned with or without node detail, this change makes ``baremetal node list`` support querying by instance, that may save some overhead.

I'm fine if we decide keeping one :)"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-07-20 14:22:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Something like

 openstack baremetal node show --instance <instance> --fields uuid name provision_state maintenance

I get your point, but we don't provide --uuid or --name arguments for the list command."}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-07-20 15:11:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Because of the uniqueness of instance id, I think keeping the /v1/nodes/detail is fine, abandoning this change.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-07-20 15:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Query node by instance uuid

This patch adds supports to ironicclient to query node by instance
uuid, which is already supported by ironic.

Change-Id: If1e213e5d7fc6cebb13fabb0f3f0601399fcb2ba
Story: #2003046
Task: #23083

commit_message:
Limit to the previous spec-cleaner release

spec-cleaner was recently dropped from the global requirements
constraints file in I5c8c1926d7ce3f812ad80e5435f19ced601aae13
so we need to limit it ourselves now

Change-Id: Ieeb36a8b79c54fe1b653b0dc95229957734a48a6

commit_message:
Limit to the previous spec-cleaner release

spec-cleaner was recently dropped from the global requirements
constraints file in I5c8c1926d7ce3f812ad80e5435f19ced601aae13
so we need to limit it ourselves now

Change-Id: Ieeb36a8b79c54fe1b653b0dc95229957734a48a6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 14:25:16.000000000', 'message': 'Generate a unique machine-id

The systemd machine-id needs to be unique on all network attached
devices. This change ensures that when a container comes online, a
unique machine-id is generated if one was not already present. When
the machine-id is created for the first time the container will restart
so the new ID can take effect.

More information on the machine-id can be found here:
https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/machine-id.html

Change-Id: Ib25aeeecf1e6001e6c6b1a7d6b6d50eca7ab45fa
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 01fc5fa64316993d5ae2eb9b37cc9afc2566cc5f)
'}]
commit_message:
Generate a unique machine-id

The systemd machine-id needs to be unique on all network attached
devices. This change ensures that when a container comes online, a
unique machine-id is generated if one was not already present. When
the machine-id is created for the first time the container will restart
so the new ID can take effect.

More information on the machine-id can be found here:
https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/machine-id.html

Change-Id: Ib25aeeecf1e6001e6c6b1a7d6b6d50eca7ab45fa
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 01fc5fa64316993d5ae2eb9b37cc9afc2566cc5f)

commit_message:
Add --xattrs to sudoers.

Depending on the environment permissions
the backup creation can fail.

This submission allows using sudo with xattrs
when creating the backup tarball.

Change-Id: I1f52b7fbaf6b20a064ab773c6c984db5846e33ec
resolves: rhbz#1594279
Closes-bug:1782341

commit_message:
Read featureset variable as string value

featureset must be string as it composes the config file to be
loaded by the job. Reading it as a number results in unexpected
value.

Change-Id: I628936e95febc506e9ba6fb752f89b1cecf6f32c

[{'created': '2018-04-16 10:50:39.000000000', 'message': 'Add simple storage

It adds the simple storage resource of Redfish standard schema.

directly-attached devices.

commit_message:
Add system simple storage resource support

Adds the simple storage resource of Redfish standard schema.
This new resource represents the properties of a storage
controller and its directly-attached devices. This patch
introduces the property ``max_size_bytes`` of
SimpleStorageCollection resource to expose the size of the
largest storage size available among all directly attached
devices available to the System.

Also brought in the common 'Status' (comprising of Health,
HealthRollup and State sub-fields) field and refactored the code
base to use that field across all the Redfish resources.

Story: 1668487
Task: 23041

Change-Id: I512c2507bf78f4a9cf1e2525fd685836387a7581

commit_message:
Fix monasca use of "action" -> "kolla_action"

The word "action" is now an Ansible reserved word, and things have
transitioned to "kolla_action", but looks like this was missed.

Change-Id: Ie07a2a7d8b153a6d39b91129256727157f8dfa34

commit_message:
Add storage disk drive

Adds storage disk drive resource of Redfish standard schema
and also provides the attribute ``drives_max_size_bytes`` on
storage which gives largest physical disk drive size available
in bytes among all physical disk drives.

Story: 1668487
Task: 23040
Partial-Bug: 1751143

Change-Id: Id7a5eb9af07730f11727c8b71c6852e080d75357

commit_message:
Add toci_jobtype as individual variables

For tripleo ci sprint 16 the toci_jobtype is
going to be replaced by individual variables at jobs
for now let's just add them so they can be use at
the refactoring, Later on we can remove toci_jobtype.

Change-Id: Ia5d0d7fc9d125ed8a71ad228f362ca117888d599

[{'created': '2018-07-13 18:23:55.000000000', 'message': 'Persistent sysctls broken due to missing .conf suffix

Kayobe provides support for setting arbitrary sysctls on hosts. These
should be persistent, but the configuration file used
(/etc/sysctl.d/kayobe) does not have the required .conf extension, so
the file is ignored.

This change adds a .conf suffix to make the file
/etc/sysctl.d/kayobe.conf.

Change-Id: I222250a91bc28aed9577293534cf481579992f52
Story: 2002972
Task: 22980

commit_message:
Persistent sysctls broken due to missing .conf suffix

Kayobe provides support for setting arbitrary sysctls on hosts. These
should be persistent, but the configuration file used
(/etc/sysctl.d/kayobe) does not have the required .conf extension, so
the file is ignored.

This change adds a .conf suffix to make the file
/etc/sysctl.d/kayobe.conf.

Change-Id: I222250a91bc28aed9577293534cf481579992f52
Story: 2002972
Task: 22980

commit_message:
Switch to use stestr for unit test

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
So we should switch to stestr.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ifb9683e3c4f2146322050cca44820475bf67039f

commit_message:
Add share instance index on share_id

The index on the foreign key is created on InnoDB mysql implicitly.
This makes it explicit.

Closes-Bug: #1776495
Change-Id: I6ff5cee86997d0d756b4852fa4d0e7bcfcc9c1cf

[{'created': '2018-07-19 17:44:42.000000000', 'message': 'Use api.lookup instead of idlutils.row_by_record

idlutils.row_by_record is a holdover from when there was only one

'}]
commit_message:
Use api.lookup instead of idlutils.row_by_record

idlutils.row_by_record is a holdover from when there was only one
schema. api.lookup() supports per-class lookup tables instead of
using the hardcoded Open_vSwitch lookup table.

Change-Id: I93a883e3afafb35f8e667afda99c77350da83ed4

commit_message:
Update get-pip to version 3.3

Version 3.2 has a bug with it on some systems that can result in the
following stacktrace: [ http://paste.openstack.org/show/726064 ]. To
correct this issue the version of the get-pip script has been set to 3.3
which does not suffer from the same issue.

Change-Id: Iaa824cc64bd0e8bdfdda4de243d80400f1529e8c
Closes-Bug: #1779534
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 79063a3e10ba733ea50a404627570c6a21bebd83)

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 79063a3e10ba733ea50a404627570c6a21bebd83)
'}]
commit_message:
Update get-pip to version 3.3

Version 3.2 has a bug with it on some systems that can result in the
following stacktrace: [ http://paste.openstack.org/show/726064 ]. To
correct this issue the version of the get-pip script has been set to 3.3
which does not suffer from the same issue.

Change-Id: Iaa824cc64bd0e8bdfdda4de243d80400f1529e8c
Closes-Bug: #1779534
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 79063a3e10ba733ea50a404627570c6a21bebd83)

subject: Enabled additional .conf files to be read by collectd

commit_message:
Enabled additional .conf files to be read by collectd

  - Included the "enable_collectd_plugins" option.
  - Enables additional plugin .conf files to be read by collectd.
  - Included a reno for this change.
  - Provided documentation for this change.

Change-Id: If0adf81ef13ecae369b84f03338795497b3f03a2

subject: Enabled the use of plugins for collectd

(1 comment)

reading again through the change, i think the extend-override file is not needed.

Using neutron-base as example: https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/master/docker/neutron/neutron-base/Dockerfile.j2#L123

First copy plugins folder in neutron-base image.
Then install plugins if exists.

Documenting only the addition of the plugin in kolla-build.conf will be enough to allow plugins addition into collect images. 

Take this change for nova as example https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454743/

What I'm not sure is if missing/empty plugins will fail at ADD plugins-archive"}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2017-07-04 14:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

since ceilometer forward metric to gnocchi now. why use use collectd-gnocchi plugin?

https://julien.danjou.info/blog/2017/gnocchi-collectd-setup'}, {'account_id': 23488, 'date': '2017-07-19 11:04:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-19 12:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I8da6f0a99a89aaba053ebc9ed03e785b08b1b6dc
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I8da6f0a99a89aaba053ebc9ed03e785b08b1b6dc

Change deprecated option iscsi_helper to target_helper

The iscsi_helper configuration option has been deprecated and
replaced by target_helper.  This patch updates it to use the
correct helper.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 18:14:00.000000000', 'message': "Switch storage to use different inventory_hostname

Our role tests execute as non-root users, and the roles
need to access the environment variables for that non-root
user. Ansible, when targeting localhost, changes to
'connection: local' and thus breaks everything we need
to do against localhost as root unless we use 'become: true',
but we if generally use that against remote hosts we lose
the environment variables for the non-root user.

As such, we switch the inventory to target 'compute1' instead,
which has the address '10.1.1.1' (br-mgmt), so that we do not
have to deal with the implict connection type changes implemented
by Ansible.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584033
Change-Id: I738e4ca31cd4d465d7e7eee3de052a40f7b1596a
"}]
commit_message:
Switch storage to use different inventory_hostname

Our role tests execute as non-root users, and the roles
need to access the environment variables for that non-root
user. Ansible, when targeting localhost, changes to
'connection: local' and thus breaks everything we need
to do against localhost as root unless we use 'become: true',
but we if generally use that against remote hosts we lose
the environment variables for the non-root user.

As such, we switch the inventory to target 'compute1' instead,
which has the address '10.1.1.1' (br-mgmt), so that we do not
have to deal with the implict connection type changes implemented
by Ansible.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584033
Change-Id: I738e4ca31cd4d465d7e7eee3de052a40f7b1596a

commit_message:
tasks: repo_build_wheels: Download get-pip.py if it does not exist

/opt/get-pip.py may not exist if the host uses the distribution
python-pip package. As such, we need to check if the file exists
and download it if it's missing before trying to copy it to the
repo build directory. Fixes the following problem:

==> opensuse423: TASK [repo_build : Copy get-pip script into release folder] ********************
==> opensuse423: Friday 25 May 2018  19:19:07 +0200 (0:00:01.362) 0:17:03.950 ************
==> opensuse423: fatal: [aio1_repo_container-b8bbcfc4]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "msg": "Source /opt/get-pip.py not found"}

Change-Id: I693b930bf337fd08931d835d57ffe9ecae904517

which has the address '10.1.1.1' (br-mgmt), so that we do not
have to deal with the implict connection type changes implemented
by Ansible.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584033
Change-Id: I3c29bab37b5dbbd0faec246c02e3a39fe4c1033a
"}]
commit_message:
Switch compute to use different inventory_hostname

Our role tests execute as non-root users, and the roles
need to access the environment variables for that non-root
user. Ansible, when targeting localhost, changes to
'connection: local' and thus breaks everything we need
to do against localhost as root unless we use 'become: true',
but we if generally use that against remote hosts we lose
the environment variables for the non-root user.

As such, we switch the inventory to target 'compute1' instead,
which has the address '10.1.1.1' (br-mgmt), so that we do not
have to deal with the implict connection type changes implemented
by Ansible.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584033
Change-Id: I3c29bab37b5dbbd0faec246c02e3a39fe4c1033a

commit_message:
Fixes compute error

We observed a compute error in  the tests due to a change
(# I94f5af2055d1b6b41a9a170ca9b4daf57363c972) increasing
the disk to 20 GB in production. This will set it for tests
back to 3 GB which should avoid the gates failing on disk
failure.

We also observed a pip error and I think it should be fixed
with If2f1ab03ccd9400fe05e2948ddfe33c8796dbd97 - so
make tye pip install become: true to work around this
until the other patch merges.

Change-Id: I31b6c5d20cedb0df6648925566afd312d7f1dda9

Temporarily set functional test to non-voting

The functional test requires multiple fixes to make
it work again, so we temporarily disable it so that
we don't have to combine all the fixes into a single
patch.

[{'created': '2018-07-17 11:48:55.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Fix populate templates dir for mixed UC/OC cases"

If the sounds dir doesn't exist, we should exit with an error, not log a warning and use some completely different path.

IMHO this is breaking a long established interface, e.g

1. --templates (no args, we use the /usr/share default templates)

2. --templates foo (foo must exist, we use foo)

The --templates argument should be explicit, and point to a path that exists.

This reverts commit cf6fc69e55734475142c7e7e7d2999007e7bec77.

commit_message:
Revert "Fix populate templates dir for mixed UC/OC cases"

If the dir doesn't exist, we should exit with an error,
not log a warning and use some completely different path.

IMHO this is breaking a long established interface, e.g

1. --templates (no args, we use the /usr/share default templates)

2. --templates foo (foo must exist, we use foo)

The --templates argument should be explicit, and point to a path that exists.

This reverts commit cf6fc69e55734475142c7e7e7d2999007e7bec77.
Change-Id: I291babbbfc091ffe6e815298301a60dd1f047de1

commit_message:
Bind mount mistral state for external deployments

External deployments, like openshift-ansible, rely on
contents of /var/lib/mistral and /usr/share/ansible/
host paths. Bind mount those to allow containerized
mistral access data required for external deployments.
Allow only executor to write into /var/lib/mistral.
The other non-API components are only allowed to read.

Change-Id: I4299442de0efaa66253ecc45acb2d0a8c082f018
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
tripleo-validations, group-validations fails with notify_running task exception

Currently when executing a group-validation like the pre-upgrade
validations, the Mistral workflow fails with:

Can not evaluate YAQL expression [expression=$.validation_name, error=u'validation_name', data={}]

This is due to referencing variables not defined.

Change-Id: Ifda4708eb2e0054cdee35edc61bbfcaab5ec2109
Closes-Bug: 1781348
Story: #2002915

subject: Automatic skip of the repo build for distro installs
messages:
[{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-20 09:07:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-07-20 09:19:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

as far as i know this playbook is never executed for distro installs so this is not needed right?'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-20 11:47:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> as far as i know this playbook is never executed for distro
 > installs so this is not needed right?

it is not executed in gates, you're right.
But for deployers it would be, as deployers are not forced to:
- Use the dynamic inventory
- Use the bootstrap-aio script (which sets the affinity to 0)."}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-07-20 12:01:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

if you look at the playbooks/setup-infrastructure.yml (once the distro patch is in) you will see that none of the repo-* playbooks are included when install_mode=='distro'."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-20 12:13:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> if you look at the playbooks/setup-infrastructure.yml (once the
 > distro patch is in) you will see that none of the repo-* playbooks
 > are included when install_mode=='distro'.

But what if I start the playbook separately?"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-20 12:15:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > if you look at the playbooks/setup-infrastructure.yml (once the
 > > distro patch is in) you will see that none of the repo-*
 > playbooks
 > > are included when install_mode=='distro'.
 > 
 > But what if I start the playbook separately?

I guess deployers are smart enough."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-20 12:15:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

[{'created': '2018-07-20 09:07:44.000000000', 'message': "Automatic skip of the repo build for distro installs

This allows all deployers to benefit of the skip of the repo
build, even if they didn't change their dynamic inventory.

Change-Id: I05a6771bba424d6668015493330c0e915a08cc24
"}]
commit_message:
Automatic skip of the repo build for distro installs

This allows all deployers to benefit of the skip of the repo
build, even if they didn't change their dynamic inventory.

Change-Id: I05a6771bba424d6668015493330c0e915a08cc24

commit_message:
Use on-clause and retry_policy get_spec for validation

This patch places restrictions on the content of the on-success,
on-complete, on-error, retry, concurrency, timeout, wait-before,
wait-after and pause-before statements.
test_direct_transition was refactored to exclude repeated test cases
for on clause keys.

Co-Authored-By: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
Closes-Bug: #1714341
Change-Id: I8b314c8759a46111a81cf4a9400aa1cab2ea5201
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

commit_message:
Return the result of the MistralHTTPAction

If the HTTP request fails, we need to fail the task. Returning the error
from the parent class will do this. While this means we also return the
success result it will be ignored by the Mistral engine.

Credit to @lijianying10 on GitHub for sending this fix via a pull
request. Tests were then added to verify the change.

Closes-Bug: #1779973
Change-Id: Ib8754c8de2d6677d71383b3793d0fa168be575f5

commit_message:
Switch to use stestr for unit test

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
So we should switch to stestr.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I28a842859279595eb66f372eff84945cf0828be9
Co-Authored-By: zhurong <aaronzhu1121@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6fa81dadddeebd13f19fa966891d82c7c77bb101
Closes-Bug: #1782299

commit_message:
Fix endpoints for heat-api* healthchecks

The http request should be made to the v1 endpoint otherwise the API
returns a 300 error that the healthcheck doesn't understand.

Change-Id: I6fa81dadddeebd13f19fa966891d82c7c77bb101
Closes-Bug: #1782299

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 19:07:24.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor _set_domain_id_and_mapping functions

This change refactors both functions listed for single refs and
a list of refs for _set_domain_id_and_mapping to do separate checks
for conditions such as _is_domain_aware and _is_mapping_needed. This
is due to how it is currently handled, it uses the same logic between
both functions, which provides more overhead for a list than a single
ref.

Change-Id: I325627f511fe7d52a191e64eada030e84d756d7e
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor _set_domain_id_and_mapping functions

This change refactors both functions listed for single refs and
a list of refs for _set_domain_id_and_mapping to do separate checks
for conditions such as _is_domain_aware and _is_mapping_needed. This
is due to how it is currently handled, it uses the same logic between
both functions, which provides more overhead for a list than a single
ref.

Change-Id: I325627f511fe7d52a191e64eada030e84d756d7e

commit_message:
Skip MTU check during deletion of Networks

MTU check can be skipped during deletion of Networks.
The MTU check doesn't provide any additional support during deletion
of the networks.

Also, if a network is created with MTU 'X' and the
global_mtu later on is decreased to 'Y', the created
network cannot be deleted due to the MTU check.

Change-Id: Ia838d2a661c5098f90b58b2cb31557f2ebf78868
Closes-Bug: #1713499
