commit_message:
Allow disabling nova-ssh

This service is only required if you want to support cold migration.
In some instances that is not a needed feature, and avoiding having
another key to manage is an advantage.

Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I0a55a91673d9178933f134832df4bd849ddf5af4

commit_message:
Allow externally managed swift as glance backend

It is possible to have an accessible swift API that is not managed by
kolla-ansible -- for example, ceph exposes a swift API, and using that
requires setting swift as the glance backend.

So, we should loosen the requirement that using the swift backend for
glance requires swift be enabled in kolla-ansible.

Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I17076d5412d2b1e1f13bb0badceaca85a5cee108

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be

    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be

    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code

DSCP marks, except for an incomplete hint in the DSCP spec in

'}]
commit_message:
Add list of all working DSCP marks

There is no place in the documentation that explicitly lists the valid
DSCP marks, except for an incomplete hint in the DSCP spec in
neutron-specs.  This provides an explicit list.

Change-Id: Ic350c88e59c33d98b54086707c9add05cf137dc2
Closes-Bug: #1781915

commit_message:
Reduce IP address collision during port creating

Try to give it a large random chance during generate IP
address.

The DB retry mechanism change moved to neutron-lib:
I5ad139bdfb3ae125658b36d05f85f139a1b47bee

Closes-Bug: #1777968
Change-Id: I2acc9c720b39271bde2a89da4a66958f7aba5b7d

Nice catch, so to get this to work..
1. We're probably going to have version the settings files by release. So anything Pike and earlier should use the old --control-scale method anything queens+ should use the settings file.
2. Take a look at https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/blob/master/roles/overcloud-deploy/tasks/pre-deploy.yml#L94-L96 to see how these variables are used.  We'll need to generate a params file w/ a jinja template
3. I'll try and get you some assistance, visit #oooq for details"}, {'account_id': 24687, 'date': '2018-03-29 08:42:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I just commit a patch in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557573/5 . It will compatible with pervious release. And I wonder how  these two commit can check at same time CI test.'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2018-03-29 09:49:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I was just able to confirm that the --compute-scale kind of arguments were deprecated in Neton and were supposed to be removed in Pike, but in rocky we still have support for the, they're also mentioned in the standard downstream documentation and I'm asking around what's the real plan with those. In the meantime, could you add this to the commit message ? commit_message:
Move --scale to {{role}}Count

In tripleoclient, some argument like --control-scale --compute-scale
are DEPRECATED from Newton and plan removed in Pike. But tripleo-quickstart
 still use these args.we should replace scale to
{{Role}}Count(ControllerCount, ComputeCount).

Change-Id: I33232fa3f3e647bac0ff9efc020ff85033bbab4d
Related-Bug: 1759738

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-06 21:44:19.000000000', 'message': "Add a get_nested filter

When accessing nested facts, such as in ansible_local sections, guard
statements in the when clause can get quite long, due to having to
repeate the 'in/not in' logic for every key at every level.

The get_nested filter attempts to instead to move the guard into a
single line, making the conditions easier to write and maintain.

As example,

   ('openstack_ansible' not in ansible_local or
    'swift' not in ansible_local['openstack_ansible'] or
    'venv_tag' not in ansible_local['openstack_ansible']['swift'] or
    ansible_local['openstack_ansible']['swift']['venv_tag'] == swift_venv_tag)

     get_nested(ansible_local, 'openstack_ansible.swift.venv_tag') == swift_venv_tag

Change-Id: I3b43c25c8783c43cf5285f2b3e7267b2c5712ea0
"}, {'created': '2017-07-07 19:42:44.000000000', 'message': "Add a get_nested filter

When accessing nested facts, such as in ansible_local sections, guard
statements in the when clause can get quite long, due to having to
repeate the 'in/not in' logic for every key at every level.

The get_nested filter attempts to instead to move the guard into a
single line, making the conditions easier to write and maintain.

As example,

   ('openstack_ansible' not in ansible_local or
    'swift' not in ansible_local['openstack_ansible'] or
    'venv_tag' not in ansible_local['openstack_ansible']['swift'] or
    ansible_local['openstack_ansible']['swift']['venv_tag'] == swift_venv_tag)

Change-Id: I3b43c25c8783c43cf5285f2b3e7267b2c5712ea0

commit_message:
Add a get_nested filter

When accessing nested facts, such as in ansible_local sections, guard
statements in the when clause can get quite long, due to having to
repeate the 'in/not in' logic for every key at every level.

The get_nested filter attempts to instead to move the guard into a
single line, making the conditions easier to write and maintain.

As example,

   ('openstack_ansible' not in ansible_local or
    'swift' not in ansible_local['openstack_ansible'] or
    'venv_tag' not in ansible_local['openstack_ansible']['swift'] or
    ansible_local['openstack_ansible']['swift']['venv_tag'] == swift_venv_tag)

 could be rewritten as

     get_nested(ansible_local, 'openstack_ansible.swift.venv_tag') == swift_venv_tag

Change-Id: I3b43c25c8783c43cf5285f2b3e7267b2c5712ea0

commit_message:
Use id of workflow instead of name to keep track of what is created

With concurrent test executions it is possible that namespaced and
non-namespaced tests run at the same time, making it flaky whether
the name of the workflow is enough to identify the workflow. Using
the id should work in all cases.

Change-Id: Ib0e7d31f9a983c723704b64b1c46940aace545d7

There's a special case of changing inventories that we didn't have
gabbit coverage for: For an existing resource provider, we allow its

commit_message:
[placement] Add gabbi coverage for an inventory change

There's a special case of changing inventories that we didn't have
gabbit coverage for: For an existing resource provider, we allow its
inventory to be changed to have a lower total than existing allocations
(See commit 09627f2a0bd). There was no gabbi coverage for that case.
This adds it.

Change-Id: I34e104a766d4578f83a455b4b900ea50c9a6ec0f

commit_message:
Disable Volume Backup Tests

This maps to an upstream change of cinder [1] disabling
the tests test_volume_backup_export_import and
test_volume_backup_reset_status, which are the only two tests
included in test_volumes_backup [2].

This has to be disabled until work is realised upstream to
fix the authentication issue of cinder-backup with swift
backend and keystone auth.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/737c50b4ea54e2e63d6e3fe8a73d22b393df4205
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/b286ad402e6bd60f33dfd8251d6cf1ed1ceae69d/tempest/api/volume/admin/test_volumes_backup.py

Change-Id: I198aab2cdff7464e79176a5c07ea0ae9b91f3b91

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 17:39:34.000000000', 'message': "Switch compute to use different inventory_hostname

Our role tests execute as non-root users, and the roles
need to access the environment variables for that non-root
user. Ansible, when targeting localhost, changes to
'connection: local' and thus breaks everything we need
to do against localhost as root unless we use 'become: true',
but we if generally use that against remote hosts we lose
the environment variables for the non-root user.

As such, we switch the inventory to target 'compute1' instead,
which has the address '127.0.0.1', so that we do not have to
deal with the implict connection type changes implemented by
Ansible.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584033
Change-Id: I79256f9cb542732cfdff6439768f94769ee33b1c

As such, we switch the inventory to target 'compute1' instead,

have to deal with the implict connection type changes implemented
by Ansible.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584033
Change-Id: I79256f9cb542732cfdff6439768f94769ee33b1c
"}]
commit_message:
Switch compute to use different inventory_hostname

Our role tests execute as non-root users, and the roles
need to access the environment variables for that non-root
user. Ansible, when targeting localhost, changes to
'connection: local' and thus breaks everything we need
to do against localhost as root unless we use 'become: true',
but we if generally use that against remote hosts we lose
the environment variables for the non-root user.

As such, we switch the inventory to target 'compute1' instead,
which has the address '10.1.1.1' (br-mgmt), so that we do not
have to deal with the implict connection type changes implemented
by Ansible.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584033
Change-Id: I79256f9cb542732cfdff6439768f94769ee33b1c

commit_message:
Switch compute/storage to use different inventory_hostname

Our role tests execute as non-root users, and the roles
need to access the environment variables for that non-root
user. Ansible, when targeting localhost, changes to
'connection: local' and thus breaks everything we need
to do against localhost as root unless we use 'become: true',
but we if generally use that against remote hosts we lose
the environment variables for the non-root user.

As such, we switch the inventory to target 'compute1' instead,
which has the address '10.1.1.1' (br-mgmt), so that we do not
have to deal with the implict connection type changes implemented
by Ansible.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584033
Change-Id: I137b9a59520c35e6342c4883435fd191fbc5dd68

commit_message:
Allow class-level definition of API URL Prefix

Add the ability to define API URL Prefix at the class-level. This
will be used only if no ap_url_prefix is passed into __init__.

Flask-restful handles prefixes in the order of `BAE` as used in Keystone:
  * Blueprint
  * API
  * Endpoint (flask-endpoint)

This allows for additional prefixes such as "OS-TRUST" for
legacy/converted extension code that has not been updated to use
non-"OS" prefixed pathes.

Change-Id: I7acf2f16a25efc6a801e6c87c1aac436bb8e5453
Partial-Bug: #1776504

Add etcd_volume_size parameter in coreos template

Without those fixes new cluster fails with message:

Task: 1722523
Story: 20337

subject: Waiting to provide radosgw key until ceph cluster is ok
messages:
[{'account_id': 5112, 'date': '2018-07-10 15:07:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5112, 'date': '2018-07-10 15:32:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24297, 'date': '2018-07-10 22:39:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Looks good Seyeong, thanks for the patch!'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-07-11 10:49:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Dealing with this particular problem is common to all client type relations; in addition we also lack any ceph-osd -> ceph-mon comms to trigger re-execution of broker processing when OSD's are up and running, so this will required a slightly broader solution than presented here."}, {'account_id': 5112, 'date': '2018-07-13 07:56:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I see, I checked broker in charm code 

I'll try to implement them and test.

Thanks"}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2018-07-20 09:00:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I agree with James. This is fundamental problem in the way the ceph charms work such that there is no way to gate pool creates until all OSDs have fully joined the cluster. The problem needs to be solved at the broker level and one possible solution could be to have the broker either cache requests and execute them later or simply retrigger the client to re-send requests once all OSDs are up + in. As James pointed out though there is no mechanism currently for the broker to be alerted when the cluster is ready (since that happens asynchronously to the charms and could happen some time after they have finished executing) so that is the main problem that needs solving first.'}, {'account_id': 5112, 'date': '2018-07-20 09:28:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Need discussion about fundamental behaviour.'}]

commit_message:
Waiting to provide radosgw key until ceph cluster is ok

Later release than Luminous, Pool can't be created if ceph
cluster is not ok. so defer radosgw key provision
until cluster is ok

Change-Id: I648ea49d87dfc7ae0dab7cf578d3a3652ceda53d
Closes-bug: #1774279

[{'created': '2018-07-19 02:38:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix server_group create issue

Heat uses python-novaclient version 10.3.0 in which 2.64 microversion
changes are not included but heat-engine uses 2.64 compute API version
resulting in failure in creating server group.

Fixed this issue by explicitly changing max_microversion
to use 2.62 instead of none.

Change-Id: I30b9fc4dd96470832f5e7516179021fbe11c63bc
Story: #2003017

changes [1] are not included but heat-engine still gets 2.64 compute
API version from client (queries nova api service) resulting in

commit_message:
Fix server_group create issue

Heat uses python-novaclient version 10.3.0 in which 2.64 microversion
changes [1] are not included but heat-engine still gets 2.64 compute
API version from client (queries nova api service) resulting in
failure in creating server group.

Fixed this issue by explicitly using 2.15 api version to
create server_group.

[1] : https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/839da6fec02182fa3c6d51460099ac4f7ebb500d#diff-815379030879ca27268b9336fecbe7dc

Change-Id: I30b9fc4dd96470832f5e7516179021fbe11c63bc
Story: #2003017

commit_message:
Check container health as part of the deploy

After starting the containers, we should make sure they are healthy
before continuing. If any containers are unhealthy we should fail
quickly and provide output showing which container is unhealthy.

Change-Id: I785ddb45779b6699fc839fdddb9c804dd1b1da5d

commit_message:
Fix gnocchi_statsd and ceilometer_agent_ipmi healthcheck

- statsd is connecting to redis only when it receives a data,
  hence to avoid false negatives we will rather test if the service
  is listening on proper port

- ceilometer_agent_ipmi connects to Redis instead of Rabbit for coordination
  now.

Closes-Bug: #1781108
Change-Id: I4414bac82981c30ba6b7c1c8b406baa7a0900e5a

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Icb3886271885bfee19981a6acdda3163f3cd72f8

commit_message:
Remove help message about ZeroMQ driver

ZeroMQ driver is deprecated, as per the Dublin 2018 PTG decision:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128055.html

Change-Id: Ia3d5fd1d2ccd57bf3b9f97172c09994bf5d44022

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I8f70f7d8a3d18301559c0eb47e6a64c8b5100d39

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 00:20:14.000000000', 'message': 'remove uid, gid from rsyncd.conf for swift user

The rsync prior to v3.1.0 the uid/gid parameter have no effect at
all if it runs as normal(non-root) user.

Since v3.1.0 these parameter are problematic for normal user
because now rsync, regardless of root or non-root, if the
parameters are given then it just tries to call setgroups() which
is not possible for normal user so errors may occur.

    swift-object-replicator: @ERROR: setgroups failed\u0000
    swift-object-replicator: rsync error: error starting
    client-server protocol (code 5) at main.c(1648)
    [sender=3.1.2]\u0000

Either way, these parameters are not needed for swift-rsync
container.

Change-Id: Ia7fe9f06d7a21a55f52b90c2cc1b2498300e6532
Signed-off-by: Minho Ban <mhban@samsung.com>
'}]
commit_message:
remove uid, gid from rsyncd.conf for swift user

The rsync prior to v3.1.0 the uid/gid parameter have no effect at
all if it runs as normal(non-root) user.

Since v3.1.0 these parameter are problematic for normal user
because now rsync, regardless of root or non-root, if the
parameters are given then it just tries to call setgroups() which
is not possible for normal user so errors may occur.

    swift-object-replicator: @ERROR: setgroups failed\u0000
    swift-object-replicator: rsync error: error starting
    client-server protocol (code 5) at main.c(1648)
    [sender=3.1.2]\u0000

Either way, these parameters are not needed for swift-rsync
container.

Change-Id: Ia7fe9f06d7a21a55f52b90c2cc1b2498300e6532
Signed-off-by: Minho Ban <mhban@samsung.com>

subject: Add fallocate_reserve to account and container servers.
messages:
[{'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-02-05 22:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-05-24 23:28:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-06-28 23:47:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-06-28 23:49:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

No conflicts; I guess the merge was just too tricky for Gerrit. My local Git managed it just fine.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-07-02 04:30:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

It's looking good so far, not 100% sure yet as it does differ quite a big from object fallocate_reserve, which I understand why. 

I don't really care about the PUT and POSTs of containers and accounts, its the REPLICATE that easily make this check not work. of course if everyone was using sharding it's less of an issue ;P

I wonder if we can send some metric on a REPLICATE verb to indicate the potential size. I know this doesn't help in the future when we'd want to potentially have different storage systems on nodes. But seeing as we're currently talking about account and containers, maybe we can use something with the difference in rowIDs. Because that would have an indication on size, e.g an average row size + number of rows would be a pretty good indication. Using rowids would also work with both usync and rsync, ie rowid difference (which we already checked mostly in db replication) and if the difference is too big, the number of rows in db (on an rsync/rsync_then_merge).
Only difference is we would do the check on the db server side (not the replicator) something like in _handle_sync_request in the ReplicatorRPC. Here we have the replicator info from both sides so can easily do a check and return 507 if we need to.

One caveat however of this approach however is when we rehash the container and now other container knows about it. Then it could have a big rowID difference (because it's never been synced so defaults to 0 in incoming_sync). If the drive if getting full then it might start 507 earlier, but maybe that's ok?

Or if no one agrees then at least let's add a little more documentation to explain the differences.

I'm happy to poke around to come up with a patch to add this check, even as a follow if people don't think it can wait :)

I do think fallocate_reserve on the metadata later is awesome tho."}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-07-18 09:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-07-20 06:20:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Let's db fallocate_reserve in."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 22:56:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add fallocate_reserve to account and container servers.

The object server can be configured to leave a certain amount of disk
space free; default is 1%. This is useful in avoiding 100%-full
filesystems, as those can get Swift in a state where the filesystem is
too full to write tombstones, so you can't delete objects to free up
space.

When a cluster has accounts/containers and objects on the same disks,
then you can wind up with a 100%-full disk since account and container
servers don't respect fallocate_reserve. This commit makes account and
container servers respect fallocate_reserve so that disks shared
between account/container and object rings won't get 100% full.

When a disk's free space falls below the configured reserve, account
and container PUT, POST, and REPLICATE requests will fail with a 507
status code. These are the operations that can significantly increase
the disk space used by a given database.

I called the parameter "fallocate_reserve" for consistency with the
object server. No actual fallocate() call happens under Swift's
control in the account or container servers (sqlite3 might make such a
call, but it's out of our hands).

Change-Id: I083442eef14bf83c0ea717b1decb3e6b56dbf1d0

commit_message:
Add fallocate_reserve to account and container servers.

The object server can be configured to leave a certain amount of disk
space free; default is 1%. This is useful in avoiding 100%-full
filesystems, as those can get Swift in a state where the filesystem is
too full to write tombstones, so you can't delete objects to free up
space.

When a cluster has accounts/containers and objects on the same disks,
then you can wind up with a 100%-full disk since account and container
servers don't respect fallocate_reserve. This commit makes account and
container servers respect fallocate_reserve so that disks shared
between account/container and object rings won't get 100% full.

When a disk's free space falls below the configured reserve, account
and container PUT, POST, and REPLICATE requests will fail with a 507
status code. These are the operations that can significantly increase
the disk space used by a given database.

I called the parameter "fallocate_reserve" for consistency with the
object server. No actual fallocate() call happens under Swift's
control in the account or container servers (sqlite3 might make such a
call, but it's out of our hands).

Change-Id: I083442eef14bf83c0ea717b1decb3e6b56dbf1d0

commit_message:
Remove the redundant "required=True"

The django form field default is "required=True", so this patch
remove the redundant "required=True" in the form.

Change-Id: If9d8320e14a32b24bbbac1c6a99597695e58b783

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-22 02:27:09.000000000', 'message': "Make microversioned keypair schema full one

Now microversioned schema is not a full one, that means
we can only test new functions with microversion, and if
we set
    min_microversion = 2.53
    max_microversion = 2.53
in tempest.conf, there will be many errors.

But in fact we should be able to support that kind of
configuration, i.e., we should be able to support running
all testcases with any microversion, not just part of testcases
with new microversion.

This is to define schema as a class, then microversioned schema
can automatically inherit all the attributes from the parent,
and we only need to modify some attributes in the child class
according to microversion functionality changelist.

This patch modified keypair schema as an experiment, if it's ok
then we can modify other schemas step by step.

Change-Id: Ifc505fe250a1f0f303c3f2fc14d46a53fb5899cf
"}]
commit_message:
Make microversioned keypair schema full one

Now microversioned schema is not a full one, that means
we can only test new functions with microversion, and if
we set
    min_microversion = 2.53
    max_microversion = 2.53
in tempest.conf, there will be many errors.

But in fact we should be able to support that kind of
configuration, i.e., we should be able to support running
all testcases with any microversion, not just part of testcases
with new microversion.

This is to define schema as a class, then microversioned schema
can automatically inherit all the attributes from the parent,
and we only need to modify some attributes in the child class
according to microversion functionality changelist.

This patch modified keypair schema as an experiment, if it's ok
then we can modify other schemas step by step.

Change-Id: Ifc505fe250a1f0f303c3f2fc14d46a53fb5899cf

commit_message:
Add compatibility with old Pod annotations

In Rocky we've changed format of Pod annotations. This commit adds
compatiblity with stable/queens format to make sure plugin works on that
branch.

Change-Id: I99acb29ffb64f42e61ca17b0aec24976a61510eb

[{'created': '2017-12-18 20:53:36.000000000', 'message': 'use callback payloads for PRECOMMIT_UPDATE events

This patch switches callbacks over to the payload object style events
[1] for PRECOMMIT_UPDATE based notifications. To do so a DBEventPayload
object is used with the publish() method to pass along the related data.
In addition a few UTs are updated to work with the changes. Finally
a few shims are put into place to allow PRECOMMIT_UPDATE based events to
use payloads while still supporting the exist kwarg style events.

NeutronLibImpact

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html#event-payloads

Change-Id: Ie6d27df01cd7b87894efc80946d41eb1ebe25bef

commit_message:
use callback payloads for PRECOMMIT_UPDATE events

This patch switches callbacks over to the payload object style events
[1] for PRECOMMIT_UPDATE based notifications. To do so a DBEventPayload
object is used with the publish() method to pass along the related data.
In addition a few UTs are updated to work with the changes. Finally
a few shims are put into place to allow PRECOMMIT_UPDATE based events to
use payloads while still supporting the existing kwarg style events.

NeutronLibImpact

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html#event-payloads

Change-Id: Ie6d27df01cd7b87894efc80946d41eb1ebe25bef

commit_message:
Fix attribute mismatch in router provider update

The transition of a router from distributed to centralized may
mistakenley get its 'ha' attribute updated at the same time. The
side-effect is that the router may become HA enabled unexpectedly.

This patch fixed the mismatched attribute in _update_router_provider
method which addressed the issue cited above.

Closes-Bug: #1780094
Change-Id: Ib00de137692979229d1b7ba033ecff04e9cc9db0

oslo_messaging's rpc_backend setting, which is set by
ConfFixture.transport_driver has been deprecated since Newton. To allow

Partial-Bug: #1712399

commit_message:
Switch to oslo_messaging.ConfFixture.transport_url

oslo_messaging's rpc_backend setting, which is set by
ConfFixture.transport_driver has been deprecated since Newton. To allow
oslo_messaging to remove it, switch to setting transport_url instead.

Change-Id: Ie37b20d1be6c177f2f1c26cc473b632d7d934c05
Partial-Bug: #1712399

Trying to dynamically switch connection types and become
just doesn't work, so instead we force all role tests to
setup a different inventory_hostname for the services on

way and we don't have to try and fudge it.

Change-Id: Ibbbab05efb0170bd66bf829a5d6c2ce136cb120f
"}]
commit_message:
Connect to localhost as remote host for cinder/nova

Trying to dynamically switch connection types and become
just doesn't work, so instead we force all role tests to
setup a different inventory_hostname for the services on
localhost so that Ansible connects to it in a different
way and we don't have to try and fudge it.

Change-Id: Ibbbab05efb0170bd66bf829a5d6c2ce136cb120f

subject: Add missing python-memcached item for requirements
messages:
[{'account_id': 14151, 'date': '2018-01-02 06:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14151, 'date': '2018-01-02 07:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-01-02 09:08:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14151, 'date': '2018-01-02 09:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-02 13:44:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

python-memcached is an optional dependency, so I am not sure we need to add python-memcahched in requirements.txt.

python-memcached is required only when we use memcached as django session storage [1] and it depends on deployments.

We have the similar case in the server projects. For example, nova and neutron controller depends on database client like PyMySQL (for MySQL) or psycopg2 (for PostgreSQL) but we don't have PyMySQL or psycopg2 in their requirements.txt. I believe this is the same case as this.

As my current conclusion, we don't need to add deployment optional requirements in our requirements.

Is there any other cases we have dependency on python-memcached?

Thought?

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/topics/cache/#memcached"}, {'account_id': 14151, 'date': '2018-07-20 07:49:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add some OpenStack networking-* projects to global-requirements 2/3

Add projects to constraints, remove them from blacklist, repos with
tox_install have been updated.

Note that this uses the existing versions on pypi for constraints, these
are not used during rocky development since installation in OpenStack CI
installs the git source trees. Once releases of these are done, the
constraint will be updated.

networking-odl is kept in blacklist since the last released version
contains an unwanted cap. This needs fixing first.

Change-Id: I11c96a90fc639c0e0e186463fb0fcb45a39bd992

commit_message:
Allow setting load balancer topology in Devstack

Load balancer topology options are SINGLE and ACTIVE_STANDBY. We default
to SINGLE as it is the default in-code too.

Change-Id: Id5af2397122ca3c031e9a5becccfcdd75506876f

commit_message:
Add missing oslo.serialization requirement

We have depended on this in mistralclient/auth/keystone.py for some time.
Often it will be installed by another project, but if you have
mistralclient only in a virtualenv it will be missing.

Change-Id: I6dd6b3e4c885d0396529dc3169cb35e057ffe34d

[{'created': '2018-07-19 04:43:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix testenv cover in tox.ini

In [testenv:cover] section, the setenv need add the {[testenv]setenv}
to inherit from the global setenv configuration, and also the $project
shoud be replace to mistral.

Change-Id: I0fd56730cc921da6d177eaa05070decf264a1f18
'}]
commit_message:
Fix testenv cover in tox.ini

In [testenv:cover] section, the setenv need add the {[testenv]setenv}
to inherit from the global setenv configuration, and also the $project
shoud be replace to mistral.

Change-Id: I0fd56730cc921da6d177eaa05070decf264a1f18

commit_message:
add rocky branch to features.yaml

This patch adds the rocky branch to features.yaml so that rocky branch
patches can land, for example [1] that currently fails with:
ERROR: branch not allowed by features matrix: rocky

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584078/

Change-Id: I235c6c3ad81dff916a65cf8b97152621812fa102

commit_message:
Use object instead of object id in the drivers delete callbacks

Commit Ide4beaf73bb99be5c3b4c71c12fecef3499f45d9 updated the drivers api spec.
This patch implements the new api for the delete callbacks.

Move Credentials API to Flask Native

Move the Credentials API to Flask Native dispatching.

This change fixes some circular importing in the
conversion.

commit_message:
Properly remove content-type on HTTP 204

With a HTTP 204, we have no content, therefore no content type.

Change-Id: I39d36876d2ec37f6c34605bea48cdf7e20461c6e
Partial-Bug: #1776504

executed with pre-provisioned credentials and an LDAP backend.

commit_message:
Add ability to pass data to create_object

create_object currently only accepts data in files. That's not awesome
for some usecases, such as creating 0-byte 'directory' nodes. Add a data
parameter so that data can be passed in.

Change-Id: I35e08d7b1a4fd6ded822edeba9e62a1390a6c4e8

commit_message:
Add flag for disabling object checksum generation

Checksums are calculated and added to the object's metadata as a way
to prevent double-uploading identical copies of large data. For some
use cases, such as uploading log files, there is no risk of that and
there is no point to paying the calculation cost.

Change-Id: I7b3c94b72e99f9abd3c961bd811da6fd563144bb

subject: Switch to use stestr for unit test
messages: [{'account_id': 28176, 'date': '2018-07-19 03:34:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-07-19 14:24:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-07-20 06:15:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 03:34:29.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to use stestr for unit test

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
So we should switch to stestr.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I753abb6ceae046e388357450a6cdb84af6e5fe74
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to use stestr for unit test

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
So we should switch to stestr.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I753abb6ceae046e388357450a6cdb84af6e5fe74

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Id656690dfa8a0f7188edbd766dcf2fa64729d046
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Id656690dfa8a0f7188edbd766dcf2fa64729d046

commit_message:
Merge extended availability zone controller

As nova extensions has been deprecated already and goal is to
merge all scattered code into main controller side.
Currently schema and request/response extended code are there
among all extensions.

This commit merge the extended AZ controller.

Partially implements: blueprint api-extensions-merge-rocky

Change-Id: I430777aab20961c76bad3d72a83b34396aaa3f93

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-25 08:01:38.000000000', 'message': 'NEC driver: Faster clone status check.

Currently, the interval of checking volume cloning status is
60 seconds and hard-coded. The interval is long for users who utilize
Image-Volume cache. The cache volumes are basically small and
copied in less than 60 seconds.
This patch changes the initial interval to 10 seconds and increases
it on retries up to 60 seconds.

Change-Id: I37b0fd4d1edd1d25848ee87cf1ebbad9f622ffa2
(cherry picked from commit 4adeca8f4754578f6c8906dc2e61a43d07e7889f)
'}]
commit_message:
NEC driver: Faster clone status check.

Currently, the interval of checking volume cloning status is
60 seconds and hard-coded. The interval is long for users who utilize
Image-Volume cache. The cache volumes are basically small and
copied in less than 60 seconds.
This patch changes the initial interval to 10 seconds and increases
it on retries up to 60 seconds.

Change-Id: I37b0fd4d1edd1d25848ee87cf1ebbad9f622ffa2
(cherry picked from commit 4adeca8f4754578f6c8906dc2e61a43d07e7889f)

commit_message:
Omit X-Subject-Token from log

I213585e691f58e380a4be463b493591f1449422e has omitted x-subject-token
from response log, but clients specify the same token on a request
header on Keystone API and that is output on the log.
Actually the following log is output at the gate:

http://logs.openstack.org/62/581162/2/check/tempest-full/835acee/controller/logs/tempest_log.txt

2018-07-10 00:44:36.563 23617 DEBUG tempest.lib.common.rest_client
  [req-20615e7c-76b6-4f6a-84c2-d3489a755000 ]
  Request - Headers: {'X-Subject-Token': 'gAAAAABbRAF0Lv0N7i4o-5hPjcI
                                          ZYXXKt1cxoo5FPUP_ukWuY_6_-4
                                          S8oRXOkTfgReg0G9GT87Qiw4Gbd..',
                      'X-Auth-Token': '<omitted>'}
  Body: None
  Response - Headers: {u'content-type': 'application/json',
                       u'x-subject-token': '<omitted>',
                       .., 'status': '200'}
  Body:  _log_request_full tempest/lib/common/rest_client.py:434

This makes the log omitted as the same reason.

Change-Id: Iedd36f8feb9784553559ed5c79e7be2012d675f5

commit_message:
Update _check_router_retain_needed()

Change to do a direct return of
_check_dvr_serviceable_ports_on_host() by moving distributed
check earlier.

Note: _check_dvr_serviceable_ports_on_host() can be called
with subnet_ids=[]

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I50987858b04fb1cf57109517b82624760ce089dc

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I49de3c0afde9bf3be15b02017031f44bbefcb1e7

'}]
commit_message:
Add Browbeat feature set and install requirements

 - Add new featureset to trigger a minimal Browbeat test
 - Add Browbeat to the extras requirements file so that
the playbooks are included

Change-Id: I5b1ef575b8e537a28a935caf8b7cc1cf9313b49b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 09:16:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix HostnameMap lookup - replace str_replace with yaql

Using str_replace when looking up hostnames in
HostnameMap may return unpredictable results.
For example if the map contain:

HostnameMap:
  overcloud-compute-12: cmp-12-london
  overcloud-compute-123: cmp-123-berlin

When we do string replace for a hostname that is
not in the map (example: 'overcloud-compute-124')
it will match on the substring. The result would
be 'cmp-12-london4'.

This change replaces the str_replace with a yaql
expression that will return the value of they key
matching the hostname provided. If the key is not
in the map, the hostname is returned.

Closes-Bug: #1781560
Change-Id: Ia3a6a3539cd566131cd81b4d755190aa5b61a573
"}, {'created': '2018-07-13 19:28:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix HostnameMap lookup - replace str_replace with yaql

This change replaces the str_replace with a yaql

"}, {'created': '2018-07-19 07:24:35.000000000', 'message': "Fix HostnameMap lookup - replace str_replace with yaql

commit_message:
Fix HostnameMap lookup - replace str_replace with yaql

Using str_replace when looking up hostnames in
HostnameMap may return unpredictable results.
For example if the map contain:

HostnameMap:
  overcloud-compute-12: cmp-12-london
  overcloud-compute-123: cmp-123-berlin

When we do string replace for a hostname that is
not in the map (example: 'overcloud-compute-124')
it will match on the substring. The result would
be 'cmp-12-london4'.

This change replaces the str_replace with a yaql
expression that will return the value of they key
matching the hostname provided. If the key is not
in the map, the hostname is returned.

Closes-Bug: #1781560
Change-Id: Ia3a6a3539cd566131cd81b4d755190aa5b61a573

[{'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-06 22:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-07-09 08:48:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Has this been tested with updates to a stack that had control plane ports without names? I want to get an idea if this will cause any issues if upgrading from an existing stack.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-07-09 09:30:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-09 11:23:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Has this been tested with updates to a stack that had control plane
 > ports without names? I want to get an idea if this will cause any
 > issues if upgrading from an existing stack.

So, this is not naming control plane ports, it's the isolated network ports.

TBH I have'nt been able to successfully deploy an overcloud using current-dev repos since a couple of weeks due to bug/1779900 ...

What I know works, is getting to the point where SQL fail to start. Then applying this patch, run an update and the ports get updated with the names.

As long as we have "Replacement Policy: AUTO" this property can be changed without the resource being replaced (ref [1]\xa0and [2]), so this should be safe.

[1]\xa0https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/resources/openstack/neutron/port.py#L89-L93
[2] https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/resources/openstack/neutron/port.py#L183-L188


Don't we test overcloud upgrade's in CI with isolated/composable networks?
(I tought we did, but looking at the check jobs in this patch I am not sure ...)'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-07-09 17:52:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I'm changing my review to +2, but I don't think we have upgrades testing currently (the one upgrades job is failing and non-voting at the moment)"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-10 16:23:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-10 16:24:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

That non-voting containers upgrade job is passing in some other jobs.
Re-based to see results on this patch.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-10 21:07:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-07-11 00:58:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-12 01:42:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I'm changing my review to +2, but I don't think we have upgrades
 > testing currently (the one upgrades job is failing and non-voting
 > at the moment)

Despite the upgrades job passing, it does not use isolated networks ...

I did a test deploying first without this patch, then apply the patch and stack update.
It completed successfully.

commit_message:
Give neutron ports names: $HOSTNAME_$NETWORKNAME

Set the name property of neutron ports created for
composable networks to:
 $HOSTNAME_$NETWORKNAME

This is helpful when troubleshooting, a simple port
list will tell us what port and ip is assigned to the
different overcloud nodes.

Change-Id: I9d067654a81826d79574d17bd073747b2f59d114

[{'created': '2018-07-13 16:07:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix UT BridgeLibTest when IPv6 is disabled

There was missing mock of
ipv6_utils.is_enabled_and_bind_by_default() in BridgeLibTest
unit tests and that cause failing some of tests from this module
when tests are running on host with disabled IPv6.
Now it's mocked and tests are running properly and are
testing what they should test.

Closes-Bug: #1773818
Change-Id: I9144450ce85e020c0e33c5214a2178acbbbf5f54
(cherry picked from commit 8930d33c71e394c1cfaa1b9ad5493c79d394cb40)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix UT BridgeLibTest when IPv6 is disabled

There was missing mock of
ipv6_utils.is_enabled_and_bind_by_default() in BridgeLibTest
unit tests and that cause failing some of tests from this module
when tests are running on host with disabled IPv6.
Now it's mocked and tests are running properly and are
testing what they should test.

Closes-Bug: #1773818
Change-Id: I9144450ce85e020c0e33c5214a2178acbbbf5f54
(cherry picked from commit 8930d33c71e394c1cfaa1b9ad5493c79d394cb40)

commit_message:
Fix Port nvmet driver to use privsep

Commit[1] fails NVMe CI due to missing attribute:

File "/opt/stack/cinder/cinder/volume/targets/nvmet.py", line 184,
                                    in _get_available_nvmf_subsystems
  out, err = cinder.privsep.nvmcli.save(tmp_file_path)
  AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'nvmcli'

[1] I3cff61b4cde16e00ad23d534c5281a2f1afcd29f


Change-Id: I5d457e5005e64b8857592b1686a5d8075f5f7c92

run-dell-emc-vmax'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2018-06-15 14:25:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

hi Helen, I haven't thoroughly reviewed your patch but I see that you are trying to change the database using volume.save(). That breaks the Cinder driver model[1]. Not sure what operations are calling that funcion, but those operation should return a dictionary of updates, and them Cinder will take care of saving the updates.
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/contributor/drivers.html#base-driver-interface"}, {'account_id': 24815, 'date': '2018-06-15 14:32:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

* Lenovo-FC http://os-logs.tristero.net/lenovo-ci/48/557448/24/Lenovo-FC : FAILURE in 4:02:14
* Lenovo-iSCSI http://os-logs.tristero.net/lenovo-ci/48/557448/24/Lenovo-iSCSI : FAILURE in 5:38:15'}, {'account_id': 12670, 'date': '2018-06-15 17:01:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2018-06-15 17:37:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

Hi Helen, Ill do a full review of you patches in the begging of the next week and see if I understand what you are doing and if there would be other option without needing to change Cinder core.
If not, we should bring to the meeting the need and propose to add that to the Cinder core.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-16 01:12:35.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 12670, 'date': '2018-06-18 08:34:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

Thanks Erlon, basically we want to a way trace and record the volume path through VMAX constructs like storage groups and masking views.  It is relevant for all operations including attach, detach and expand volumes which do not have the model_update return parameter. Regards, Helen'}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2018-06-18 12:43:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24:

Hi Helen, this seems to be a very bad way to adding debugging. I don't  think Cinder has a defined way on how drivers should use metadata, but adding logging information to it does not seem to be good.

One problem I can see with that is that you will clutter the database with a lot more operations given you can have a lot of volumes and for each volume, to perform a lot of operations, you might have space and performance issues.

To allow that for all your operations and not to break our driver model, we would need to change the driver interface to always receive a model update for all volume operations.

We should bring that topic to the Cinder meeting and see if people are OK with your proposal usage and the side effects it can bring.

I added a topic on the agenda. Let me know if you will be able to attend."}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2018-06-18 12:45:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24:

Hi Helen, this seems to be a very bad way to adding debugging. I don't  think Cinder has a defined way on how drivers should use metadata, but adding logging information to it does not seem to be good.

One problem I can see with that is that you will clutter the database with a lot more operations given you can have a lot of volumes and for each volume, to perform a lot of operations, you might have space and performance issues.

To allow that for all your operations and not to break our driver model, we would need to change the driver interface to always receive a model update for all volume operations.

We should bring that topic to the Cinder meeting and see if people are OK with your proposal usage and the side effects it can bring."}, {'account_id': 12670, 'date': '2018-06-18 13:27:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 12670, 'date': '2018-06-18 14:03:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26: Patch Set 25 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 12670, 'date': '2018-06-18 14:07:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Add VMAX specific volume metadata to logs

Log VMAX specific metadata of a volume and version
information, when debug is enabled. It enables the user
to trace the vmax location of a volume after every
operation i.e. storage group, masking view etc., as well
as useful debug information like OS, VMAX and python
versions.

Change-Id: Ib727797da7624dec5662a35de1db05ad6dc866a0
Implements: blueprint vmax-metadata

commit_message:
Move Octavia tests to scenario tests

The Octavia test is similar to the other scenario tests and is currently
the only 'functional' test to use external templates. Make it a scenario
test for consistency, and also so that we can remove the
_load_template() method from the HeatIntegrationTest base class.

commit_message:
Add release note for ability to set attachment mode

This adds a release note announcing the availability of the
--mode CLI option to create attachments as RO or RW.

Change-Id: I89e2bdd9b6da2745a793db78450b15e701e23ed1

commit_message:
Transfer snapshots with volumes

This patch will support to transfer volumes with or without
snapshots in new V3 api after mircoversion 3.55.

Change-Id: I61a84b5abf386a4073baea57d8820c8fd762ae03
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/533564/
Implements: blueprint transfer-snps-with-vols

commit_message:
Disable os-collect-config by default

With the switch to config-download, os-collect-config no longer needs to
be enabled on the overcloud nodes by default. It should be disabled to
avoid confusion as to why it might be running, as well as so that there
will be no accidental conflicts with config-download.

Change-Id: Ideae13e2bf42f1d62196f431d443bd5e55fdcff8

commit_message:
Add a variable to append paths in log collect list

This commit adds a new variable named artcl_collect_list_append that
gives the user the ability to append additional paths to what is the
default. So instead of redeclaring the (huge) amount of existing paths
with in addition the new ones, one can just add the ones he's interested
on inside the new variable.

Change-Id: I9843ce2a1159d550099f4d6dfe53dff22791a05a

commit_message:
[doc] Use openstack client command to replace others

The neutron client commands will be deprecated,
and 'nova net-list' has already been deprecated, so use
openstack client commands to replace neutron client.

Change-Id: Idb7d9782bb3af28cba7e318b0ed664641b5d731f

- gate-masakari-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/23/458023/4/check/gate-masakari-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/3156b88//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 4m 58s'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2017-06-06 06:51:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

My 2 cents.

1) Executing workflows within the same process is not necessary a good thing. This is a huge reason why many choose to use Mistral, fully offloading execution engine responsibility with all non-functional requirements (ha, scalability, tolerance to failures etc.) to a separate technology that does it well. Although I know that taskflow can do some of that too. Taskflow  itself though should not be compared with Mistral too seriously, my strong opinion is that they are simply different technologies in many ways, we can discuss it separately. Anyway, for things that requires large scale and flexibility I would definitely recommend Mistral.
2) Reinventing a YAML based language even distantly similar to Mistral workflow language sounds like a horrible idea. Sorry :) I can spend hours explaining why. We've gone through all circles of hell with it and spent years to make what we and our users would be satisfied with.

If you decide to integrate closer with Mistral we (Mistral team) can help. I believe some of the challenges you listed with regard to Mistral integration are either solved already or can be relatively easily solved (I just don't fully understand all of them). But the choice is up to you, of course.

Thanks"}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2017-06-06 07:19:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2017-06-07 05:34:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

extra parameters to execute commands in action etc.

commit_message:
Fix gnocchi_statsd and ceilometer_agent_ipmi healthcheck

- statsd is connecting to redis only when it receives a data,
  hence to avoid false negatives we will rather test if the service
  is listening on proper port

- ceilometer_agent_ipmi connects to Redis instead of Rabbit for coordination
  now.

Closes-Bug: #1781108
Change-Id: I4414bac82981c30ba6b7c1c8b406baa7a0900e5a
(cherry picked from commit 218065b63edd3a173089ea55ab008518b57b4386)

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I56099c2e073fdba3830ae53fa053c2daded8ada0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

messages: [{'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-07-19 16:58:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-07-19 18:42:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-07-19 19:35:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-07-19 20:34:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-07-19 23:08:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-07-19 23:08:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 16:58:34.000000000', 'message': "Use valid filters to list floating IPs in neutron

The test case used 'attached' as a filter for listing floating IPs,
but this is not a supported parameter in neutron. In before, the test
passed because neutron server ignored this parameter and returned
all the floating IPs. However, neutron is planing to employ a strict
validation on the list endpoint [1]. As a result, neutron will reject
the request with 400 response if the request contains unknown filter.

This patch fixes the usage of neutron API. It passes filters to neutron
API only if they are known supported filters. The list of supported
filters for listing floating IPs can be found in the neutron API
reference [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574907/
[2] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/#id130

Change-Id: I47eac210bd0364166647345ff14ea0c49ef4e9e3
"}, {'created': '2018-07-19 19:35:56.000000000', 'message': "Use valid filters to list floating IPs in neutron

OpenStackSDK used 'attached' as a filter for listing floating IPs,
but this is not a supported parameter in neutron. In before, the test
passed because neutron server ignored this parameter and returned
all the floating IPs. However, neutron is planing to employ a strict
validation on the list endpoint [1]. As a result, neutron will reject
the request with 400 response if the request contains unknown filter.

This patch fixes the usage of neutron API. It passes filters to neutron
API only if they are known supported filters. The list of supported
filters for listing floating IPs can be found in the neutron API
reference [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574907/
[2] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/#id130

Depends-On: I124adfc5e9cdd5bc20aacf23f9dcc10c55b0870b
Change-Id: I47eac210bd0364166647345ff14ea0c49ef4e9e3
"}]
commit_message:
Use valid filters to list floating IPs in neutron

OpenStackSDK used 'attached' as a filter for listing floating IPs,
but this is not a supported parameter in neutron. In before, the test
passed because neutron server ignored this parameter and returned
all the floating IPs. However, neutron is planing to employ a strict
validation on the list endpoint [1]. As a result, neutron will reject
the request with 400 response if the request contains unknown filter.

This patch fixes the usage of neutron API. It passes filters to neutron
API only if they are known supported filters. The list of supported
filters for listing floating IPs can be found in the neutron API
reference [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574907/
[2] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/#id130

Depends-On: I124adfc5e9cdd5bc20aacf23f9dcc10c55b0870b
Change-Id: I47eac210bd0364166647345ff14ea0c49ef4e9e3

commit_message:
Verify docker API version if runtime is specified

The 'runtime' parameter is supported in Docker API version 1.26
or later. This patch add a validation on this requirement.

In addition, this patch allows Zun to work with legacy Docker
API version if 'runtime' parameter is not specified.
Right now, Kolla is using Docker API version 1.24 so it requires
this fix to make it work.

Change-Id: I04fb640977bfb6e0e5771806c9327b347fe8ed48

commit_message:
Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- py3-dj111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Also, change basepython from python3.5 to python3 for docs and js jobs.

Change-Id: I04d3d4c3520150293951fb5e09e7d4513a1ca1ca

commit_message:
Use Tempest scenario job to run all scenario tests

Tempest has migrated the scenario job in Tempest
tree and renamed it to "tempest-scenario-all".[1]

This job runs all the Tempest scenario tests including
slow tests.

Old job running Tempest scenario test is running as experimental
in nova[2]. That job will be removed in favor of "tempest-scenario-all"

This new job "tempest-scenario-all" will run as voting on check pipeline
where old job was running as experimental. This is fine as we want to run
all scenario tests on nova to avoid any regression.

Tempest also run "tempest-scenario-all" as voting job.

Detailed discussion on ML[3].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/.zuul.yaml#n147
[2] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/zuul.d/projects.yaml#n9561
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130394.html

Change-Id: Iefb23c211f29190b73cfa8faaf62327c224a1661

commit_message:
Fix 'availability_zones' attribute not recognized when creating volume

Volume type's reserved key 'availability_zones' will not be
recognized if type is specified in source volume or snapshot.
This patch fixes this issue while refactor some codes regarding
collecting volume type from resource.

Change-Id: Ibe937d5a97d685f5d9c3f8c03c5c384bb02a6942

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-25 11:40:11.000000000', 'message': "Add minimum version and fix dulwich issue

Main changes:
- Add minimum version for requirements [1]
- Fix dulwich issue that broke py35 gate [2]

Trivial change:
- Re-format multi-line deps in tox.ini

---
requirements without minimum version definitaions may cause CI failure

Merge https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574367/ made requirements job
check for minimum version definitions, requirements without minimum version
may cause CI failure.

This patch sync the requirements with lower-constraints

---
Start using upper-constraints in tox venvs

Without this we are exposed to any breakages in dependencies, which
is currently blocking the repo because of a broken dulwich release.

Note that this required the removal of the explicit .[oslo_config]
requirement.  I'm not sure why that was there since it will be
pulled in by oslo.concurrency anyway and it broke the venv creation
when constraints were added.  Since I'm not sure why it was split
out as a separate thing I'm leaving the setup.cfg target but
removing it from tox.ini.

We also need to pin dulwich in lower-constraints, even though it's a
transitive dependency.  Otherwise the lower-constraints job installs
the broken latest version.

Transitive dependency that we need to pin due to
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1778004
---

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575691
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577462

Co-Authored-By: Kevin_Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ibfe5f460139849ba39b369321360f6f5a0e9e2a0
Closes-Bug: #1777083
Closes-Bug: #1778004
"}, {'created': '2018-06-25 12:01:13.000000000', 'message': "Add minimum version and fix dulwich issue

Main changes:
- Add minimum version for requirements [1]
- Fix dulwich issue that broke py35 gate [2]

Trivial changes:
- Re-format multi-line deps in tox.ini
- Verify and change constraints of pymongo, prettytable
  to match global requirements

---
requirements without minimum version definitaions may cause CI failure

Merge https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574367/ made requirements job
check for minimum version definitions, requirements without minimum version
may cause CI failure.

This patch sync the requirements with lower-constraints

---
Start using upper-constraints in tox venvs

Without this we are exposed to any breakages in dependencies, which
is currently blocking the repo because of a broken dulwich release.

Note that this required the removal of the explicit .[oslo_config]
requirement.  I'm not sure why that was there since it will be
pulled in by oslo.concurrency anyway and it broke the venv creation
when constraints were added.  Since I'm not sure why it was split
out as a separate thing I'm leaving the setup.cfg target but
removing it from tox.ini.

We also need to pin dulwich in lower-constraints, even though it's a
transitive dependency.  Otherwise the lower-constraints job installs
the broken latest version.

Transitive dependency that we need to pin due to
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1778004
---

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575691
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577462

Co-Authored-By: Kevin_Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: Ibfe5f460139849ba39b369321360f6f5a0e9e2a0
Closes-Bug: #1777083
Closes-Bug: #1778004
"}]
commit_message:
Add minimum version and fix dulwich issue

Main changes:
- Add minimum version for requirements [1]
- Fix dulwich issue that broke py35 gate [2]

Trivial changes:
- Re-format multi-line deps in tox.ini
- Verify and change constraints of pymongo, prettytable
  to match global requirements

---
requirements without minimum version definitaions may cause CI failure

Merge https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574367/ made requirements job
check for minimum version definitions, requirements without minimum version
may cause CI failure.

This patch sync the requirements with lower-constraints

---
Start using upper-constraints in tox venvs

Without this we are exposed to any breakages in dependencies, which
is currently blocking the repo because of a broken dulwich release.

Note that this required the removal of the explicit .[oslo_config]
requirement.  I'm not sure why that was there since it will be
pulled in by oslo.concurrency anyway and it broke the venv creation
when constraints were added.  Since I'm not sure why it was split
out as a separate thing I'm leaving the setup.cfg target but
removing it from tox.ini.

We also need to pin dulwich in lower-constraints, even though it's a
transitive dependency.  Otherwise the lower-constraints job installs
the broken latest version.

Transitive dependency that we need to pin due to
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1778004
---

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575691
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577462

Co-Authored-By: Kevin_Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ibfe5f460139849ba39b369321360f6f5a0e9e2a0
Closes-Bug: #1777083
Closes-Bug: #1778004

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 15:46:46.000000000', 'message': "Retry journal recording in L3

Since journal recording can fail, and is not run in the same
transaction as router/FIP operations, it will lead to the resource
(router or FIP) to remain altered while a journmal record hasn't been
created.

L3 Flavors should solve this issue comprehensively, but we need a
solution until it's stable, which can also be backported to stable
branches. Hence, this fix should address 99% or the cases.

Change-Id: Ibef0db9a58d86a85ffd948a35db983863999d319
Closes-Bug: #1738246
"}, {'created': '2018-06-18 11:04:32.000000000', 'message': "Retry journal recording in L3

Since journal recording can fail, and is not run in the same
transaction as router/FIP operations, it will lead to the resource
(router or FIP) to remain altered while a journmal record hasn't been
created.

L3 Flavors should solve this issue comprehensively, but we need a
solution until it's stable, which can also be backported to stable
branches. Hence, this fix should address 99% or the cases.

commit_message:
Retry journal recording in L3

Since journal recording can fail, and is not run in the same
transaction as router/FIP operations, it will lead to the resource
(router or FIP) to remain altered while a journmal record hasn't been
created.

L3 Flavors should solve this issue comprehensively, but we need a
solution until it's stable, which can also be backported to stable
branches. Hence, this fix should address 99% or the cases.

Change-Id: Ibef0db9a58d86a85ffd948a35db983863999d319
Closes-Bug: #1738246
(cherry picked from commit 19143fed7b975ee91bca67e64e3fb68f28bc9438)

commit_message:
Cleanup l3_odl_v2 code

Some cleanup in preparation for fixing bug #1738246:
 * Remove session.begin code since it doesn't actually do anything.
 * Simplify dependency list construction in delete_floatingip
 * Remove comment from rcurran since it's already handled
 * Remove get_floatingip mocking from tests set up since it doesn't do
   anything but will interfere with any proper testing (next patch).

Change-Id: I6e718d3943a0c958d6717ba242c069a855e07c83
Partial-Bug: #1738246
(cherry picked from commit 8c5551f2ba57a035090be1ac00f73a397d274a9e)

commit_message:
Drop legacy scenario multinode job from Tempest

The legacy job:
legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-scenario-multinode-lvm-multibackend
has been superseded by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580877/5
which uses ZuulV3.

So we should drop this job to reduce unnecessary consumption of
nodes.

Change-Id: I5b8df4f521cd3118fa26cbb4397e6d4f18133684

commit_message:
Limit deploy health checks to paunch managed ones

If an operator has non-paunch managed containers (ceph/openshift), we
may not want to fail the deployment if those are unhealthy.

Change-Id: Ifd3e67a66b3224d0ed5f7ef12ba27b06f78c8556

commit_message:
rocky: release os-traits 0.9.0

This release adds a helper method 'normalize_name' for consumers to use
if they generate names of traits dynamically, to ensure the names
conform to the restrictions on trait names in placement.

Change-Id: If1a86da99987143969ef6f96393bdfc6b0e21102

subject: [ingress] introduce keepalived sidecar for ingress vip
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6678, 'name': 'Hyunsun Moon', 'email': 'hyunsun.moon@gmail.com', 'username': 'hyunsun-moon'}, {'_account_id': 8181, 'name': 'Jaesuk Ahn', 'email': 'bluejay.ahn@gmail.com', 'username': 'blujeay.kr'}, {'_account_id': 8898, 'name': 'Chris Wedgwood', 'email': 'cw@f00f.org', 'username': 'anticw'}, {'_account_id': 16513, 'name': 'Seungkyu Ahn', 'email': 'seungkyua@gmail.com', 'username': 'seungkyu'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22477, 'name': 'Matt McEuen', 'email': 'matt.mceuen@att.com', 'username': 'mattmceuen'}, {'_account_id': 23928, 'name': 'Pete Birley', 'email': 'petebirley@gmail.com', 'username': 'portdirect'}, {'_account_id': 26201, 'name': 'AT&T Openstack-Helm CI', 'email': 'stacey.fletcher@att.com', 'username': 'ATT-OSH-CI'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-06-22 06:24:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-06-22 08:00:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-06-25 03:49:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-06-25 05:58:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

This is quite interesting, but as the ingress controller should be run as a daemonset, when managing host interfaces - do we get any value from this approach? If run as a deployment there's the possibility of a lot of mess being left on nodes, and unhealthy routes being left."}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-06-25 06:31:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> This is quite interesting, but as the ingress controller should be
 > run as a daemonset, when managing host interfaces - do we get any
 > value from this approach? If run as a deployment there's the
 > possibility of a lot of mess being left on nodes, and unhealthy
 > routes being left.

I guess fast failover is critical where ingress is the only access point to openstack services from external. As I described in commit message, it takes too long time to move the existing ingress pod to healthy node when node failure. keepalived ensures nearly immediate failover to another healthy ingress pod with this way.
I don't get "unhealthy routes" part..adding or removing vip is managed by keepalived very well.'}, {'account_id': 16513, 'date': '2018-06-25 12:27:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

A keepalived must have at least two instances to communicate through vrrp. In that sense, daemonset is the better way. If only one keepalived is running, the recovery time is equal to the node failover time. (I stopped the kubelet process and tested it with node notReay state)'}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-06-25 14:39:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I might misunderstood the first question, let me try answer again.
1) with the existing VIP approach, which restricts replica to 1, it takes unacceptable time to failover when node with the ingress pod fails.
2) with the proposed approach, keepalived container in an ingress pod ensures VIP is always owned by a healthy pod in a healthy node.
3) it works with 1 replica as existing VIP approach does, but to cover node failure scenario it requires at least 2 replicas regardless of deployment or daemonset (i did the test with 3 replicas).
4) i can confirm that there are no stale network states left when ingress pod removed.
5) it would be very thankful if you feel this idea cannot be merged, since i have to find out another way in a very short time frame for internal schedule.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-06-25 14:49:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I might misunderstood the first question, let me try answer again.
 > 1) with the existing VIP approach, which restricts replica to 1, it
 > takes unacceptable time to failover when node with the ingress pod
 > fails.
 > 2) with the proposed approach, keepalived container in an ingress
 > pod ensures VIP is always owned by a healthy pod in a healthy node.
 > 3) it works with 1 replica as existing VIP approach does, but to
 > cover node failure scenario it requires at least 2 replicas
 > regardless of deployment or daemonset (i did the test with 3
 > replicas).
 > 4) i can confirm that there are no stale network states left when
 > ingress pod removed.
 > 5) it would be very thankful if you feel this idea cannot be
 > merged, since i have to find out another way in a very short time
 > frame for internal schedule.

Ah - this explains a lot - thanks.

1) The current approach is typically used at present in combination with our calico chart to advertise the IP via BGP to a tor, effectively providing an ecmp address for the controllers which run as a DS, so we can run any number of ingress controllers.
(I hope this clarification answers points 2-4 as well)

5) I think we should be able to merge this, provided we allow users to select both the current method and yours - which is a great enhancement for people who don't have the ability to peer with their fabric. For us to do this I think we need to make the following changes:
 * - don't change the vip.manage to vip.enable - as this is in use by many deployments at present.
 * - allow the method to be selected, so we can deploy either the existing approach for scenarios where peering is possible and the keepalive approach for when it's not."}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-06-25 14:57:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-22 06:24:35.000000000', 'message': '[ingress] introduce keepalived sidecar for ingress vip

Current way of handling vip works but it takes too long time to
failover in host failure scenario, which is very critical.
Also, the constraint of 1 replicaset when vip is enabled is removed.
"vip.manage" is changed to "vip.enable" as well.

Change-Id: I7dd164134e18998d4d2688cb0618cc699a92d166
'}, {'created': '2018-06-22 08:00:09.000000000', 'message': '[ingress] introduce keepalived sidecar for ingress vip

Current way of handling vip works but when node fails, k8s waits for
pod_eviction_timeout before moving ingress pod to healthy node,
which takes 5min by default.
By running keepalived sidecar container, vip can be moved to healthy
host immediately.
Also, with this way, we can run multiple instance of ingress pod when
vip enabled.
Minor but changed "vip.manage" to "vip.enable".

Change-Id: I7dd164134e18998d4d2688cb0618cc699a92d166
'}, {'created': '2018-06-25 03:49:39.000000000', 'message': '[ingress] introduce keepalived sidecar for ingress vip

Current way of handling vip works but when node fails, k8s waits for
pod_eviction_timeout before moving ingress pod to healthy node,
which takes 5min by default.
By running keepalived sidecar container, vip can be moved to healthy
host immediately.
Also, with this way, we can run multiple instance of ingress pod when
vip enabled.
Minor but changed "vip.manage" to "vip.enable".

Change-Id: I7dd164134e18998d4d2688cb0618cc699a92d166

commit_message:
[ingress] introduce keepalived sidecar for ingress vip

Added new method of serving VIP with keepalived, which ensures
VIP is always owned by a healthy pod in a healthy node.
User can select prefered VIP method by setting "network.vip.mode"
to "keepalived" or "routed".

Change-Id: I7dd164134e18998d4d2688cb0618cc699a92d166
