(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2017-08-28 22:40:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

That's one way to think about it. I think the trouble is that regardless of what the flavor says, a boot-from-volume instance occupies no disk space, so it's not really correct to request it or report it that way. Resource providers will handle this eventually but it's been at least two cycles since I've tried proposing this stopgap solution. So this is something we could do in the meantime."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2017-08-29 08:12:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: -Code-Review

> That's one way to think about it. I think the trouble is that
 > regardless of what the flavor says, a boot-from-volume instance
 > occupies no disk space, so it's not really correct to request it or
 > report it that way. Resource providers will handle this eventually
 > but it's been at least two cycles since I've tried proposing this
 > stopgap solution. So this is something we could do in the meantime.

I feel that with this patch nova tries to be smarter than the user who selected the wrong flavor, and nova tries to correct the user's mistake by ignoring the disk part of the user selected flavor. I think it would be a lot cleaner change to simply reject the request, maybe with a HTTP 409, and let the user correct the request. In the other hand I understand that that would be an API change which complicates the situation.
Cheers,
gibi"}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2017-08-29 08:20:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2017-08-29 22:20:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

> I feel that with this patch nova tries to be smarter than the user
 > who selected the wrong flavor, and nova tries to correct the user's
 > mistake by ignoring the disk part of the user selected flavor. I
 > think it would be a lot cleaner change to simply reject the
 > request, maybe with a HTTP 409, and let the user correct the
 > request. In the other hand I understand that that would be an API
 > change which complicates the situation.

I understand where you're coming from. We're in a messy situation with boot-from-volume because it was added on later after flavors were designed. I think in the ideal world we'd have "composable flavors" (which we've discussed at design summit multiple times) where the flavor is only CPU and RAM and the other capabilities (boot-from-volume, NUMA, local disk, etc) are specified separately from the flavor. For example, "I want an instance with 4 CPUs and 8 GB RAM and X,Y,Z capabilities." So we wouldn't have "disk" tied to flavor and we could more properly support boot-from-volume, NUMA, and all the other things.

I think eventually we'll have a design like that but there's a lot of work to do until then.

The current situation for users is a bad usability experience. If their cloud isn't 100% boot-from-volume, they have to carry two sets of flavors: a set with 0 disk and a set with non-zero disk and train users when to pick which flavor and how to combine it with the --block-device part of the API request. This is why users and operators are pushing so hard for a solution here.

I think resource providers aims to be smarter than the user and detect boot-from-volume and Do The Right Thing with the request/claim/report. It's just the work hasn't progressed that far yet.

These patches have been around for awhile and would have been more appropriate a year ago when the first version of them were proposed. But, I keep rebasing them in case we can help people out for now and then phase it out when we have better support in resource providers.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2017-09-05 16:04:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15: Patch Set 14 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-05 18:28:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Verified+1

(1 comment)

I would want to see at least a couple of functional tests where this is all tied together across all of the services involved (nova-api, conductor, scheduler, compute) where we boot from volume and assert there are no DISK_GB allocations in placement for the instance against the compute host provider it lands on. We'd also want a functional test to assert that if we boot from volume but have swap and/or ephemeral disks attached, those swap/ephemeral disks would have DISK_GB allocations against the compute node provider but not the root_gb from the flavor."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-11 20:00:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-02 23:08:15.000000000', 'message': "Request zero root disk for boot-from-volume instances

We should not request any DISK_GB resource for boot-from-volume instances
that will not use it on their compute node. This is slightly ugly because
we're not communicating a very rich request to scheduler right now, and
thus scheduler has lost sight of the fact that an instance has a volume
as its root disk. Because we pass a copy of the flavor to scheduler
purely as the resource request, we can hack in our root_gb=0 there, which
will live only for that single RPC call.

Later, we need to pass more detail anyway so that scheduler can request
of placement resources available from the appropriate volume resource
provider (for example).

Change-Id: I4aec3700ff5bb9d50213e5827870ffcb13e44b7a

We should not request any DISK_GB resource for boot-from-volume instances
that will not use it on their compute node. This is slightly ugly because
we're not communicating a very rich request to scheduler right now, and
thus scheduler has lost sight of the fact that an instance has a volume
as its root disk. Because we pass a copy of the flavor to scheduler
purely as the resource request, we can hack in our root_gb=0 there, which
will live only for that single RPC call.

Later, we need to pass more detail anyway so that scheduler can request
of placement resources available from the appropriate volume resource
provider (for example).

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Partial-Bug: #1469179

commit_message:
Request zero root disk for boot-from-volume instances

We should not request any DISK_GB resource for boot-from-volume instances
that will not use it on their compute node. This is slightly ugly because
we're not communicating a very rich request to scheduler right now, and
thus scheduler has lost sight of the fact that an instance has a volume
as its root disk. Because we pass a copy of the flavor to scheduler
purely as the resource request, we can hack in our root_gb=0 there, which
will live only for that single RPC call.

Later, we need to pass more detail anyway so that scheduler can request
of placement resources available from the appropriate volume resource
provider (for example).

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Partial-Bug: #1469179

Change-Id: I4aec3700ff5bb9d50213e5827870ffcb13e44b7a

subject: Claim and report zero root disk for boot-from-volume instances

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-03 00:22:14.000000000', 'message': "WIP Add functional test for boot-from-volume instances

This is a test that verfies boot-from-volume instances flavor disk
isn't requested or claimed for scheduling against a compute host's
local disk.

Change-Id: Ifcb599fda8cda6baf256c9c5bdec4a6295d3e80c
"}, {'created': '2017-02-03 01:19:37.000000000', 'message': "WIP Add functional test for boot-from-volume instances

This is a test that verfies boot-from-volume instances flavor disk
isn't requested or claimed for scheduling against a compute host's
local disk.

Change-Id: Ifcb599fda8cda6baf256c9c5bdec4a6295d3e80c
"}, {'created': '2017-02-07 08:41:40.000000000', 'message': "Report zero root disk for boot-from-volume instances

We should not report local disk usage for boot-from-volume instances
that do not use it on their compute host.

This also includes a functional test that verfies:

  1. Boot-from-volume instance flavor disk isn't requested or claimed
     against a compute host's local disk during scheduling.

  2. Boot-from-volume instance flavor disk isn't reported as part of
     a compute host's local disk usage.

  3. Boot-from-volume instance flavor and request spec are not
     persisted to the database with root_gb = 0.

Change-Id: Ifcb599fda8cda6baf256c9c5bdec4a6295d3e80c
"}, {'created': '2017-02-08 06:48:21.000000000', 'message': "Claim and report zero root disk for boot-from-volume instances

We should not claim or report local disk usage for boot-from-volume
instances that do not use it on their compute host.

This also includes a functional test that verfies:

  1. Boot-from-volume instance flavor disk isn't requested or claimed
     against a compute host's local disk during scheduling.

  2. Boot-from-volume instance flavor disk isn't reported as part of
     a compute host's local disk usage.

  3. Boot-from-volume instance flavor and request spec are not
     persisted to the database with root_gb = 0.

Change-Id: Ifcb599fda8cda6baf256c9c5bdec4a6295d3e80c
"}, {'created': '2017-02-08 08:38:35.000000000', 'message': "Claim and report zero root disk for boot-from-volume instances

     against a compute host's local disk during scheduling.

Change-Id: Ifcb599fda8cda6baf256c9c5bdec4a6295d3e80c
"}, {'created': '2017-02-09 17:45:59.000000000', 'message': "Claim and report zero root disk for boot-from-volume instances

We should not claim or report local disk usage for boot-from-volume
instances that do not use it on their compute host.

This also includes a functional test that verfies:

  1. Boot-from-volume instance flavor disk isn't requested or claimed
     against a compute host's local disk during scheduling.
  2. Boot-from-volume instance flavor disk isn't reported as part of
     a compute host's local disk usage.
  3. Boot-from-volume instance flavor and request spec are not

commit_message:
Claim and report zero root disk for boot-from-volume instances

We should not claim or report local disk usage for boot-from-volume
instances that do not use it on their compute host.

This also includes a functional test that verfies:

  1. Boot-from-volume instance flavor disk isn't requested or claimed
     against a compute host's local disk during scheduling.
  2. Boot-from-volume instance flavor disk isn't reported as part of
     a compute host's local disk usage.
  3. Boot-from-volume instance flavor and request spec are not
     persisted to the database with root_gb = 0.

Closes-Bug: #1469179

Change-Id: Ifcb599fda8cda6baf256c9c5bdec4a6295d3e80c

commit_message:
Move l3_notifier check in remove_router_from_l3_agent()

If there is no notifier to be called, then we can skip
some work.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I90feaf1c93c05937f3331fa2cdfda24cd4c9c37c

commit_message:
Bump lower constraint for pysaml2 to 4.5.0

Known moderate severity security vulnerability detected in pysaml2
<=4.4.0. Let's bump our requirements pass the versions with known
vulnerabilities.

Change-Id: I235062eace1fa9f581018f2eec519f3cbea11ef7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-06 15:14:44.000000000', 'message': 'GoodnessWeigher schedules non-type volumes

If the GoodnessWeigher is configured to be the only active weigher within
the scheduler, it cannot schedule a non-typed volumed for creation. This
patch adds a safety assignement to the weigher stats generation to allow
for scheduling untyped volumes.

This patch safely assigns a dictionary data-type to "volume_type" in the
event that:

    weight_properties = {
        "volume_type": None,
        etc..
    }

Volumes created with a volume-type will not cause an exception and will
be scheduled with the volume-type and back-end as configured.

Closes-Bug: 1766966

Change-Id: I7bc77ab02154aee80282e54b19a242bdea0a78ec
Signed-off-by: Eric M Gonzalez <eric@awnix.com>
(cherry picked from commit 34d75ca1a6eea03bc0fe856bf1a63e7d8d60f024)
(cherry picked from commit a02126af7933ae4d5356bc6fa2e3422854ba2838)
'}]
commit_message:
GoodnessWeigher schedules non-type volumes

If the GoodnessWeigher is configured to be the only active weigher within
the scheduler, it cannot schedule a non-typed volumed for creation. This
patch adds a safety assignement to the weigher stats generation to allow
for scheduling untyped volumes.

This patch safely assigns a dictionary data-type to "volume_type" in the
event that:

    weight_properties = {
        "volume_type": None,
        etc..
    }

Volumes created with a volume-type will not cause an exception and will
be scheduled with the volume-type and back-end as configured.

Closes-Bug: 1766966

Change-Id: I7bc77ab02154aee80282e54b19a242bdea0a78ec
Signed-off-by: Eric M Gonzalez <eric@awnix.com>
(cherry picked from commit 34d75ca1a6eea03bc0fe856bf1a63e7d8d60f024)
(cherry picked from commit a02126af7933ae4d5356bc6fa2e3422854ba2838)

commit_message:
Use latest Ubuntu 16.04 LTS guest image.

The release we are using is more than a year old, let's update to a
recent release in order to make sure we stay up to date.

Change-Id: Ie0f5266707483a69ea8d6d4f63ca39f26552fc24
Co-Authored-By: Luong Anh Tuan <tuanla@vn.fujitsu.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-24 10:31:29.000000000', 'message': 'Allow to connect to SSH server using an intermediate SSH server

For debugging purposes it could be handy to execute tests
on your workstation and connect test instances via SSH passing
throw an intermediate SSH server.

This allow to configure in tempest.conf an intermediate
SSH client connection to be used from tests to create SSH
connections to VMs.

Example of configuration in tempest.conf:

  [neutron_plugin_options]
  ssh_proxy_jump_host = some.ssh.server
  ssh_proxy_jump_username = root
  # ssh_proxy_jump_password = # better using keys
  proxy_jump_keyfile = ~/.ssh/id_rsa
  proxy_jump_port = 22

Change-Id: Icae73c2cddbdcd8da2b4cdb07a7027791642c6a8

commit_message:
Allow to connect to SSH server using an intermediate SSH server

For debugging purposes it could be handy to execute tests
on your workstation and connect test instances via SSH passing
throw an intermediate SSH server.

This allow to configure in tempest.conf an intermediate
SSH client connection to be used from tests to create SSH
connections to VMs.

Example of configuration in tempest.conf:

  [neutron_plugin_options]
  ssh_proxy_jump_host = some.ssh.server
  ssh_proxy_jump_username = root
  # ssh_proxy_jump_password = # better using keys
  proxy_jump_keyfile = ~/.ssh/id_rsa
  proxy_jump_port = 22

Change-Id: Icae73c2cddbdcd8da2b4cdb07a7027791642c6a8

With this change it works.

the subsequent ovs-vsctl calls failed (seen in the logs).

commit_message:
Migration: process port names properly during migration

Without this fix the "$port" weren't properly cleaned up, and
the subsequent ovs-vsctl calls failed (seen in the logs).

With this change it works.

Change-Id: I7acfc5ce7f584d99d4e4e041531191b6fd4e71ec

subject: Fix inconsistency
messages:
[{'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-06-06 13:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-06-06 13:36:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Not a typo.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2018-06-06 13:39:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Agree.  None of these are actual typos.'}, {'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-06-06 13:47:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Not a typo.
Please check out this line:
https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/v2/shell.py#L4818
Then we have two lines with different choices of wording to convey the same kind of information. We have to stick to one of them, don't we?"}, {'account_id': 23913, 'date': '2018-06-06 13:57:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

When I think about it... wouldn't it be "migrate off of" instead of "migrate off" ?'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2018-06-06 14:57:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Honestly, all 3 forms are acceptable English.  "migrate off" is a little more informal than "migrate off of", but English is weird that way.  In the face of that, we reviewers tend to fall back to what causes the least amount of churn, which is no change at all.  Consistency would be nice, but I think reducing churn, in this case, is the more important consideration, which is why I've voted the way I have.'}, {'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-06-07 06:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Honestly, all 3 forms are acceptable English.  "migrate off" is a
 > little more informal than "migrate off of", but English is weird
 > that way.  In the face of that, we reviewers tend to fall back to
 > what causes the least amount of churn, which is no change at all. 
 > Consistency would be nice, but I think reducing churn, in this
 > case, is the more important consideration, which is why I've voted
 > the way I have.

Thanks for clearing things. But still I would like to say consistency in this case is necessary, since the inconsistent part is exposed to the user in an obvious way through the client interface.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-07-18 13:22:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

There is inconsistency certainly.

stack@devstack-master:~$ nova --version
10.3.0
stack@devstack-master:~$ nova help | grep migrate
    host-evacuate-live          Live migrate all instances of the specified
    host-servers-migrate        Cold migrate all instances off the specified
    migrate                     Migrate a server.

"Live migrate all instances of" and "Cold migrate all instances off".
So how about fixing "Live migrate all instances of"?
(change it to "Live migrate all instances off")

https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/32a3244bb4879f5c0ea430de6fac284b2a987441/novaclient/v2/shell.py#L4890'}, {'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-07-19 06:33:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-07-19 06:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-07-19 06:44:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Allow a bypass of operating system

Without this patch, it is impossible to deploy an OpenStack-Ansible
cloud on an unsupported operating system.

This is a problem, as an experienced developer cannot bypass this check
when working on an experimental OS.

This patch solves the problem by creating a variable to determine if
tests should run, and run the OS test by default.

Change-Id: Icf70f32826cd096ec65309aff47ca5d5c01f57cc

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 15:41:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the doc CI failure

CI job now uses pip >= 10.0.0 to install the package.

In pip >= 10.0.0, if the package name is missing, the command
"pip install -U" returns error, but in pip < 10.0.0 it
just logs warning.

So this patch make sure the package name exists first.

Change-Id: Id900640a7133f837ece8c6c0e7d2e4c17665a53d
(cherry picked from commit ad10c32a89b770c08e8c21f65d2ddc961e1e6d48)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the doc CI failure

CI job now uses pip >= 10.0.0 to install the package.

In pip >= 10.0.0, if the package name is missing, the command
"pip install -U" returns error, but in pip < 10.0.0 it
just logs warning.

So this patch make sure the package name exists first.

Change-Id: Id900640a7133f837ece8c6c0e7d2e4c17665a53d
(cherry picked from commit ad10c32a89b770c08e8c21f65d2ddc961e1e6d48)

commit_message:
python3: fix netlink_lib delete_entries

libc and netfilter_conntrack calls, as C bindings, do not work with
python3 strings.
This fixes netlink_lib by using bytes type for addresses manipulation.
Update corresponding unit test by removing str() conversions.

Closes-bug: #1779170
Change-Id: Id1ddc6cdf6b6c094eaac8284193606d765de4295

commit_message:
Run scenario009 for more services

We should test scenario009 when services like mistral, haproxy and
keepalived are modified as these have a direct impact either in the
deployment or openshift's architecture.

Change-Id: I40313aa79c22fca0e53ae398807b8d2b0ac7269b

commit_message:
Check for neutron_plugin_ml2_ansible service when including plugin

We would not want ansible ml2 plugin configured for roles unless
neutron_plugin_ml2_ansible service is enabled. Check services_names
before including neutron puppet manifest.

Change-Id: Ia36c62a6b7c234dd31912a8289bb1b1e4b4698fb

commit_message:
Fix docs builds

This is a squash of two commits, which is required to fix two separate
issues on the stable/pike branch.

First:

Fix docs builds

With the new way of generating docs in the gate[1] our autodoc builds
are slightly broken. Put the required dependencies for doc building and
autodoc generation into doc/requirements.txt. We can also now remove
docs-related requirements from test-requirements.txt.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

(cherry picked from commit ba9c1a3bec7b7c06dfbb3392b56f789752696a66)

Second:

Fix the doc CI failure

CI job now uses pip >= 10.0.0 to install the package.

In pip >= 10.0.0, if the package name is missing, the command
"pip install -U" returns error, but in pip < 10.0.0 it
just logs warning.

So this patch make sure the package name exists first.

(cherry picked from commit ad10c32a89b770c08e8c21f65d2ddc961e1e6d48)

Co-authored-by: wangxiyuan <wangxiyuan@huawei.com>

Change-Id: Ifbd16fe364bb216821125c70bb7d3ab0ac1f10a3

subject: Remove useless group var
messages: [{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-18 13:08:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-18 13:45:55.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from tempest_git_repo to cleanup_tempest'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-18 13:46:05.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from cleanup_tempest to latest_tempest'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-18 14:44:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-19 20:39:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-07-19 20:42:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 13:08:47.000000000', 'message': 'Remove useless group var

Since we moved to install tempest from pip packages,
this variable can go away:

The tempest_git_repo group var is applied when:
- The user builds tempest from source instead of from pip packages
- The user wants to use developer mode for tempest.

For the first case, any override in user space of the user
(extra var, group var) would override the group var value,
making it completely useless.

For the second case, if a deployer wants to use developer mode,
this var would override the defaults of the role, which would
probably be an inconvenience for the deployer: the deployer
would then need to override tempest_developer_constraints, or
override the tempest_git_repo itself. That inconvenience can
be removed if the group_var is removed.

Change-Id: Iec8973105686d448b0284cbaeab625a897066664
'}]
commit_message:
Remove useless group var

Since we moved to install tempest from pip packages,
this variable can go away:

The tempest_git_repo group var is applied when:
- The user builds tempest from source instead of from pip packages
- The user wants to use developer mode for tempest.

For the first case, any override in user space of the user
(extra var, group var) would override the group var value,
making it completely useless.

For the second case, if a deployer wants to use developer mode,
this var would override the defaults of the role, which would
probably be an inconvenience for the deployer: the deployer
would then need to override tempest_developer_constraints, or
override the tempest_git_repo itself. That inconvenience can
be removed if the group_var is removed.

Change-Id: Iec8973105686d448b0284cbaeab625a897066664

commit_message:
Check alarm state just after the PUT

This reduces the chance to have Aodh evaluator to changing our alarm
state between our PUT and GET.

Change-Id: I6ceeb9b605c50a54116ff3bfdd9673bfd5beeccf

commit_message:
[FWaaS v1] RPC listener should be served by rpc worker

In effort to support deploying neutron-api under uwsgi, there is
an error related to FWaaS as [1]. Therefore this patch fixed that
for FWaaS v1.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131722.html

Partially-implements: blueprint run-in-wsgi-server
Change-Id: I3f3309805f48c0c52709e29b4ff6fa5b5a5a4628

commit_message:
Fix KeystoneMiddleware memcachepool abstraction

Keystonemiddleware's abstraction for the memcache pool was broken
when converting to use a queue.Queue. The logic that placed the
connection back into the pool was moved to .acquire and the reserve
method was not using acquire.

Change-Id: I0eda5981cbb661f63790258cf8e70c7340615159
Closes-Bug: #1782404

subject: Use valid filters to list floating IPs in neutron
messages: [{'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-07-19 19:30:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-07-19 20:33:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 19:30:16.000000000', 'message': "Use valid filters to list floating IPs in neutron

Shade used 'attached' as a filter for listing floating IPs,
but this is not a supported parameter in neutron. In before, the test
passed because neutron server ignored this parameter and returned
all the floating IPs. However, neutron is planing to employ a strict
validation on the list endpoint [1]. As a result, neutron will reject
the request with 400 response if the request contains unknown filter.

This patch fixes the usage of neutron API. It passes filters to neutron
API only if they are known supported filters. The list of supported
filters for listing floating IPs can be found in the neutron API
reference [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574907/
[2] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/#id130

Change-Id: I124adfc5e9cdd5bc20aacf23f9dcc10c55b0870b
"}]
commit_message:
Use valid filters to list floating IPs in neutron

Shade used 'attached' as a filter for listing floating IPs,
but this is not a supported parameter in neutron. In before, the test
passed because neutron server ignored this parameter and returned
all the floating IPs. However, neutron is planing to employ a strict
validation on the list endpoint [1]. As a result, neutron will reject
the request with 400 response if the request contains unknown filter.

This patch fixes the usage of neutron API. It passes filters to neutron
API only if they are known supported filters. The list of supported
filters for listing floating IPs can be found in the neutron API
reference [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574907/
[2] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/#id130

Change-Id: I124adfc5e9cdd5bc20aacf23f9dcc10c55b0870b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-25 16:06:34.000000000', 'message': 'Improve nova statedir ownership logic

The nova_compute container kolla config is currently set to recursively change
the ownership of /var/lib/nova to nova:nova on startup.

This is necessary when upgrading from an non-container deployment to a
containerized deployment as the nova uids are not consistent across the host
and container image.

While this is incorrect for VM disks (owned by qemu) and console logs (owned
by root), it does not appear to have an adverse side-effects on local storage
as open file handles remain valid.
However if the nova instancedir is an NFS mount then open filehandles are
broken and every VM using that NFS export fails with I/O errors.

This change re-implements the nova statedir ownership logic to target only the
files/directories contolled by nova.

Change-Id: I57d421feb6356d28002e77fb9bfa50a397758cbf
Closes-bug: 1778465

commit_message:
Improve nova statedir ownership logic

The nova_compute container kolla config is currently set to recursively change
the ownership of /var/lib/nova to nova:nova on startup.

This is necessary when upgrading from an non-container deployment to a
containerized deployment as the nova uids are not consistent across the host
and container image.

If the nova instancedir is an NFS mount then open filehandles are
broken and every VM using that NFS export fails with I/O errors.

This change re-implements the nova statedir ownership logic to target only the
files/directories controlled by nova.

Requires dist-git change: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/14734

Change-Id: I57d421feb6356d28002e77fb9bfa50a397758cbf
Closes-bug: 1778465

commit_message:
Make it possible to run functional tests again

When running tox -e functional, stestr was running the unit tests.
Changing .stestr.conf to use ${OS_TEST_PATH} seems to fix it. Two
functional tests were not passing when I made this change, so I
fixed those as well so this change wouldn't fail the gate.

Change-Id: I6c4a3ff7a50aca925dca1d7f9cfe83e99fedaa50

[{'created': '2018-07-19 16:04:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the doc CI failure

CI job now uses pip >= 10.0.0 to install the package.

In pip >= 10.0.0, if the package name is missing, the command
"pip install -U" returns error, but in pip < 10.0.0 it
just logs warning.

So this patch make sure the package name exists first.

Change-Id: Id900640a7133f837ece8c6c0e7d2e4c17665a53d
(cherry picked from commit ad10c32a89b770c08e8c21f65d2ddc961e1e6d48)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the doc CI failure

CI job now uses pip >= 10.0.0 to install the package.

In pip >= 10.0.0, if the package name is missing, the command
"pip install -U" returns error, but in pip < 10.0.0 it
just logs warning.

So this patch make sure the package name exists first.

Change-Id: Id900640a7133f837ece8c6c0e7d2e4c17665a53d
(cherry picked from commit ad10c32a89b770c08e8c21f65d2ddc961e1e6d48)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 10:50:20.000000000', 'message': "Ensure get-pip is not used when good version of pip is present

This is a combined backport of three commits to make sure
get-pip will be skipped if an appropriate version of pip is
present.

By skipping get-pip, no downgrade of pip will happen on the
hosts, leading to issues like the bug here.

Here are the commits:
tests: Do not always fetch the get-pip.py script during tests

Since we are testing the idempotence of this role, we shouldn't
fetch the get-pip.py script on every iteration so we set the variable
to 'false'. Moreover, we bump the PIP version to 9.0.3 since this is
what is currently being deployed on the hosts. Finally, get-pip.py
uses --force-reinstall by default which means that everything is being
reinstalled all the time and this breaks idempotence. We can fix that by
simply checking if a suitable version of PIP is installed and then use
it to do a proper upgrade.

---

tasks: main: Fix conditional for PIP script

The conditional must search the 'stdout' item to find the string we
are looking for.

---

Ensure the fallback uses the same install method

We have a test to ensure the install method of pip is from distro
or get-pip. But if an issue appeared in the first task, the
fallback method will automatically fallback to get-pip instead
of fallback to the isolated version of the pre-defined CLI.

This should ensure consistency by not using get-pip if it's not
needed.

---

(cherry picked from commit 40373daf7e27ab8cef00611945acf68c3e86fe82)
(cherry picked from commit fe5d99228bb756a28fb433b4a734d1e604eb0482)
(cherry picked from commit b6024a918442c0f89e207e496f497d14a8d55ba1)

Change-Id: Ia6efeb278fd7a7ec32b9a48c8b3e44197afe182c
Related-Bug: 1782051
Related-Bug: 1779534

commit_message:
Ensure get-pip is not used when good version of pip is present

This is a combined backport of three commits to make sure
get-pip will be skipped if an appropriate version of pip is
present.

By skipping get-pip, no downgrade of pip will happen on the
hosts, leading to issues like the bug here.

Here are the commits:
tests: Do not always fetch the get-pip.py script during tests

Since we are testing the idempotence of this role, we shouldn't
fetch the get-pip.py script on every iteration so we set the variable
to 'false'. Moreover, we bump the PIP version to 9.0.3 since this is
what is currently being deployed on the hosts. Finally, get-pip.py
uses --force-reinstall by default which means that everything is being
reinstalled all the time and this breaks idempotence. We can fix that by
simply checking if a suitable version of PIP is installed and then use
it to do a proper upgrade.

---

tasks: main: Fix conditional for PIP script

The conditional must search the 'stdout' item to find the string we
are looking for.

---

Ensure the fallback uses the same install method

We have a test to ensure the install method of pip is from distro
or get-pip. But if an issue appeared in the first task, the
fallback method will automatically fallback to get-pip instead
of fallback to the isolated version of the pre-defined CLI.

This should ensure consistency by not using get-pip if it's not
needed.

---

(cherry picked from commit 40373daf7e27ab8cef00611945acf68c3e86fe82)
(cherry picked from commit fe5d99228bb756a28fb433b4a734d1e604eb0482)
(cherry picked from commit b6024a918442c0f89e207e496f497d14a8d55ba1)

Change-Id: Ia6efeb278fd7a7ec32b9a48c8b3e44197afe182c
Related-Bug: 1782051
Related-Bug: 1779534

commit_message:
Add convenience parameters to create_network.

It adds convenience parameters to crete_network method:
- external -> shortcut to router:external
- provider_network_type -> shorcut to provider:network_type
- provider_physical_network -> shortcut to provider:phyiscal_network
- provider_segmentation_id -> shortcut to provider:segmentation_id

When client is not provider and admin_client is attribute is not None
(for example when using BaseAdminNetworkTest base class) and using any
of the convenience parameters it silently uses admin_client. If the
network is not shared then it uses the same project_id as regular
client.

It also add delete_network to help deleting networks
created with other clients than cls.client.

When admin_client attribute is not None (for exemble when using
BaseAdminNetworkTest base class), for convenience it
silently uses admin_client when required, while using the same
project ID as regular client when network is not shared.

Change-Id: I1ef57c518c137f1dbbd3e345b48afe9a35b10904

commit_message:
Add server IDs on multinode test log

test_create_server_with_scheduler_hint_group_anti_affinity fails
on the gate, but it is difficult to debug the issue because of less
server IDs on the log.
This adds the IDs to the log.

Change-Id: I88f1f02301e2fc22460a302d58ef4d885c21c5cf
Related-Bug: #1782002

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 04:57:22.000000000', 'message': "Pass list rather than a generator for reversing

Running new-release errors out with:
  TypeError: 'generator' object is not reversible
Fix that by forcing the generator into a list

In addition treat the whole reversed list as a list to avoid:
  AttributeError: 'list_reverseiterator' object has no attribute 'index'

Change-Id: Ia8720142b921f91d3f83100553aade239817857d
"}]
commit_message:
Pass list rather than a generator for reversing

Running new-release errors out with:
  TypeError: 'generator' object is not reversible
Fix that by forcing the generator into a list

In addition treat the whole reversed list as a list to avoid:
  AttributeError: 'list_reverseiterator' object has no attribute 'index'

Change-Id: Ia8720142b921f91d3f83100553aade239817857d

> Hi Sahid, plz refer to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577438/ for the discussion with Nova team. I think we've already had many discussions with key people in the Nova team already :) And what Zhenghao implements here reflected that discussion.

Thanks for the link. I commented on it. I don't see any consensus from folks involved on drivers.

It is clear for me that there is not point to have something else than the driver to update guest configuration like I don't see the point to make os-acc libvirt centrist."}, {'account_id': 17813, 'date': '2018-07-19 11:22:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 17813, 'date': '2018-07-19 13:14:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

In order to make the non-client lib release, we make exception to move this to land. Further modifications are welcomed.'}, {'account_id': 27458, 'date': '2018-07-19 20:01:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-07-19 20:03:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

I fail to see how this library has anything to do with "accelerators", really. The plugin interface is just to attach/detach a device. Any device. That's so generic that this could essentially be os-device-plugin and not os-acc. I'm wondering what the FPGA and GPU-specific things will be in this library?

Also, I would advise being more generic about certain things in the public interfaces. Instead of calling attributes "pcie_address", just call the attribute "address" and have the plugin interpret the field accordingly.'}]

commit_message:
Init os-acc

1.Imply os-acc to attach or detach accelerator.
2.This implementation couples with libvirt, we must improve
  it later.
3.Here is a patch of nova. I hope it can help to review this
  commit.
  https://github.com/wangzh1993/openstack_patch/tree/master/cyborg-os_acc-nova-patch/nova
4.Add UT
5.Remove unnecessary file.
6.Remove unused config in tox.

Change-Id: I140cb63549dbe2f70ac84122c569564193001e18

Version 3.2 has a bug with it on some systems that can result in the
following stacktrace: [ http://paste.openstack.org/show/726064 ]. To
correct this issue the version of the get-pip script has been set to 3.3
which does not suffer from the same issue.

commit_message:
Update get-pip to version 3.3

Version 3.2 has a bug with it on some systems that can result in the
following stacktrace: [ http://paste.openstack.org/show/726064 ]. To
correct this issue the version of the get-pip script has been set to 3.3
which does not suffer from the same issue.

Change-Id: Iaa824cc64bd0e8bdfdda4de243d80400f1529e8c
Closes-Bug: #1779534
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'created': '2018-07-18 13:45:17.000000000', 'message': 'Make master branch to install HEAD of tempest master

This is a hack workaround in gates to:
- Keep the same behavior as currently when not on master branch
  (installing tempest from pip packages)
- Install master of tempest without using enabling the
  repo build for everyone, until a new version of tempest
  is released with the patch [1] included.

Without this patch, all the sha bumps of keystone would fail in
tempest, as there are discrepencies between latest keystone
and 18.0.0 tempest.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/7d2b636a30057ed8db8cfd4fe2248f509b3570f1

Change-Id: I431c56d622dcbdb7752e6891815c527d30a93fb6
'}]
commit_message:
Make master branch to install HEAD of tempest master

This is a hack workaround in gates to:
- Keep the same behavior as currently when not on master branch
  (installing tempest from pip packages)
- Install master of tempest without using enabling the
  repo build for everyone, until a new version of tempest
  is released with the patch [1] included.

Without this patch, all the sha bumps of keystone would fail in
tempest, as there are discrepencies between latest keystone
and 18.0.0 tempest.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/7d2b636a30057ed8db8cfd4fe2248f509b3570f1

Change-Id: I431c56d622dcbdb7752e6891815c527d30a93fb6

This would introduce a new up-call from computes to the controller services (API DB is needed for aggregates), so like the #4 up-call here:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/cellsv2-layout.html#operations-requiring-upcalls

Ideally if we could resolve the #5 issue there then we can also fix this one.

Or if we simply moved volume creation to conductor rather than compute, but that's a lot more work (but likely something we should be doing anyway)."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-11 23:02:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

One idea for fixing this would be to set the AZ for each host in the list of Selection objects that come back from the scheduler - that happens at "the top" where we have access to the API DB and thus the aggregates table.

We send the list of Selection objects down to the compute service which, during boot from volume where nova creates the volume, could be used to specify the compute host AZ for the volume.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-11 23:03:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Also, is this fixed by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/446053/ since Pike now?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-11 23:12:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I think this has likely been fixed since Pike. I'll bring up a devstack environment to try and recreate to make sure."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-12 13:38:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Huh, well it looks like this doesn't work in a default devstack setup (without this patch):

http://paste.openstack.org/show/725704/"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-12 14:08:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> Huh, well it looks like this doesn't work in a default devstack setup (without this patch):

That CantStartEngineError is due to the up-call to get the host aggregate, so a different problem, but I didn't think we'd need to make that call to get the aggregates because the instance.availability_zone should already be set and instance.host should also be set by the time we hit that code."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-12 14:16:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Once I gave access to the api database from the cell conductor for the up call the server create passes and the volume is created in the same AZ (nova):

http://paste.openstack.org/show/725715/

So that seems to indicate this is fixed provided the cell can hit the API DB (which is a known separate issue).'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-12 14:36:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Also, I put some debug logging into the conductor code after the scheduler picks a host and we set the instance.availability_zone:

Jul 12 14:26:04 rocky nova-conductor[5805]: INFO nova.conductor.manager [None req-500f823f-1e48-4a9e-a776-d2b9c77b8dd2 demo demo] [instance: 002cd6fa-a168-4bfa-a3dc-65c1e4b19469] Set instance AZ to nova for selected host: rocky
stack@rocky:~$'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-12 14:37:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Now I just need to figure out why the get_instance_availability_zone method is making the up-call to the API DB to get the host aggregate info.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-12 15:08:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-12 15:20:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-12 15:22:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-2

I've marked bug 1497253 as fixed since pike."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-19 20:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
block_device: fix propagation of instance AZ to Cinder

When choosing an AZ for a volume to be created an instance host must
be considered, as it effectively defines the AZ the instance was
scheduled to.

The value of availability_zone attribute of the instance object, that
is used now, is actually a different thing - it's the AZ requested by
a user on creation of the instance and it will be None, if any
particular AZ was chosen. In this case, Cinder will use its own
default (not aligned with Nova one), which may break volume
attachment, if cross zone attachment is disabled.

Closes-Bug: #1497253

Change-Id: Ic8693c143dd61c5d61e9676e3915a3278a8af10b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 20:16:46.000000000', 'message': "Pin get-pip.py to 3.2

As get-pip.py evolves based on pip 10, while we're still using
pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to
pip 7.1.2 which fulfills our needs.

Change-Id: I96228099c8087ffaad8673184aa0bdddfb44023d
(cherry picked from commit 15c12437a2bc9d51814fc9aa840fff480c133934)
"}]
commit_message:
Pin get-pip.py to 3.2

As get-pip.py evolves based on pip 10, while we're still using
pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to
pip 7.1.2 which fulfills our needs.

Change-Id: I96228099c8087ffaad8673184aa0bdddfb44023d
(cherry picked from commit 15c12437a2bc9d51814fc9aa840fff480c133934)

commit_message:
Pin get-pip.py to 3.2

As get-pip.py evolves based on pip 10, while we're still using
pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to
pip 7.1.2 which fulfills our needs.

Change-Id: I96228099c8087ffaad8673184aa0bdddfb44023d

commit_message:
Limit formatting routes when adding resources

By default, routes.mapper.Mapper.resource adds a bunch of formatted
routes that accept anything after a '.'. Our spec says only .xml
and .json are accepted so limit the formatting to those valuse.

This allows identifiers with a '.' in urls. A few tests were added
to the extensions test to prove that .xml and .json are stripped
but other values are not.

It is already modified in cinder [1].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1307956

Change-Id: I91d8aa967446b5d7ce52f1b245149304494777f3
Closes-bug: #1774353
(cherry picked from commit 3c37b942e73937c854b6ffa0e1e15164673ae1f1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 11:46:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix post-execution for tempest tests

Manila's post_test_hook runs tempest after
populating tempest.conf with the requisite
options, the results from tempest are saved
prior to performing some post tasks, including
deciding to run tests again with a different
configuration if necessary
(Ex: manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-dummy). The
result is then replayed at the end of the gate
job so it can be reported to gerrit as a
SUCCESS or a FAILURE.

Fix the mis-aligned command that saves the
test execution status to replay later.

Change-Id: I1578760697aeae6e20bf567c60fbcdee0a642bee
Closes-Bug: 1770183
(cherry picked from commit a0947ab42d9f37236c1f0784bd39346b04f8b6a8)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix post-execution for tempest tests

Manila's post_test_hook runs tempest after
populating tempest.conf with the requisite
options, the results from tempest are saved
prior to performing some post tasks, including
deciding to run tests again with a different
configuration if necessary
(Ex: manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-dummy). The
result is then replayed at the end of the gate
job so it can be reported to gerrit as a
SUCCESS or a FAILURE.

Fix the mis-aligned command that saves the
test execution status to replay later.

Change-Id: I1578760697aeae6e20bf567c60fbcdee0a642bee
Closes-Bug: 1770183
(cherry picked from commit a0947ab42d9f37236c1f0784bd39346b04f8b6a8)

[{'created': '2018-07-17 16:09:30.000000000', 'message': 'Update get-pip to version 3.3

Version 3.2 has a bug with it on some systems that can result in the
following stacktrace: [ http://paste.openstack.org/show/726064 ]. To
correct this issue the version of the get-pip script has been set to 3.3
which does not suffer from the same issue.

Change-Id: Ib551c8627351ba23d3c1a67a9631f58fdd2157a7
'}]
commit_message:
Update get-pip to version 3.3

Version 3.2 has a bug with it on some systems that can result in the
following stacktrace: [ http://paste.openstack.org/show/726064 ]. To
correct this issue the version of the get-pip script has been set to 3.3
which does not suffer from the same issue.

Change-Id: Ib551c8627351ba23d3c1a67a9631f58fdd2157a7

commit_message:
Only run rolling upgrade for neutron, vpnaas, fwaas

Due to only neutron, vpnass and fwaas have supported for rolling upgrade
database migration, this patch set add --subproject argument to limited
the upgrade to these.

Co-Authored-By: Ha Manh Dong <donghm@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I007e0068622fd630eb9f2f29b604015376ae7cd3
Implements: blueprint apply-service-upgrade-procedure

commit_message:
Clarify Zuul Ram and HDD usage graphs

Make it clear that these values are percentages. We update labels to
convey that and scale the values so that we get 71% instead of 7.145.

Change-Id: I64bb9cfa536c2ba395be0264839a7a50929d7477

commit_message:
Add conductor_group field to config, node and conductor objects

Adds the fields and bumps the objects versions. Excludes the field from
the node API for now.

Also adds the conductor_group config option, and populates the field in
the conductors table.

Also fixes a fundamentally broken test in ironic.tests.unit.db.test_api.

Change-Id: Ice2f90f7739b2927712ed45c969865136a216bd6
Story: 2001795
Task: 22640
Task: 22642

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9312, 'date': '2017-12-26 10:28:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-06-19 16:40:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

WIP because this needs unit tests.

It would be nice to get it in though.  The reason the rule check is getting run frequently is that we call load_rules on every enforce call: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.policy/blob/9fbbda81f10f81ff691eca102b61646e70b7042b/oslo_policy/policy.py#L808

Mostly that's a noop because it just reloads rules from cache, but because caching doesn't apply to the check_rules call it gets run in all its glory every time.  I think the logic in this change is correct, but again we should have unit tests to confirm that.

I can't say that I'm seeing this poor performance locally, but that's with stock policy rules.  If someone had a more complex policy I could see it being more of a problem."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-06-19 19:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-06-19 19:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Avoid redundant policy syntax checks

Introduce a private variable inside Enforcer class to remember
status of the last policy syntax checks in order to avoid
redundant calls to the check_rules() method.

Having this flag makes the whole rules mechanism faster, as under
certain conditions check_rules() method was being executed
multiple times even when not needed.

commit_message:
create stable/rocky branch for neutron-lib

This patch adds the 'branches' section to the neutron-lib rocky
deliverable using neutron-lib version 1.18.0 for the branch.

Change-Id: Ifa8346f8571dfbdcf1f4b1e2deb10b6dd2a9fa73

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-25 12:45:39.000000000', 'message': 'Allow api_version_request.matches to accept a string or None

According to the Manila devref you should be able to use the following
pattern:

if req_version.matches("2.1", "2.5"):
    ....stuff....
elif req_version.matches("2.6", "2.10"):
    ....other stuff....
elif req_version > api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("2.10"):
    ....more stuff.....

However, the api_version_request.matches() function will not accept a
string, it requires an api_version_request object.

Fix this to accept a string, as well as None for object.

Change-Id: Ic2faaaa7696cc7a647679cbb7a8600b30c3d66d7
Closes-Bug: 1550337
(cherry picked from commit 29b8358ef56160b2845d6ce6f5fd46695617bf7e)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow api_version_request.matches to accept a string or None

According to the Manila devref you should be able to use the following
pattern:

if req_version.matches("2.1", "2.5"):
    ....stuff....
elif req_version.matches("2.6", "2.10"):
    ....other stuff....
elif req_version > api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("2.10"):
    ....more stuff.....

However, the api_version_request.matches() function will not accept a
string, it requires an api_version_request object.

Fix this to accept a string, as well as None for object.

Change-Id: Ic2faaaa7696cc7a647679cbb7a8600b30c3d66d7
Closes-Bug: 1550337
(cherry picked from commit 29b8358ef56160b2845d6ce6f5fd46695617bf7e)

commit_message:
htk: merge list items with same "name" key

This patchset changes the "helm-toolkit.utils.merge" function such that
when merging lists it not only removes duplicates, but also optionally
merges any items which have the same value for the "name" key, when
passing a "merge_same_named" parameter as true.

Change-Id: I5105e3649820b41b0dbd6fb36f776bc5ad38c84d

commit_message:
Cannot remove user rule for NFS share

Use generic driver create share, then add user type access failed.
We can not use 'manila access-deny' to delete the user rule
in a NFS share db.
This path fix this issue.

Change-Id: I9375c4be9361d593102a382eb9c14c2d776bb1aa
Closes-Bug:#1591357
(cherry picked from commit 74989545065981ccf42152949f5f29566d68703c)

As the other service plugins config the extensions option in AGENT
section, so if we use devstack to deploy all-in-one env, the l3_agent

Change-Id: I90dc03cc5b072ac96249ffe3bb779d139e46401d

commit_message:
Forbid to config l3 agent if L3_AGENT_EXTENSIONS not set

As the other service plugins config the extensions option in AGENT
section, so if we use devstack to deploy all-in-one env, the l3_agent
will be configured many times(l3 service plugins counts which contain l3
extension configuration plus neutron), neutron configure it under
agent section, but others under AGENT section, so it is overrided.

This patch try to fix it in neutron side, and check if the
L3_AGENT_EXTENSIONS is not an empty string, then do it.

Change-Id: I90dc03cc5b072ac96249ffe3bb779d139e46401d
Closes-Bug: #1779978

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 15:35:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add list of all working DSCP marks

The QoS DSCP spec is not terribly specific about what DSCP marks are
valid.  This change makes it explicit.

This spec is quite old.  But since there has been no other place in the
documentation that explicitly lists what the valid DSCP marks are,
updating this in case people use it as documentation.

Change-Id: Ieec3e238b8d404e46c49b5a1a0fdaf695fff4252
Related-Bug: #1781915
'}]
commit_message:
Add list of all working DSCP marks

The QoS DSCP spec is not terribly specific about what DSCP marks are
valid.  This change makes it explicit.

This spec is quite old.  But since there has been no other place in the
documentation that explicitly lists what the valid DSCP marks are,
updating this in case people use it as documentation.

Change-Id: Ieec3e238b8d404e46c49b5a1a0fdaf695fff4252
Related-Bug: #1781915

[{'account_id': 28716, 'date': '2018-07-19 16:03:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-07-19 16:03:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2018-07-19 17:19:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Prepare Stein PTL election

Setting PTL Election. Release is at: 2018-08-30
Latest possible completion is at: 2018-08-09
Moving back to Tuesday: 2018-08-07
PTL Nominations from 2018-07-24T23:45 to 2018-07-31T23:45
PTL Election from 2018-07-31T23:45 to 2018-08-07T23:45

The date for the beginning of the queens development cycle was
approximately the beginning of RC1 week which is about when we branch.
The end of Rocky has been set to match the email deadline, which gives
the officials the week of nominations to prepare and validate rolls.

I have also removed myself as an election official for the typical
reasons.

Change-Id: I4a775c95064ea81106b906e6f0a2e0ec915ae714

commit_message:
Simplify identity endpoint

Per the Keystone Install Guide[1] the admin endpoint is superseded in
favor of a single public endpoint. Although internal goes through the
same instance, we should differentiate for project traffic and OpenStack
service traffic.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/queens/install/keystone-install-ubuntu.html#install-and-configure-components

Depends-On: Id74966d9f1279f725bc41c08e434230a7845bbc1
Change-Id: I1adb3066c83aaffe8b22f2f2553f634483371974
Implements: blueprint simplify-identity-endpoint

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 11:31:12.000000000', 'message': "[Fullstack] HA L3 agent restart only standby agents

In fullstack test which is testing if there is no packet lost
during restart of agents there were restarted always all agents
which hosted router.
In case when as first was restarted 'master' agent it might
lead to the case when after restart 'master' node was switched
to second L3 agent and that caused lost of few packets and
failed test.
This test should only check if restart of standby agents will
not cause any packet lost so this patch do it in this way.

Change-Id: I6293169d7d7f35e3a9726071e63003ac569dd01e
Closes-Bug: #1776459
(cherry picked from commit c57a5d9d8aef4a9b89e3d41c293ceb40d7ebad22)
"}]
commit_message:
[Fullstack] HA L3 agent restart only standby agents

In fullstack test which is testing if there is no packet lost
during restart of agents there were restarted always all agents
which hosted router.
In case when as first was restarted 'master' agent it might
lead to the case when after restart 'master' node was switched
to second L3 agent and that caused lost of few packets and
failed test.
This test should only check if restart of standby agents will
not cause any packet lost so this patch do it in this way.

Change-Id: I6293169d7d7f35e3a9726071e63003ac569dd01e
Closes-Bug: #1776459
(cherry picked from commit c57a5d9d8aef4a9b89e3d41c293ceb40d7ebad22)

commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I46bb0acaf1dec9bb4b91d4a2180b3e7ed66741c2

Fix some quirks in this and call out the need to actually use a
directive (something that wasn't at all obvious at first glance).

Change-Id: I7fcd49f580450e74f716fc5b388e5370deca4b04
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephen@that.guru>
"}, {'created': '2018-06-26 09:16:30.000000000', 'message': "doc: Rework everything

Basically rewrite all the documentation. The usage guide is
significantly improved, adding a detailed comparison of drivers,
features and implementations and examples for how this can actually be
used as a directive (something that wasn't at all obvious at first
glance).

We also take the opportunity to change the new-style documentation
layout.

Change-Id: I7fcd49f580450e74f716fc5b388e5370deca4b04
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephen@that.guru>
"}]
commit_message:
doc: Rework everything

Basically rewrite all the documentation. The usage guide is
significantly improved, adding a detailed comparison of drivers,
features and implementations and examples for how this can actually be
used as a directive (something that wasn't at all obvious at first
glance).

We also take the opportunity to change the new-style documentation
layout.

Change-Id: I7fcd49f580450e74f716fc5b388e5370deca4b04
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephen@that.guru>

commit_message:
Evolve project setup into a tech guidance chapter

Expand the short 'Project setup' chapter into a more complete
set of technical guidelines for projects, including pointers to
the list of base services, API guidelines...

This should be expanded in the future with other useful technical
design pointers.

Support a redirect from the old page name to the new page name.

Change-Id: Ic8e859dbe7261e15f4f6b3bcd84f31c39a8efb3c

subject: fix the calculation used for finding release history
messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-19 15:56:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-07-19 16:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nOutside verification that this fixes the issue, pushing through as others may encounter this during the deadline crunch.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 15:56:12.000000000', 'message': 'fix the calculation used for finding release history

reversed() must be passed a sequence data structure, not a generator.

We cannot slide the result of reversed() so turn it back into a list
so we can slice it.

Include all of the series starting with and including the one given so
that when it is the final series we can still include it in
calculations.

Change-Id: Idbaab36014271c7a60bec6d8a04fc69d51eb13d1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix the calculation used for finding release history

reversed() must be passed a sequence data structure, not a generator.

We cannot slide the result of reversed() so turn it back into a list
so we can slice it.

Include all of the series starting with and including the one given so
that when it is the final series we can still include it in
calculations.

Change-Id: Idbaab36014271c7a60bec6d8a04fc69d51eb13d1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-18 05:50:03.000000000', 'message': 'iSCSI volume detach after migration

In the case of live_migration if the detach or delete is performed
on iSCSI VM it fails since the BDM information is lost, so there is
no way to get the UDID value of the VM to identify the device name.
Handling this scenario by performing an additional iSCSI volume discovery
to get the volume device name so it can be disconnected.

Change-Id: I81aee924093ebcbf1e43ec8c7e330b7d4a973420
'}, {'created': '2018-06-18 07:36:32.000000000', 'message': 'iSCSI volume detach after migration

to get the volume device name so it can be disconnected.

on iSCSI VM it fails since the BDM information is lost, so there is
no way to get the UDID value of the VM to identify the device name.
Handling this scenario by performing an additional iSCSI volume discovery
to get the volume device name so it can be disconnected.

Change-Id: I81aee924093ebcbf1e43ec8c7e330b7d4a973420
'}, {'created': '2018-06-26 07:29:11.000000000', 'message': 'iSCSI volume detach after migration

In the case of live_migration if the detach or delete is performed
on iSCSI VM it fails since the BDM connection_info information is
does not have the UDID value needed by powervm to identify the
device name.
Handling this scenario by saving the BDM information during
pre_live_migration after volume discovery. Also performing an
additional iSCSI volume discovery during failback case to handle
scenarios for Onboarded VM, to get the volume device name so they
can be disconnected.

Change-Id: I81aee924093ebcbf1e43ec8c7e330b7d4a973420
'}, {'created': '2018-06-27 15:25:27.000000000', 'message': 'iSCSI volume detach with no UDID

If the UDID information is missing in the BDM connection_info
detach fails to perform, in such case re-discover the volume
on the VIOS to get the UDID of the attach volume.

Closes-Bug: 1778939
Change-Id: I81aee924093ebcbf1e43ec8c7e330b7d4a973420
'}, {'created': '2018-06-28 06:43:16.000000000', 'message': 'iSCSI volume detach with no UDID

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 21:57:45.000000000', 'message': 'Remove config option help translation

Config option help is used to generate sample config files. This
is done statically and only in English. Translation is done
dynamically at runtime by loading the translation catalogs. So
putting the _() translation around config option help creates
unnecessary work for the translators as this will never be loaded
and translated.

This removes translation markers from config option definitions.

Change-Id: I0597a5b69ef4e179324885cb35bbb72fceb2b830
'}, {'created': '2018-07-19 13:53:41.000000000', 'message': 'Remove config option help translation

Config option help is used to generate sample config files.  This
is done statically and only in English. Translation is done
dynamically at runtime by loading the translation catalogs. So
putting the _() translation around config option help creates
unnecessary work for the translators as this will never be loaded

This removes translation markers from config option definitions.

Change-Id: I0597a5b69ef4e179324885cb35bbb72fceb2b830

commit_message:
Remove config option help translation

Config option help is used to generate sample config files.  This
is done statically and only in English. Translation is done
dynamically at runtime by loading the translation catalogs. So
putting the _() translation around config option help creates
unnecessary work for the translators as this will never be loaded
and translated.

This removes translation markers from config option definitions.

Change-Id: I0597a5b69ef4e179324885cb35bbb72fceb2b830

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I04b87b308a82113a57ea41bde0329e92b07b642e

[{'created': '2018-07-13 07:30:52.000000000', 'message': "meta: don't throw KeyError on misconfigured floating IPs

When a floating IP is associated to the network port of a server with a
fixed IP that doesn't belong to the server,
`_get_supplemental_addresses()` throws a `KeyError`.

While it's most likely a misconfiguration of the floating IP, we should

Change-Id: I8093ce58dd22b901521803e878536ab4fa03141f
Task: 22974

commit_message:
meta: don't throw KeyError on misconfigured floating IPs

When a floating IP is associated to the network port of a server with a
fixed IP that doesn't belong to the server,
`_get_supplemental_addresses()` throws a `KeyError`.

While it's most likely a misconfiguration of the floating IP, we should
handle that situation gracefully.

Change-Id: I8093ce58dd22b901521803e878536ab4fa03141f
Task: 22974

> Thank you Sergii. Looks good. Please open a bug [1] for this and
 > add releasenotes [2].

As the PTL, I'm less concerned about recording a bug for this, although I'm primarily concerned about having a release note."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-03 14:56:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm hearing downstream reports that this needs to be backported as well...

If that is the case, we're definitely going to need a bug to understand how this was encountered."}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-07-04 12:07:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-07-04 12:15:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Is it worth making the number of retries a configurable option?

I have a slight concern that if the boot interface configures the boot device to PXE for only the next boot (i.e. non-persistent), that when iPXE triggers a reboot it may not reboot to try PXEing again. I think non-persistent is the default behaviour in the PXE boot interface https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/drivers/modules/pxe.py#L544-L545'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2018-07-04 13:47:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build failed. For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

- hpe-gen9-dsvm-ironic-standalone-wholedisk-uefi-ilo-virtual-media-direct http://15.184.0.52/12/578512/4/check/hpe-gen9-dsvm-ironic-standalone-wholedisk-uefi-ilo-virtual-media-direct/747457d/ : SUCCESS in 30m 04s
- hpe-gen8-dsvm-ironic-standalone-wholedisk-bios-ilo-virtual-media-iscsi http://15.184.0.52/12/578512/4/check/hpe-gen8-dsvm-ironic-standalone-wholedisk-bios-ilo-virtual-media-iscsi/f9080d4/ : SUCCESS in 29m 53s
- hpe-gen9-dsvm-ironic-standalone-wholedisk-uefi-ilo-pxe-direct http://15.184.0.52/12/578512/4/check/hpe-gen9-dsvm-ironic-standalone-wholedisk-uefi-ilo-pxe-direct/4878a0c/ : SUCCESS in 32m 28s'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-09 17:29:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Sam raises a very valid point that the default is to not persist, so if cleaning is disabled... then the possibility exists that this patch may return the nodes to an OS in the TripleO case. I don't think we can change the default for persistence because that will have negative impacts and behaviors across various types of hardware.

The backoff makes sense, what if we only rebooted if the boot mode was set to be persistent for deployments? We also can't backport new configuration as it would fall into the gray area of being a new feature.

Marking -1 as more discussion is required."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-10 13:16:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-07-10 13:56:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2018-07-10 14:09:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build failed. For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-27 18:28:59.000000000', 'message': 'Reboot server after 10 tries

Some faulty iPXE FW cannot load kernel or initrd file causing DoS on httpd
(especially when environment has hundreds of haulty nods). This patch changes
the behavior to reboot node after 10 unsuccessful retries.

Change-Id: Iec4650499c51c4c7dac38c279728d294ed3434b6
'}, {'created': '2018-06-28 00:11:24.000000000', 'message': 'Reboot server after 10 tries

Some faulty iPXE FW cannot load kernel or initrd file causing DoS on
httpd (especially when environment has hundreds of faulty nods). This
patch changes the behavior to reboot node after 10 unsuccessful retries.

Change-Id: Iec4650499c51c4c7dac38c279728d294ed3434b6
'}, {'created': '2018-06-28 18:58:58.000000000', 'message': 'Reboot server after 10 tries

'}, {'created': '2018-07-04 12:07:44.000000000', 'message': 'Reboot server after 10 tries

Some faulty iPXE FW cannot load kernel or initrd file causing DoS on

commit_message:
Poweroff server after 10 tries

Some faulty iPXE FW cannot load kernel or initrd file causing DoS on
http server (especially when environment has hundreds of faulty nods).
This patch changes the behavior to poweroff the hardware node after 10
unsuccessful retries to get kernel or initrd over http.

Story: #2002928
Task: #22915
Change-Id: Iec4650499c51c4c7dac38c279728d294ed3434b6
Co-Authored-By: Julia Kreger <juliaashleykreger@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 21:05:36.000000000', 'message': "Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- keystone_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- keystone_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I62fb8fc1390402aaee2057833c510a9827fd5292
"}]
commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- keystone_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- keystone_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I62fb8fc1390402aaee2057833c510a9827fd5292

commit_message:
Cap neutron-lib for Queens

neutron-lib 1.17.0 is not compatible with Queens Neutron because of
change I5cbe779b401e5214f414ab1c732867fdd4d75651. This patch constrains
the upper version to be less than 1.17.0 to avoid wrong installations
from PyPI.

Change-Id: I8d8eb146ea70f60f1cb1cb66bbd0b96f7ead51bf

commit_message:
Add netloc and version check for version discovery

If the url netloc in the catalog and service's response
are not the same, we should choose the catalog's and
add the version info to it if needed.

Change-Id: If78d368bd505156a5416bb9cbfaf988204925c79
Closes-bug: #1733052

commit_message:
Expand error code document to expect clarity

Based on conversation in IRC http://p.anticdent.org/282V , update
the errors guideline to be more specific about:

* using specific codes for specific cases
* adding errors is okay and not a breaking-change

Change-Id: I473918ce9c6b49c0b904e93b7140421525f4e7c0

commit_message:
Remove non-voting job from gate queue

Non-voting jobs should not be in gate queue at all, remove them.
They are just wasting resources.

Change-Id: Id8542e8a7dd7e681570f9c8c59b63b4f352c92d2

commit_message:
Add mode option to attachment-create

We introduce a mode option in attachment-create starting with
microversion 3.54.  The mode option is the new/preferred way of
setting ro mode (as opposed to admin-metadata).

This patch adds the support for the mode option to the client for
endpoints that support 3.54.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/532702/
Change-Id: I22cfddd0192c4a72b8f844f23d1fa51b96c57e06

subject: Make some test_list_projects tests work w/ pre-prov
messages: [{'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2018-07-19 16:39:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2018-07-19 16:39:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\noops forgot to copy change-id'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 16:39:03.000000000', 'message': 'Make some test_list_projects tests work w/ pre-prov

This is part 2 of 2 commits to not force dynamic creds to execute
the following tests:
  * test_list_projects
  * test_list_projects_with_name
  * test_list_projects_with_domains
so that users with a cloud using the pre-provisioned credential
provider can execute these tests.
Part 1 did some refactoring[1]

The other tests cannot be moved because they require resources to
be created explained below:
  * test_list_projects_with_parent
    - if this test requires a project with a parent then we cannot
      use pre-provisioned credentials because there is no way to
      provide an account with a parent using the current
      implementation of the pre-provisioned credential provider.
  * test_list_projects_with_enabled
    - if this test requires projects that are disabled then we
      cannot use pre-provisioned credentials because there is no
      way to provide an account that is disabled with the current
      implementation of the pre-provisioned credential provider.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583385/

Change-Id: I2c20626ede648f2bbacdcbf447762af1a2426478
'}]
commit_message:
Make some test_list_projects tests work w/ pre-prov

This is part 2 of 2 commits to not force dynamic creds to execute
the following tests:
  * test_list_projects
  * test_list_projects_with_name
  * test_list_projects_with_domains
so that users with a cloud using the pre-provisioned credential
provider can execute these tests.
Part 1 did some refactoring[1]

The other tests cannot be moved because they require resources to
be created explained below:
  * test_list_projects_with_parent
    - if this test requires a project with a parent then we cannot
      use pre-provisioned credentials because there is no way to
      provide an account with a parent using the current
      implementation of the pre-provisioned credential provider.
  * test_list_projects_with_enabled
    - if this test requires projects that are disabled then we
      cannot use pre-provisioned credentials because there is no
      way to provide an account that is disabled with the current
      implementation of the pre-provisioned credential provider.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583385/

Change-Id: I2c20626ede648f2bbacdcbf447762af1a2426478

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-03 16:32:49.000000000', 'message': "Remove tox_install.sh helper

With the move to Zuul v3 there is no need to use zuul cloner anymore and
therefore also no need to have tox_install.sh -that does not work well
with the OpenStack CI.

This patch removes the need for the helpers, adapts tox.ini to install
with pip and moves to use packages from PyPi while installing from git
the only package (ceilometer) that does not publish in PyPi.

Change-Id: I955c9d737864b8a2557366be518922e192f4be91

Use latest ODL version for jobs

All the EOL releases are archived and don't have snapshots anymore, so
use the latest released version for CI.

Change-Id: Ifbca9cc504a4351c1671bce6083b3eb04b0bed3e
Co-Authored-By: Michel Peterson <mpeterso@redhat.com>

Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more details information, please refer to:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Change-Id: Id50e29dd51d80abf34faa48ccdc7af6dea7bb0d0
