"}, {'created': '2018-07-16 21:38:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix stable/queens gate

commit [1]. Remove tox_install.sh helper

With the move to Zuul v3 there is no need to use zuul cloner anymore and
therefore also no need to have tox_install.sh -that does not work well
with the OpenStack CI.

This patch removes the need for the helpers, adapts tox.ini to install
with pip and moves to use packages from PyPi while installing from git
the only package (ceilometer) that does not publish in PyPi.

Commit [2]

Use latest ODL version for jobs

All the EOL releases are archived and don't have snapshots anymore, so
use the latest released version for CI.

commit [3]
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more details information, please refer to:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

commit_message:
Fix stable/queens gate

commit [1]. Remove tox_install.sh helper

With the move to Zuul v3 there is no need to use zuul cloner anymore and
therefore also no need to have tox_install.sh -that does not work well
with the OpenStack CI.

This patch removes the need for the helpers, adapts tox.ini to install
with pip and moves to use packages from PyPi while installing from git
the only package (ceilometer) that does not publish in PyPi.

Commit [2]

Use latest ODL version for jobs

All the EOL releases are archived and don't have snapshots anymore, so
use the latest released version for CI.

commit [3]
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more details information, please refer to:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Co-Authored-By: Michel Peterson <mpeterso@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id50e29dd51d80abf34faa48ccdc7af6dea7bb0d0

I thought we already removed this file...and I don't understand why {packages} is empty http://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#confval-install_command=ARGV

But the docs build seems to work so okay"}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-04-20 14:56:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-04-21 01:10:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 1b617cfbd14e3bdf9f507b015890d8a30635a46e'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 09:07:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the doc CI failure

CI job now uses pip >= 10.0.0 to install the package.

In pip >= 10.0.0, if the package name is missing, the command
"pip install -U" returns error, but in pip < 10.0.0 it
just logs warning.

So this patch make sure the package name exists first.

Change-Id: Id900640a7133f837ece8c6c0e7d2e4c17665a53d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the doc CI failure

CI job now uses pip >= 10.0.0 to install the package.

In pip >= 10.0.0, if the package name is missing, the command
"pip install -U" returns error, but in pip < 10.0.0 it
just logs warning.

So this patch make sure the package name exists first.

Change-Id: Id900640a7133f837ece8c6c0e7d2e4c17665a53d

commit_message:
Switch to use stestr for unit test

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
So we should switch to stestr.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I4b724692f8e8178f4372941f20579813237aed6c

commit_message:
Allow S3 credentials in data source create

Do so, in a backwards-compatible way, and not in a way with good UX.

Change-Id: I31b53c2e63ec9c28aba45aabab70a6abed1969f3

[{'created': '2018-07-13 11:41:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the cover tox target (switch to stestr)

The cover tox target was broken for a while.
Switch it to use coverage+stestr.

Patch proposed again with the wrong authorship information.
For some reason I messed up them when I first sent out
the patch, and I did not notice.
If the author would have been the one reported in
the original patch, I would have simply merged it with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571480/

Change-Id: Ie907ec3b381fcc98955c6be4280caf3b5cb220d7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the cover tox target (switch to stestr)

The cover tox target was broken for a while.
Switch it to use coverage+stestr.

Patch proposed again with the wrong authorship information.
For some reason I messed up them when I first sent out
the patch, and I did not notice.
If the author would have been the one reported in
the original patch, I would have simply merged it with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571480/

Change-Id: Ie907ec3b381fcc98955c6be4280caf3b5cb220d7

commit_message:
Add set_provision_state and wait_for_provision_state for baremetal Node

This change adds set_provision_state and wait_for_provision_state
to openstack.baremetal.v1.Node, as well as set_node_provision_state
to the bare metal Proxy. Also adds wait_for_nodes_provision_state,
which is similar to Node.wait_for_provision_state but handles several
nodes at the same time, which is important for bulk operations.

The cloud's node_set_provision_state was updated to use the new calls.
As a nice side effect, it now supports all provision states and actions
up to the Queens release, as well as does proper microversioning.

Some documentation was written for the bare metal proxy.

Change-Id: I22a76c3623f4dd2cca0b2103cbd8b853d5cebb71

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 15:43:23.000000000', 'message': "[CI] Don't set test config for API microversions if master

If the version's being bumped on manila,
the newer API changes cause test failures with
manila-tempest-plugin.

We could carefully craft a
manila-tempest-plugin changeset that fixes
any incongruous test assumptions and make the
manila change depend on the tempest changeset.
However, that may make developing the API harder
than it is today.

Change-Id: Ie97fb49b38b565dcc57332db8b42605216372aa8
Related-Bug: #1781671
"}]
commit_message:
[CI] Don't set test config for API microversions if master

If the version's being bumped on manila,
the newer API changes cause test failures with
manila-tempest-plugin.

We could carefully craft a
manila-tempest-plugin changeset that fixes
any incongruous test assumptions and make the
manila change depend on the tempest changeset.
However, that may make developing the API harder
than it is today.

Change-Id: Ie97fb49b38b565dcc57332db8b42605216372aa8
Related-Bug: #1781671

commit_message:
Implement signature generation functionality

Openstacksdk is extended with a signature generation functionality.
This adds cryptography to the requirements and lower constraints.

Change-Id: Idc15b9a12d408bd4b2e096da8402c374be56f9fa
Story: 2002128
Co-Authored-By: Markus Hentsch <markus.hentsch@secustack.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 10:19:08.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I31a783516ef06ec0a97dc3dd7a9f610f581b560c
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I31a783516ef06ec0a97dc3dd7a9f610f581b560c

subject: Use proxy/cache for pypi instead of AFS mirror
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 18:28:03.000000000', 'message': "Use proxy/cache for pypi instead of AFS mirror

We've run out of space on our PyPI mirror because apparently tensorflow
people are uploading 300M python packages. How friendly.

Set pypi_mirror in site-variables to point to the new url.

Change-Id: Iaf6eb3b82645a2e6dc59c8614cf20f0eaef9bcbf
"}]
commit_message:
Use proxy/cache for pypi instead of AFS mirror

We've run out of space on our PyPI mirror because apparently tensorflow
people are uploading 300M python packages. How friendly.

Set pypi_mirror in site-variables to point to the new url.

Change-Id: Iaf6eb3b82645a2e6dc59c8614cf20f0eaef9bcbf

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/556333/5/ : SUCCESS in 3h 19m 59s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-31 14:51:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Looks like this is breaking resize with the new flow because neutron hits an internal server error:

http://logs.openstack.org/33/556333/5/check/tempest-full/942d323/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Mar_31_01_29_36_038592

http://logs.openstack.org/33/556333/5/check/tempest-full/942d323/controller/logs/screen-q-svc.txt.gz#_Mar_31_01_29_36_029130

This is where that port's host binding is deleted:

http://logs.openstack.org/33/556333/5/check/tempest-full/942d323/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Mar_31_01_29_28_683944

But it should be only happening when tearing down networking for one of the hosts (if we're doing a resize here, we're deleting the port host binding for the source compute after confirming the resize on the dest host).

Looking at the request ID for that delete_port_binding call in the logs, it is a confirm resize:

http://logs.openstack.org/33/556333/5/check/tempest-full/942d323/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Mar_31_01_29_27_098795"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-31 14:55:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

I'm hitting an error in a resize flow where we confirm the resize and delete the source compute host port binding. We are confirming the resize here:

http://logs.openstack.org/33/556333/5/check/tempest-full/942d323/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Mar_31_01_29_27_098795

Deleting the port's host binding here:

http://logs.openstack.org/33/556333/5/check/tempest-full/942d323/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Mar_31_01_29_28_683944

And then later when the server is deleted during the test teardown, we get a 500 error from neutron:

http://logs.openstack.org/33/556333/5/check/tempest-full/942d323/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Mar_31_01_29_36_038592

http://logs.openstack.org/33/556333/5/check/tempest-full/942d323/controller/logs/screen-q-svc.txt.gz#_Mar_31_01_29_36_029130

Thinking about this, it's probably a bug in nova since this is a single-node job and we're resizing to the same host, so we deleted the sole port host binding, which is probably bad....looks like I need a check in the nova flow to see if the host binding that we're deleting is actually different from the instance's current host."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-31 15:01:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-26 01:12:47.000000000', 'message': "Delete port bindings in setup_networks_on_host if teardown=True

This change adds some logic to the neutronv2 API implementation
of setup_networks_on_host such that if teardown=True and a host
is provided, port bindings for that host and the ports attached
to the instance are deleted.

commit_message:
Delete port bindings in setup_networks_on_host if teardown=True

This change adds some logic to the neutronv2 API implementation
of setup_networks_on_host such that if teardown=True and a host
is provided (which is not the current instance.host), port
bindings, for the instance in scope, for that host are deleted.

If the port bindings don't exist, then Neutron will return a 404
which we ignore.

This will be used later in _post_live_migration and
_rollback_live_migration flows. In the post case, the live
migration was successful so the inactive port bindings on the
source host will be deleted. In the rollback case, the live
migration failed so the inactive port bindings on the destination
host will be deleted.

Part of blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

Change-Id: I588d6845c69a8cb751dc17b615884985a5c40155

commit_message:
Add "activate_port_binding" neutron API method

This method will be needed to activate the inactive
port binding for the destination host during post-live-migration.

This is based on the neutron API spec:

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/backlog/pike/portbinding_information_for_nova.html#activating-an-inactive-binding

And neutron ML2 plugin API code:

https://review.openstack.org/414251/

Part of blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-02-19 17:41:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

> (1 comment)

One more thing, most of the workers have  0 as min, and 0 means workers = num_of_processors, default = 1. 
Would be good if we maintain that consistency. In case there was any other thought, then thats ok.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-02-20 09:18:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

In cinder we don't default it to 0, we default to `None`, it's only that we check for the equivalent of `bool(value)` which is the same for 0 and None.

    cfg.IntOpt('osapi_volume_workers',
               help='Number of workers for OpenStack Volume API service. '
                    'The default is equal to the number of CPUs available.'),

And for all APIs they default to number of processors, which I think is the biggest mistake that one can make on a deployment, as I see people deploying with the default and then end up with a controller node that has 24 Cinder API workers, 24 Nova API workers, 24 Glance API workers...  And that's just wrong on too many levels: Processor consumption, message broker connections, DB connections, RAM...

So I don't want to make it easy for people to define a 0 value and set too many processes."}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-02-20 09:52:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-02-20 11:19:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Its just that it becomes easy to look up for configurable parameters in conf file.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-02-21 10:12:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Easier to find, but easier to create misunderstandings. Let's wait to hear other people's view before changing it."}, {'account_id': 24815, 'date': '2018-02-25 14:48:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 16:56:26.000000000', 'message': 'Support multiple processes on Cinder Backup

Cinder Backup has always been run as a single process, and this works
fine if the number of backups is small, but there are deployments where
a big number of backups are run simultaneously, and in such cases we
will find a bottleneck on CPU intensive operations, like compression and
SHA calculations, since we are using a single process and therefore a
single CPU core.

This patch adds support to define the number of processes we want to run
on the backup service using a new "backup_processes" configuration
option.

When running multiple processes they will all be running as children of
a parent process, but when running a single process it will run on its
own.

To preven race conditions and avoid the backup service from becoming
available before it should only the first process will do the initial
cleanup and all the others will wait on a lock until it is released by
this first process.

Change-Id: Ib43095024754a6219eb51cc0663913fac10bb642

commit_message:
Support multiple processes on Cinder Backup

Cinder Backup has always been run as a single process, and this works
fine if the number of backups is small, but there are deployments where
a big number of backups are run simultaneously, and in such cases we
will find a bottleneck on CPU intensive operations, like compression and
SHA calculations, since we are using a single process and therefore a
single CPU core.

This patch adds support to define the number of processes we want to run
on the backup service using a new "backup_processes" configuration
option.

When running multiple processes they will all be running as children of
a parent process, but when running a single process it will run on its
own.

To preven race conditions and avoid the backup service from becoming
available before it should only the first process will do the initial
cleanup and all the others will wait on a lock until it is released by
this first process.

Change-Id: Ib43095024754a6219eb51cc0663913fac10bb642

commit_message:
Migration: Stop ovn_controller in all hosts before syncing DB

Otherwise, the ovn-controllers all around, even though they are
connected to br-migration to avoid br-int manipulation at that stage
they will start sending gratuitous ARPs which will switch FIPs and
router IPs to the wrong hosts.

After the db sync operation has finished, and the configuration
has been pointed to br-int, ovn_controller container are brought back
up.

Change-Id: I323d6e56c0b9bcbb2d7810dc03b1644356de153e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 15:34:02.000000000', 'message': 'Update HostState.instances during _consume_selected_host

Change I4b67ec9dd4ce846a704d0f75ad64c41e693de0fb changed the
behavior of the ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter to rely on
HostState.instances being accurate within the same request
so that it can compare the number of group members on the same
host for filtering. Previously the filter was just checking
InstanceGroup.hosts which was updated in the
FilterScheduler._consume_selected_host method for each instance
processed in a multi-create request.

This change updates _consume_selected_host such that if we have
an instance group and an instance_uuid (which should always be
the case unless conductor is running code older than Pike), then
we update HostState.instances with the instance_uuid so the
ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter can properly compare the number of
group members against the instances on a given host in a multi-create
request.

Change-Id: Iacc636fa8a59a9e8670a8d683c10bdbb0dc8237b
Closes-Bug: #1781710
'}]
commit_message:
Update HostState.instances during _consume_selected_host

Change I4b67ec9dd4ce846a704d0f75ad64c41e693de0fb changed the
behavior of the ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter to rely on
HostState.instances being accurate within the same request
so that it can compare the number of group members on the same
host for filtering. Previously the filter was just checking
InstanceGroup.hosts which was updated in the
FilterScheduler._consume_selected_host method for each instance
processed in a multi-create request.

This change updates _consume_selected_host such that if we have
an instance group and an instance_uuid (which should always be
the case unless conductor is running code older than Pike), then
we update HostState.instances with the instance_uuid so the
ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter can properly compare the number of
group members against the instances on a given host in a multi-create
request.

Change-Id: Iacc636fa8a59a9e8670a8d683c10bdbb0dc8237b
Closes-Bug: #1781710

[{'created': '2018-07-17 02:16:54.000000000', 'message': 'Clone Zun repository by TARGET_BRANCH

The variable $TARGET_BRANCH will be set by devstack. It will point
to the right branch that the devstack is based on. For example,
if the devstack is on a stable branch, TARGET_BRANCH will point to
that stable branch. Using this variable will save us the manual
effort to update the branch whenever we cut a release.

Change-Id: If71cd66e28ca44ec2af4c6a6daaa9db74b49186b
'}]
commit_message:
Clone Zun repository by TARGET_BRANCH

The variable $TARGET_BRANCH will be set by devstack. It will point
to the right branch that the devstack is based on. For example,
if the devstack is on a stable branch, TARGET_BRANCH will point to
that stable branch. Using this variable will save us the manual
effort to update the branch whenever we cut a release.

Change-Id: If71cd66e28ca44ec2af4c6a6daaa9db74b49186b

commit_message:
Migration: Restart the right containers for the T1 DHCP update

Before we were restarting all the sidecar containers for DHCP,
this way we target only the dhcp_agent containers themselves.

Change-Id: I190f6f8ffd16bf6c01dbc4d87d81543c67795ea1

commit_message:
Mechanism driver API: responsible_for_rsc_provider

Allow mechanism manager to query drivers if they are responsible for a
resource provider or not.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/574783
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

commit_message:
Pull in ldap dependencies via ldappool

For the transition from pyldap to python-ldap, we can use ldappool
to pull in the correct variant of ldap for us. so we don't need
to depend on pyldap nor python-ldap.

This patch was previously merged but pyldap was mistakenly pulled
back in [1].

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573508/

Change-Id: I55456ea886de950cd48981b1117aa08b38e4a2ba
Co-Authored-By: Dirk Mueller <dirk@dmllr.de>

commit_message:
Fixes unlimited listener connection limit

When using the Octavia/amphora driver, unspecified or unlimited (-1)
settings would lead to a 2000 connection limit in HAproxy.
This patch updates that to be 1,000,000 connections.
1,000,000 was selected to amphora memory usage at a reasonable level.

Change-Id: Iddeb62412bb71b69cf1e9198be6131c59a3051b0
Story: 1635416
Task: 5159

commit_message:
Translate expected package names to installed ones

This patch fixes an issue that caused an internal error to the amphora
agent and led amphorae to transition to FAILURE state. The issue was
that on CentOS-based amphorae HAproxy package name is 'haproxy18' while
the expected package name is 'haproxy'.

The patch introduces a package name per distro map that is consulted
whenever a package has a different name than the one expected. If
there's a miss, it falls back to the expected package name.

Conflicts:
        octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/osutils.py
        octavia/tests/unit/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/test_osutils.py

Story: 2002958
Task: 22960

Change-Id: I59dfa3f9bd5974302ec72343444813232ec2ea02
(cherry picked from commit 1c4004c156684340406659535534abde7c6ad0e5)

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000 for "identity_uri"

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for "identity_uri".

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: I79185e6dd147bc3baa5faeb32b7824411798a170

ironic CI job patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568829/9'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-07-09 12:36:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

The WIP ironic CI job is failing with this patch during upgrade while performing the online data migrations: http://logs.openstack.org/29/568829/10/experimental/kolla-ansible-centos-binary-ironic/2765edd/primary/logs/ansible/upgrade'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-07-09 12:37:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Looks like the test found a bug: http://logs.openstack.org/29/568829/10/experimental/kolla-ansible-centos-binary-ironic/2765edd/primary/logs/docker_logs/bootstrap_ironic.txt.gz

+++ ironic-dbsync online_data_migration
usage: ironic-dbsync [-h] [--config-dir DIR] [--config-file PATH] [--debug]
                     [--log-config-append PATH]
                     [--log-date-format DATE_FORMAT] [--log-dir LOG_DIR]
                     [--log-file PATH] [--nodebug] [--nouse-journal]
                     [--nouse-json] [--nouse-syslog] [--nowatch-log-file]
                     [--syslog-log-facility SYSLOG_LOG_FACILITY]
                     [--use-journal] [--use-json] [--use-syslog] [--version]
                     [--watch-log-file]

                     {upgrade,stamp,revision,version,create_schema,online_data_migrations}
                     ...
ironic-dbsync: error: argument command: invalid choice: 'online_data_migration' (choose from 'upgrade', 'stamp', 'revision', 'version', 'create_schema', 'online_data_migrations')"}, {'account_id': 28176, 'date': '2018-07-10 01:29:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Thanks, I fixed it.'}, {'account_id': 14151, 'date': '2018-07-10 03:11:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-07-10 08:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

The ironic CI job has now passed with this change on CentOS. It always seems to fail on ubuntu.'}, {'account_id': 28176, 'date': '2018-07-13 10:16:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> The code looks good to me now. I'm not giving a +2 as we don't have
 > a resolution on the per-task serial support required to do a proper
 > rolling upgrade.
 > 
 > I have a WIP patch that a

Hi Mark Goddard, can we merge this patch set as minimal downtime upgrade? Because the rolling upgrade can be achievement if ansible strategy were merged, but it have some problem that make me can't resolve it as soon."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-07-13 18:30:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

Ok, I guess it's an improvement on where we are now, if not a true rolling upgrade.

I was thinking about this a while ago, I wonder if we could build a simple rolling upgrade functionality using etcd/tooz? We could create a semaphore-type resource and allow only restarting with the lock acquired. WDYT?"}, {'account_id': 28176, 'date': '2018-07-16 02:40:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

You mean we will using tooz to create tasks in handlers.yml become to a semaphore-resource, so with this we do not need to care about license problem, right?'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-07-16 08:46:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> You mean we will using tooz to create tasks in handlers.yml become
 > to a semaphore-resource, so with this we do not need to care about
 > license problem, right?

It's just an idea at the moment, and no doubt has some issues.

It could be done by modifying the kolla_docker module to use toox talk to e.g. etcd. The problem with this approach is that is assumes access to etcd from all hosts, which might not be true e.g. for compute nodes.

Another alternative is to use an Ansible action plugin. This would perform the synchronisation required, possibly even just using something simple like file locks or IPC on localhost, then execute the kolla_docker module when it is safe to do so.

If licensing is the problem blocking merging the strategy plugin, could we somehow package it separately, either as a role, or a python package?"}, {'account_id': 28176, 'date': '2018-07-16 09:50:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Oh yes, Thanks for your suggestion, i think i will continue following duonghq's patch set https://review.openstack.org/#/c/482863 to create an Ansible module in separate project, as the result from Kolla IRC meeting at http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/kolla/2017/kolla.2017-08-02-15.59.log.html#l-78"}, {'account_id': 28176, 'date': '2018-07-17 03:05:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-07-17 08:58:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-07-18 09:34:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-07-19 11:24:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Don't allow legacy and native flask to share paths

When a path-prefix is moved to flask native dispatching, no longer
allow that path prefix to be registered with the legacy dispatch
middleware. This will ensure the entire Keystone path is moved
and prevent bad behavior due to both dispatchers needing ot handle
a URL.

Change-Id: Ice800abf80a725349d6450b742a2c48238e11e6e
Partial-Bug: #1776504

commit_message:
bionic: Remove python-software-properties

python-software-properties is deprecated in favor of software-properties-common
on Bionic.

Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree
Reading state information... Done
Package python-software-properties is not available, but is referred to by another package.
This may mean that the package is missing, has been obsoleted, or
is only available from another source
However the following packages replace it:
  software-properties-common

E: Package 'python-software-properties' has no installation candidate

Change-Id: I7a3c45ece08daff6a5bffe3f949835f31035a7cd

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 10:21:30.000000000', 'message': "Ensure the fallback uses the same install method

We have a test to ensure the install method of pip is from distro
or get-pip. But if an issue appeared in the first task, the
fallback method will automatically fallback to get-pip instead
of fallback to the isolated version of the pre-defined CLI.

This should ensure consistency by not using get-pip if it's not
needed.

Change-Id: I7aa4056ffb9bc2162f0960e74b6458bcbffa141f
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure the fallback uses the same install method

We have a test to ensure the install method of pip is from distro
or get-pip. But if an issue appeared in the first task, the
fallback method will automatically fallback to get-pip instead
of fallback to the isolated version of the pre-defined CLI.

This should ensure consistency by not using get-pip if it's not
needed.

Change-Id: I7aa4056ffb9bc2162f0960e74b6458bcbffa141f

Add document and scripts for testing NS features

1. This patch update document nsd_usage_guide.rst about
supporting VNFFG in NSD template.
2. Add some scripts for users to create network service
automatically.

Partially-implements: blueprint vnffg-ns

commit_message:
Update get-pip to version 3.3

Version 3.2 has a bug with it on some systems that can result in the
following stacktrace: [ http://paste.openstack.org/show/726064 ]. To
correct this issue the version of the get-pip script has been set to 3.3
which does not suffer from the same issue.

Change-Id: Iaddb390a13d1955356e85af11ab087319808697c
Closes-Bug: #1779534

commit_message:
Fix package version querying on non-dpkg distros

Non-Debian based amphora agents raise internal server error when
querying for a package version. That is due to the fact that the agent
currently assumes dpkg-based distros ignoring other OS families such as
Red Hat, SUSE, etc where the output from package info querying output is
slightly different from dpkg.

Story: 2002961
Task: 22963

Change-Id: Ied37bb0191ca8af4966d097f47ec80536dfc843f

[{'created': '2018-07-12 12:36:57.000000000', 'message': "Translate expected package names to installed ones

This patch fixes an issue that caused an internal error to the amphora
agent and led amphorae to transition to FAILURE state. The issue was
taht CentOS-based amphorae install package 'haproxy18' while the
expected package name is 'haproxy'.

The patch introduces a package name per distro class that is consulted
whenever a package has a different name than the one expected. If
there's a miss, it falls back to the expected package name.

Story: 2002958
Task: 22960

commit_message:
Translate expected package names to installed ones

This patch fixes an issue that caused an internal error to the amphora
agent and led amphorae to transition to FAILURE state. The issue was
that on CentOS-based amphorae HAproxy package name is 'haproxy18' while
the expected package name is 'haproxy'.

The patch introduces a package name per distro map that is consulted
whenever a package has a different name than the one expected. If
there's a miss, it falls back to the expected package name.

Story: 2002958
Task: 22960

Change-Id: I59dfa3f9bd5974302ec72343444813232ec2ea02

commit_message:
Release openstack-dev/bashate as independent release

openstack-dev/bashate has lot of updates mostly doc and
coding style since last tag 0.5.1 which happened 2 years back.

This commit
- adds the bashate as independent release model
- release 0.6.0

Remove the redundant codses

The django form field default is "required=True", so this patch
remove the redundant "required=True" in the forms.

Change-Id: I4cd4bc58976fee2a9c0521311f216294c09c36e4

commit_message:
move the process document into the published reference guide

Move our process document into the reference guide published on the
website so it is easier to provide folks with links to explain the
various stages of the cycle.

Adding the new page also requires fixing up some RST warnings so
Sphinx would run properly, and fixing some markup so the rendered page
looked OK.

Change-Id: If6280b60b8802d3908c233a30547ec442cb2804e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use configured endpoint instead of hardcoded ones

Usage of public endpoints was hardcoded
- for the Heat client
- in a test for the Zaqar client
- when checking if a service is available

A test also required Heat to be configured to use public endpoints when
talking to services. This test is more relaxed now.

Change-Id: I3784e126d28a51d990702e1b9e6bf23f0447fa21

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Iebd6f34335e4ef0dd3629e970661d8c9ef08754a

commit_message:
rate limit iptables logging

We currently have the following rule in the post firewall section of our puppet code:

tripleo::firewall::rule{ '998 log all':
  proto => 'all',
  jump => 'LOG',
}

The problem is that with this rule we log every single packet which is rather suboptimal:
Jul 10 05:05:03 overcloud-controller-1 kernel: IN=vlan20 OUT= MAC=1a:1a:0a:72:8a:0c:ba:ac:11:55:28:28:08:00 SRC=172.16.2.10 DST=172.16.2.14 LEN=228 TOS=0x00 PREC=0x00 TTL=64 ID=59388 DF PROTO=UDP SPT=43036 DPT=5405 LEN=208
Jul 10 05:05:03 overcloud-controller-1 kernel: IN=vlan20 OUT= MAC=1a:1a:0a:72:8a:0c:ba:ac:11:55:28:28:08:00 SRC=172.16.2.10 DST=172.16.2.14 LEN=228 TOS=0x00 PREC=0x00 TTL=64 ID=59391 DF PROTO=UDP SPT=43036 DPT=5405 LEN=208
Jul 10 05:05:03 overcloud-controller-1 kernel: IN=vlan20 OUT= MAC=1a:1a:0a:72:8a:0c:ba:ac:11:55:28:28:08:00 SRC=172.16.2.10 DST=172.16.2.14 LEN=228 TOS=0x00 PREC=0x00 TTL=64 ID=59392 DF PROTO=UDP SPT=43036 DPT=5405 LEN=208
...

(undercloud) [stack@undercloud stonith-scalingup-issue]$ grep IN=vlan20 sosreport-overcloud-controller-1-20180710070209/var/log/messages |wc -l
8682

Let's start by ratelimiting this to a burst of 15 messages
and 20 messages per minute. According to [1] this means that
we will have 15 messages logged before the 20 messages per minute
limit kicks in.
Let's also add a parameter so that an operator can override this
in case the defaults are not suitable for her/him.

[1] https://netfilter.org/documentation/HOWTO/packet-filtering-HOWTO-7.html

Change-Id: Ie8fe28e582bdcf51b819d5ca7f979b0a21597768
Closes-Bug: #1781171

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 12:48:59.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7ff2c75c76c22554fef8f3521db182065fd5295a
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7ff2c75c76c22554fef8f3521db182065fd5295a

commit_message:
Adding some missing negative tests in test_servers_negative.py

There are some negative tests which are missing
from test_servers_negative.py
This patch will add tests for the server to boost
the confidence level for nova server.
It will check creating, updating and deleting the
server is handling properly with negative values

Change-Id: Ic691c22701a1d945dbf3e8d639db38b15693e58f

commit_message:
VNFFG support for Network Service Descriptor

This spec describes the plan to add VNFFG support in tacker for
network service.

Blueprint: vnffg-ns

Co-Authored-By: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Yan Xing an <yanxingan@cmss.chinamobile.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dharmendra Kushwaha <dharmendra.kushwaha@india.nec.com>
Co-Authored-By: Trinh Nguyen <dangtrinhnt@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Cong Phuoc Hoang <hoangphuocbk2.07@gmail.com>

Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ibefb340ca8e180e9a4f7b3b38a57438e74278f77

commit_message:
Apply Swift rolling upgrade

Apply Swift rolling upgrade based on recommendations from Swift PTL John
Dickinson at [1]

[1]https://www.swiftstack.com/blog/2013/12/20/upgrade-openstack-swift-no-downtime/

Co-Authored-By: Duong Ha-Quang <duonghq@vn.fujitsu.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ha Manh Dong <donghm@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: Ic59a2d2dda3469af5d4259e020d22b619ff7d603
Implements: blueprint apply-service-upgrade-procedure

Ricardo, Peng: I had to add requests-mock to test-requirements, how should make accepted by zuul/requirements-check?'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2018-07-17 11:34:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2018-07-17 11:35:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Ricardo, Peng: I hope I found it.
Could you suggest what kind of documentation should I add?'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-07-17 12:57:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Ricardo, Peng: I hope I found it.
 > Could you suggest what kind of documentation should I add?

Hey Lajos! I'm back from PTO. I'll have an exhaustive look to the patch, but first of all, thanks a lot for your contribution. 
The documentation I'm expecting should be something simple, explaining the syntax of the new commands, or some kind of correspondence like:

neutron l2-gateway-list -> openstack l2gw list

with some details on the parameters.

The release notes are included via reno:

https://docs.openstack.org/reno/latest/"}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2018-07-18 06:12:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck openstack-tox-lower-constraints'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-07-18 08:34:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

The code looks pretty good to me. The unit tests match the l2gw client extension for neutronclient and they're even more organized in classes. Good job Lajos!! The feature freeze for Rocky is next week, so we have some days to get the documentation and release notes in. Once you upload that, I'll merge it."}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2018-07-18 13:48:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2018-07-18 13:50:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Ricardo: I added these osc commands to usage.rst, is that enough as documentation?
I can't find releasenotes....."}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2018-07-19 07:26:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck openstack-tox-py35'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-07-19 08:19:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add networking-l2gw OSC commands

Instead of the neutron commands in the form neutron l2-gateway-<command>
and neutron l2-gateway-connection-<command> introduce the osc form:
openstack l2gw <command> and openstack l2gw connection <command>.

Change-Id: I3ad1c6fdde9c3cfc8732680f130fbd6420d98c53

(3) Modify NSD updation functionality with the ability to update
    VNFFG
(4) Write docs for VNFFG-NS
(5) Add devref

'}, {'created': '2018-06-27 08:49:13.000000000', 'message': 'Implement VNFFG support for NS

This patch will add VNFFG support for NS. In NSD, users can
describe VNFDs and nested VNFFGD inside. When NS is created,
VNFs and VNFFG are also created too.

Work items of this patch:
1. Add sample nsd templates
2. Update NFVO plugin to adapt VNFFGD template extraction
    from NSD and create VNFFG using that template
3. Modify Mistral workflow to create/delete VNFFG using NSD

User guide, defref will be added in following patches.

Co-Authored-By: Cong Phuoc Hoang <hoangphuocbk2.07@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Id5827e66aec0231bf27e87fc96d8fc6bc5cb9c26
Partially-implements: blueprint vnffg-ns

commit_message:
Implement VNFFG support for NS

This patch will add VNFFG support for NS. In NSD, users can
describe VNFDs and nested VNFFGDs inside. When NS is created,
VNFs and VNFFGs are also created too.

Work items of this patch:
1. Add sample nsd templates
2. Update NFVO plugin to adapt VNFFGD template extraction
    from NSD and create VNFFGs using that template
3. Modify Mistral workflow to create/delete VNFFGs using NSD

User guide, defref will be added in following patches.

Co-Authored-By: Cong Phuoc Hoang <hoangphuocbk2.07@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Id5827e66aec0231bf27e87fc96d8fc6bc5cb9c26
Partially-implements: blueprint vnffg-ns

commit_message:
[contrib] Update heading markup to follow what most projects do

Based on the discussion from:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579177/

Make the convention consistent with what other OpenStack projects
do and with recommendations from:
http://docutils.sourceforge.net/docs/user/rst/quickstart.html#sections

Change-Id: I33628180430357dbdc14b7775aa3a5307bb93291

[4]: https://review.openstack.org/583889"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 09:24:05.000000000', 'message': "Avoid os.getpgrp, breaking Windows c-backup support

A recent change introduced a regression, breaking Cinder Backup
support for Windows. It uses os.getpgrp, which isn't available on
Windows, using the process group as part of a lock name.

This lock ensures that only one of the cinder backup workers will
cleanup incomplete backups. It should be safe to just drop the
process group from the lock name, fixing this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1781168

Change-Id: I01edb5cd757a08b1b371e20ce5fa42fee888bbfb
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid os.getpgrp, breaking Windows c-backup support

A recent change introduced a regression, breaking Cinder Backup
support for Windows. It uses os.getpgrp, which isn't available on
Windows, using the process group as part of a lock name.

This lock ensures that only one of the cinder backup workers will
cleanup incomplete backups. It should be safe to just drop the
process group from the lock name, fixing this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1781168

Change-Id: I01edb5cd757a08b1b371e20ce5fa42fee888bbfb

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I27549a10209a45750e6294fc38b4ef6339752f89

that is loaded dynamically and wire it properly.

commit_message:
Added required defaults, env example, Manage LB hook

I've decided to add env and required secrets example for easier stratup.
Also added missing variables to defaults, as playbook was just failiing without them.
Variables regarding rabbitmq were missing.
Also, as masakari_venv_download_url is not defined by default,
masakari_venv_download had been set to false.

Handlers were missing Manage LB task and had wrong variable -
masakari-services instead of masakari_services

Functional test was missing USER system environment variable.
Also test inventory had mistakes.

test-masakari-functions.yml wasn't able to pass test due to error.
Functional tests moved to voting.

Change-Id: I6644d576177f441ca59e9221ce9a2e5b7cc0fc46

commit_message:
Adding identity ng-groups delete action

This patch adds angular groups delete action.

To be added in subsequent patches:
 - Edit, manage members action

Parent patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/480426/

To Test
 - set 'groups_panel': True in settings.py
 - enable keystone v3 in local_settings.py

Change-Id: I9b1265d3f2efe941cbf34407f1fc06b69f86a2a8
Implements: blueprint ng-groups-actions
Co-Authored-By: Shu Muto <shu.mutow@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Adding identity ng-groups create action

This patch adds angular groups create action.

To be added in subsequent patches:
 - Delete, edit, manage members action

To Test
 - set 'groups_panel': True in settings.py
 - enable keystone v3 in local_settings.py

Co-Authored-By: Shu Muto <shu.mutow@gmail.com>

Change-Id: If072ef89dab7aeccef8988d165d687621f1edb7c
Implements: blueprint ng-groups-actions

subject: Fix instructions for opting in to V-72115
messages:
[{'account_id': 28457, 'date': '2018-06-12 18:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-12 18:15:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-06-15 08:54:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-19 07:31:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 18:15:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix instructions for opting in to V-72115

The docs previously specified that the wrong boolean value should be set
in order to opt-in to control V-72115. The variable
security_rhel7_audit_lsetxattr has a value of no by default.

Change-Id: I2701ada847404a629de44a548ace2f5e9424638d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix instructions for opting in to V-72115

The docs previously specified that the wrong boolean value should be set
in order to opt-in to control V-72115. The variable
security_rhel7_audit_lsetxattr has a value of no by default.

Change-Id: I2701ada847404a629de44a548ace2f5e9424638d

subject: Prevent triggerring firewall actions in init_bundle
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8745, 'name': 'Lars Kellogg-Stedman', 'email': 'lars@redhat.com', 'username': 'lars'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 20778, 'name': 'Damien Ciabrini', 'email': 'dciabrin@redhat.com', 'username': 'dciabrin'}, {'_account_id': 21129, 'name': 'Alan Bishop', 'email': 'abishop@redhat.com', 'username': 'ASBishop'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-07-11 13:16:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-07-11 13:19:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This review aims at fixing the problem discussed in Ia63cd0817eae24d1ea8271465f988b364fc53c66.
I'm currently trying to validate it locally with the proper deployment flags"}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-07-11 13:30:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Looks good, and will happily +2 if your local test confirms this resolves the problem.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-07-11 14:24:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-07-19 07:20:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

After some initial tests, it appears we can't noop the firewall resources like we do for haproxy, because stonithxvm make use of specific providers...
I'm abandonning this review in favour of I595f8bc22e76868b7dace400667d53f3c4565248 which achieves the same thing in a different manner."}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-07-19 07:20:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 13:16:48.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent triggerring firewall actions in init_bundle

transient containers for *_init_bundle run puppet manifests
responsible for creating the HA resources in the pacemaker cluster.

When *_init_bundle is being run at step 5 or above, the puppet
manifest for stonith is being run automatically, and depending on the
fencing configuration, this can transitively include puppet manifest
for firewall management, which would unexpectedly call iptables, which
is forbidden in those containers.

Ensure that no firewall resource can lead to call to iptables, by
noop-ing firewall resource on the impacted *_init_bundles, like we did
in [1].

This is safe because the firewall rules needed for the fencing
configuration are still created when puppet is executed on the host at
step 5.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/docker/services/pacemaker/haproxy.yaml#L160

Change-Id: Iade593bfa6bceb78b77ccc98873663b5bd9acdbe
Related: rhbz#1598904
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent triggerring firewall actions in init_bundle

transient containers for *_init_bundle run puppet manifests
responsible for creating the HA resources in the pacemaker cluster.

When *_init_bundle is being run at step 5 or above, the puppet
manifest for stonith is being run automatically, and depending on the
fencing configuration, this can transitively include puppet manifest
for firewall management, which would unexpectedly call iptables, which
is forbidden in those containers.

Ensure that no firewall resource can lead to call to iptables, by
noop-ing firewall resource on the impacted *_init_bundles, like we did
in [1].

This is safe because the firewall rules needed for the fencing
configuration are still created when puppet is executed on the host at
step 5.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/docker/services/pacemaker/haproxy.yaml#L160

Change-Id: Iade593bfa6bceb78b77ccc98873663b5bd9acdbe
Related: rhbz#1598904

commit_message:
Reload OSD when AppArmor policies are changed

When AppArmor profiles are updated, the OSD processes need to be
restarted as well to make the new polocy effective.
Policy files can change on charm upgrade.

Change-Id: Ib0dbcfd11949451e3abc0b2b7477a5f474bae234
Partial-Bug: 1755823

messages: [{'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-07-18 16:03:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-07-19 05:41:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-07-19 06:18:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nThis could life in-repo as well.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 16:03:52.000000000', 'message': "Gate governance with project-config

To avoid the potential to typo new project names in governance, we're
adding a linter to the governance repo to ensure the project exists in
project-config[1]. Add project-config as a required project for the
governance linters job so that new projects need not wait for the
project-config patch to merge before the governance patch can pass
tests.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/583637

Change-Id: I8be9eae083ad2b1e9387704e064d104b196a0d1b
"}]
commit_message:
Gate governance with project-config

To avoid the potential to typo new project names in governance, we're
adding a linter to the governance repo to ensure the project exists in
project-config[1]. Add project-config as a required project for the
governance linters job so that new projects need not wait for the
project-config patch to merge before the governance patch can pass
tests.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/583637

Change-Id: I8be9eae083ad2b1e9387704e064d104b196a0d1b

commit_message:
Fix some incorrect unit test case

For test cases that verify input cpu/memory/disk value, it should
not pass 'run=xyz' since this is an invalid input for 'run'.
In those test cases, we should use a valid input for 'run'.

Change-Id: I43e9995add677d40def2dec6921291cd22bcd97d

commit_message:
Switch to use stestr for unit test

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
So we should switch to stestr.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Id56b915767fcf0a503a62891bf43d6b827f9a46c
